Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207 Registration by provisional ballot.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(1): (6); 20A-3a-601 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(1)(a): the individual is otherwise legally entitled to vote the ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(1)(b): the ballot is identical to the ballot for the precinct in which the individual resides;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(1)(c): the information on the provisional ballot form is complete; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(1)(d): the individual provides valid voter identification and proof of residence to the poll worker.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(2): (1) If a provisional ballot and the individual who voted the ballot comply with the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(2)(a): consider the provisional ballot a voter registration form;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(2)(b): place the ballot with the other ballots, to be counted with those ballots at the canvass; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(2)(c): as soon as reasonably possible, register the individual to vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(3): (4); 20A-4-202 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(3)(a): is not registered to vote and is not eligible for registration under this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(3)(b): is not legally entitled to vote the ballot that the individual voted.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(4): (3) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5): (5)(a); 20A-3a-601 The lieutenant governor shall report to the Government Operations Interim Committee on or before October 31, 2020, regarding:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5)(a): implementation of registration by provisional ballot, as described in this section, on a statewide basis;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5)(b): (5)(a) any difficulties resulting from the implementation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5)(c): the effect of registration by provisional ballot on voter participation in Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5)(d): 20A-3a-601 the number of ballots cast by voters who registered by provisional ballot:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5)(d)(i): 20A-3a-601 during the early voting period described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5)(d)(ii): on election day; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(5)(e): suggested changes in the law relating to registration by provisional ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(6): For an election administered by an election officer other than a county clerk:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(6)(a): if the election officer does not operate a polling place to allow early voting, the individual may not register to vote, under this section, during an early voting period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-207(6)(b): if the election officer does not operate a polling place on election day, the individual may not register to vote, under this section, on election day.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.5 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.5(1): "Discretionary voter registration agency" means each office designated by the county clerk to provide voter registration forms to the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.5(2): "Public assistance agency" means each office in Utah that provides:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.5(2)(a): public assistance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.5(2)(b): state funded programs primarily engaged in providing services to people with disabilities.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.6 Voter registration activities -- Coordination among local, state, and federal officials.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The lieutenant governor shall:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.6(1): oversee, manage, and coordinate all voter registration activities in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-300.6(2): coordinate with local, state, and federal officials to ensure compliance with state and federal election laws.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301 County clerk responsibilities -- Voter registration forms.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(1): Each county clerk shall provide voter registration forms for use in the voter registration process.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(2): 20A-2-302
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(2)(a): Each county clerk shall provide a copy of the voter registration form to each public assistance agency and discretionary voter registration agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(2)(b): 20A-2-302 Each county clerk may provide a copy of the voter registration form to public school districts and nonpublic schools as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(3)(a): The clerk shall make a copy of the voter registration form available to any person upon request.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(3)(b): A person may make multiple copies of the voter registration form at the person's own expense.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(3)(c): A person shall provide all completed voter registration forms in the person's possession to the county clerk at or before 5 p.m. on the day of the voter registration deadline.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(4): The county clerk may not refuse to register an individual to vote for failing to provide a telephone number on the voter registration form.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(5): (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(5)(a): It is unlawful for any person in possession of a completed voter registration form, other than the person's own completed voter registration form, to willfully fail or refuse to timely deliver the completed voter registration form to the county clerk.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-301(5)(b): (5) A person who violates this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302 Voter registration forms for high school students.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(1): 20A-2-101.1
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(1)(a): A county clerk may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(1)(a)(i): contact each high school and each accredited nonpublic high school in the county;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(1)(a)(ii): determine the number of high school seniors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(1)(a)(iii): distribute voter registration forms to each accredited public or private high school in an amount sufficient for distribution to each high school senior.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(1)(b): 20A-2-101.1 The county clerk shall process a voter registration form received from an individual under this section in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(2): Each public school and accredited nonpublic school may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(2)(a): include the voter registration form in the senior registration packet; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-302(2)(b): collect and forward completed voter registration forms to the county clerk.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304 County clerk's responsibilities -- Notice of disposition.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each county clerk shall:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(1): 20A-2-204 register to vote each individual who meets the requirements for registration and who:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(1)(a): submits a completed voter registration form to the county clerk;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(1)(b): 20A-2-204 submits a completed voter registration form, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(1)(c): submits a completed voter registration form to a public assistance agency or a discretionary voter registration agency; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(1)(d): mails a completed voter registration form to the county clerk; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2): 20A-3a-401.5 within 30 days after the day on which the county clerk processes a voter registration form, send a notice to the individual who submits the form that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(a): 20A-3a-401.5
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(a)(i): informs the individual that the individual's voter registration form has been accepted and that the individual is registered to vote;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(a)(ii): informs the individual of the procedure for designating or changing the individual's political affiliation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(a)(iii): informs the individual of the procedure to cancel a voter registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(a)(iv): 20A-3a-401.5 provides instructions to the voter on how the voter may sign up to receive electronic ballot status notifications via the ballot tracking system described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(a)(v): confirms that the individual has chosen to receive electronic ballot status notifications if the individual opted to receive electronic ballot status notifications on the voter registration form;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(b): informs the individual that the individual's voter registration form has been rejected and the reason for the rejection; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(c)(i): informs the individual that the individual's voter registration form is being returned to the individual for further action because the form is incomplete; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-304(2)(c)(ii): gives instructions to the individual on how to properly complete the form.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307 County clerks' instructions to election judges.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307(1): Each county clerk shall instruct election judges to allow a voter to vote a regular ballot if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307(1)(a): the voter has moved from one address within a county to another address within the same county; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307(1)(b): the voter affirms the change of address orally or in writing before the election judges.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307(2): 20A-2-207; 20A-3a-803 Each county clerk shall instruct election judges to allow an individual to vote a provisional ballot if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307(2)(a): 20A-2-207 the individual is not registered to vote, but is otherwise legally entitled to vote under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307(2)(b): the voter's name does not appear on the official register; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-307(2)(c): 20A-3a-803 the voter is challenged as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401 Fraudulent registration -- Penalty.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401(1): 20A-2-101; 20A-2-101
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401(1)(a): 20A-2-101 An individual may not willfully register to vote, or cause, procure, or allow himself or herself to be registered to vote, knowing that the individual is not eligible to register to vote under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401(1)(b): 20A-2-101 A person may not willfully cause, procure, advise, encourage, or assist any individual to be registered to vote, knowing or believing that the individual is not eligible to register to vote under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401(2): 20A-2-101.1; 20A-2-101.1
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401(2)(a): 20A-2-101.1 An individual may not willfully preregister to vote, or allow himself or herself to be preregistered to vote, knowing that the individual is not eligible to preregister to vote under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401(2)(b): 20A-2-101.1 A person may not willfully cause, advise, encourage, or assist an individual to preregister to vote, knowing or believing that the individual is not eligible to preregister to vote under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-401(3): A person who violates this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(1): 20A-2-504 "Annual maintenance utility" means a tool within the system that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(1)(a): 20A-2-504 is designed to comply with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(1)(b): a county clerk is required to run on an annual basis; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(1)(c): identifies each inactive voter and each voter to be removed from the voter registration database.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(2): 20A-2-502(1)(a); 63G-2-103 "Database" means the statewide voter registration database, described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(2)(a): is maintained and updated via the system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(2)(b): 63G-2-103 uses information relative to voter registration and voting, including information that is obtained from a voter, a governmental entity, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(3): "Duplicate voter utility" means a tool within the system that runs a set of queries to identify potential duplicate voter records.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(4): 20A-2-502(1)(a) "System" means the statewide voter registration system described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-501(5): "Voter identification verification tool" means a tool within the system that compares data in a voter registration record to Driver License Division data and Social Security Administration data to verify voter identification.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504 Removing names from the official register -- General requirements.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(1): The county clerk may not remove a voter's name from the official register solely because the voter has failed to vote in an election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2): (3); 20A-2-505; 20A-2-505; 20A-2-505; 20A-2-101.3; 20A-2-101.5 The county clerk shall remove a voter's name from the official register if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(a): (3) the voter dies and the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(b): 20A-2-505 the county clerk, after complying with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(c): 20A-2-505; 20A-2-505
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(c)(i): the county clerk obtains evidence that the voter's residence has changed;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(c)(ii): 20A-2-505 the county clerk mails notice to the voter as required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(c)(iii): the county clerk:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(c)(iii)(A): receives no response from the voter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(c)(iii)(B): does not receive information that confirms the voter's residence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(c)(iv): 20A-2-505 the voter does not vote or appear to vote in an election during the period beginning on the date of the notice described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(d): the voter requests, in writing, that the voter's name be removed from the official register;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(e): 20A-2-101.3; 20A-2-101.5 the county clerk receives notice that a voter has been convicted of any felony or a misdemeanor for an offense under this title and the voter's right to vote has not been restored as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(2)(f): the county clerk receives notice that a voter has registered to vote in another state after the day on which the voter registered to vote in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-504(3): The county clerk shall remove a voter's name from the  official register within five business days after the day on which the county clerk receives  confirmation from the Office of Vital Records that the voter is deceased.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506 Lieutenant governor and county clerks to preserve records.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(1)(a): "Voter registration record" means a record concerning the implementation of programs and activities conducted for the purpose of ensuring that the official register is accurate and current.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(1)(b): "Voter registration record" does not include a record that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(1)(b)(i): relates to a person's decision to decline to register to vote; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(1)(b)(ii): identifies the particular public assistance agency, discretionary voter registration agency, or Driver License Division through which a particular voter registered to vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(2): 20A-2-505; 63G-2-302; (2)(b) The lieutenant governor and each county clerk shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(2)(a): 20A-2-505 preserve for at least two years all records relating to voter registration, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(2)(a)(i): the official register; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(2)(a)(ii): 20A-2-505 the name and address of each individual to whom the notice required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(2)(b): 63G-2-302 make a voter registration record available for public inspection, except for a voter registration record, or part of a voter registration record that is classified as private under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(2)(c): (2)(b) allow a record or part of a record described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(3): 20A-2-102.5(2)(a) The lieutenant governor shall take, and store for at least 22 months, a static copy of the official register made at the following times:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(3)(a): 20A-2-102.5(2)(a) the voter registration deadline described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(3)(b): the day of the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-506(3)(c): the last day of the canvass.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-507 Rulemaking authority relating to voter registration records.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The director of elections within the Office of the Lieutenant Governor shall make rules, in accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 20A-2-507(1): to regulate the use, security, maintenance, data entry, and update of the system;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-507(2): 20A-2-502(4) establishing duties and deadlines for a county clerk to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-507(2)(a): ensure that the database is updated, accurate, and secure; and

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-507(3)(a): running the utilities and tools in the system;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-507(3)(b): actions that the county clerk is required to take in response to the matters identified, or the results produced, from running the utilities and tools; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-2-507(3)(c): documenting and reporting compliance with the requirements of this part and rules made under this section.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 20A - Chapter 3a - Voting
*****************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
This chapter is known as "Voting."

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102 Residency and age requirements of voters.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102(1): Chapter 2, Voter Registration An individual may vote in any regular general election or statewide special election if that individual has registered to vote in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102(2): Chapter 2, Voter Registration An individual may vote in the presidential primary election or a regular primary election if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102(2)(a): Chapter 2, Voter Registration that individual has registered to vote in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102(2)(b): that individual's political party affiliation, or unaffiliated status, allows the person to vote in the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102(3): Chapter 2, Voter Registration An individual may vote in a municipal general election, municipal primary election, local special election, special district election, and bond election if that individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102(3)(a): Chapter 2, Voter Registration has registered to vote in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-102(3)(b): is a resident of a voting district or precinct within the local entity that is holding the election.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-103 Age requirements for primary elections -- 17-year-olds may vote.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An individual who is 17 years of age may vote in a regular primary election, a municipal primary election, or a presidential primary election, if:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-103(1): the individual will be 18 years of age on or before the day of the general election that immediately follows the regular primary election, municipal primary election, or presidential primary election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-103(2): Chapter 2, Voter Registration the individual is registered to vote in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-103(3): the individual's political party affiliation, or unaffiliated status, allows the individual to vote in the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-103(4): the individual otherwise complies with the requirements to vote in the primary election.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-104 Voting by secret ballot.
---------------------------------------------------------
All voting at each regular and municipal general election, at each statewide or local special election, at each primary election, at each special district election, and at each bond election shall be by secret ballot.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105 Employee's right to time off for election.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(1)(a): Each employer shall allow any voter to be absent from service or employment on election day for not more than two hours between the time the polls open and close.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(1)(b): The voter shall apply for a leave of absence before election day.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(1)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(1)(c)(i): The employer may specify the hours during which the employee may be absent.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(1)(c)(ii): If the employee requests the leave of absence at the beginning or end of the work shift, the employer shall grant that request.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(1)(d): The employer may not deduct from an employee's usual salary or wages because of the absence.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(2): This section does not apply to an employee who has three or more hours between the time polls open and close during which the employee is not employed on the job.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-105(3): Any employer who violates this section is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-106 Rulemaking authority relating to conducting an election.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The director of elections, within the Office of the Lieutenant Governor, may make rules, in accordance withUtah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-106(1): 20A-3a-202(4) a return envelope described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-106(2): 20A-3a-402.5 complying with the signature comparison audit requirements described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-106(3): 20A-3a-401(7)(b) conducting and documenting the identity verification process described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201 Voting methods.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(1): 20A-7-609.5; 20A-16-102; Part 3, Emergency Ballots Except for an election conducted entirely by mail under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(1)(a): by mail;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(1)(b): at a polling place during early voting hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(1)(c): at a polling place on election day when the polls are open;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(1)(d): if the voter is an individual with a disability, by voting remotely, via a mechanical ballot or via electronic means if approved by the election officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(1)(e): 20A-16-102 electronically or via a federal write-in absentee ballot if the voter is a covered voter, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(1)(f): Part 3, Emergency Ballots by emergency ballot, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-201(2): (1)(d); (f) A voter may not vote at a polling place if the voter voted by mail or in a manner described in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202 Conducting election by mail.
-------------------------------------------------------------
"County of ____State of ____Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(1): 20A-7-609.5
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(1)(a): 20A-7-609.5 Except as otherwise provided for an election conducted entirely by mail under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(1)(b): An individual who did not provide valid voter identification at the time the voter registered to vote shall provide valid voter identification before voting.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2): (3); 20A-3a-401.5; (9)(c)(ii); (2)(d) An election officer who administers an election:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(a): (3); 20A-3a-401.5 shall in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(a)(i): a manual ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(a)(ii): a return envelope;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(a)(iii): instructions for returning the ballot that include an express notice about any relevant deadlines that the voter must meet in order for the voter's vote to be counted;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(a)(iv): for an election administered by a county clerk, information regarding the location and hours of operation of any election day voting center at which the voter may vote or a website address where the voter may view this information;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(a)(v): for an election administered by an election officer other than a county clerk, if the election officer does not operate a polling place or an election day voting center, a warning, on a separate page of colored paper in bold face print, indicating that if the voter fails to follow the instructions included with the ballot, the voter will be unable to vote in that election because there will be no polling place for the voting precinct on the day of the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(a)(vi): 20A-3a-401.5 instructions on how a voter may sign up to receive electronic ballot status notifications via the ballot tracking system described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(b): (9)(c)(ii) may not mail a ballot under this section to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(b)(i): an inactive voter, unless the inactive voter requests a manual ballot; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(b)(ii): (9)(c)(ii) a voter whom the election officer is prohibited from sending a ballot under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(c): shall, on the outside of the envelope in which the election officer mails the ballot, include instructions for returning the ballot if the individual to whom the election officer mails the ballot does not live at the address to which the ballot is sent;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(d): shall provide a method of accessible voting to a voter with a disability who is not able to vote by mail; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(2)(e): (2)(d) shall include, on the election officer's website and with each ballot mailed, instructions regarding how a voter described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(3): (2); (3)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(3)(a): (2); (3)(b) An election officer who mails a manual ballot under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(3)(a)(i): provided at the time of registration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(3)(a)(ii): (3)(b) if, at or after the time of registration, the voter files an alternate address request form described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(3)(b): The lieutenant governor shall make available to voters an alternate address request form that permits a voter to request that the election officer mail the voter's ballot to a location other than the voter's residence.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(3)(c): A voter shall provide the completed alternate address request form to the election officer no later than 11 days before the day of the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(4): The return envelope shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(4)(a): the name, official title, and post office address of the election officer on the front of the envelope;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(4)(b): a space where a voter may write an email address and phone number by which the election officer may contact the voter if the voter's ballot is rejected;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(4)(c): a printed affidavit in substantially the following form:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(4)(d): a warning that the affidavit must be signed by the individual to whom the ballot was sent and that the ballot will not be counted if the signature on the affidavit does not match the signature on file with the election officer of the individual to whom the ballot was sent.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(5): 20A-3a-401.5 If the election officer determines that the voter is required to show valid voter identification, the election officer may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(5)(a): mail a ballot to the voter;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(5)(b): instruct the voter to include a copy of the voter's valid voter identification with the return ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(5)(c): 20A-3a-401.5 provide instructions to the voter on how the voter may sign up to receive electronic ballot status notifications via the ballot tracking system described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(6): An election officer who administers an election shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(6)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(6)(a)(i): before the election, obtain the signatures of each voter qualified to vote in the election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(6)(a)(ii): obtain the signature of each voter within the voting precinct from the county clerk; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(6)(b): maintain the signatures on file in the election officer's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(7): 20A-3a-401 Upon receipt of a returned ballot, the election officer shall review and process the ballot under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8): Part 7, Election Day Voting Center; 20A-3a-601; 20A-3a-604 A county that administers an election:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8)(a): Part 7, Election Day Voting Center shall provide at least one election day voting center in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8)(b): shall ensure that each election day voting center operated by the county has at least one voting device that is accessible, in accordance with the Help America Vote Act of 2002, Pub. L. No. 107-252, for individuals with disabilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8)(c): 20A-3a-601; 20A-3a-604 may reduce the early voting period described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8)(c)(i): the county clerk conducts early voting on at least four days;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8)(c)(ii): the early voting days are within the period beginning on the date that is 14 days before the date of the election and ending on the day before the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8)(c)(iii): 20A-3a-604 the county clerk provides notice of the reduced early voting period in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(8)(d): is not required to pay return postage for a ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-202(9): (9)(a); (9)(a); (9)(a); (9)(b); (9)(c)(ii)(A); (9)(a)
