Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203 Voting at a polling place.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(1): 20A-7-609.5 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2): 20A-3a-205; 20A-3a-803; 20A-3a-205
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(a): The voter shall give the voter's name, and, if requested, the voter's residence, to one of the poll workers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(b): The voter shall present valid voter identification to one of the poll workers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(c): 20A-3a-205 If the poll worker is not satisfied that the voter has presented valid voter identification, the poll worker shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(c)(i): indicate on the official register that the voter was not properly identified;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(c)(ii): issue the voter a provisional ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(c)(iii): notify the voter that the voter will have until the close of normal office hours on Monday after the day of the election to present valid voter identification:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(c)(iii)(A): to the county clerk at the county clerk's office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(c)(iii)(B): to an election officer who is administering the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(c)(iv): 20A-3a-205 follow the procedures and requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(2)(d): 20A-3a-803; 20A-3a-205 If the person's right to vote is challenged as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(3): A poll worker shall check the official register to determine whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(3)(a): a voter is registered to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(3)(b): if the election is a regular primary election or a presidential primary election, whether a voter's party affiliation designation in the official register allows the voter to vote the ballot that the voter requests.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(4): (5); 20A-3a-205
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(4)(a): (5); 20A-3a-205 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(4)(b): If, in a regular primary election or a presidential primary election, the official register does not affirmatively identify the voter as being affiliated with a registered political party or if the official register identifies the voter as being "unaffiliated," the voter shall be considered to be "unaffiliated."
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(5): (6); (3) In a regular primary election or a presidential primary election:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(5)(a): if a voter's name is not found on the official register, and if it is not unduly disruptive to the election process, the poll worker may attempt to contact the county clerk's office to request oral verification of the voter's registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(5)(b): (6); (3) if oral verification is received from the county clerk's office, the poll worker shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(5)(b)(i): record the verification on the official register;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(5)(b)(ii): determine the voter's party affiliation and the ballot that the voter is qualified to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(5)(b)(iii): (6); (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(6): (6)(b); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(6)(a): (6)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(6)(b): (3) If, in a regular primary election or a presidential primary election, the voter is listed in the official register as unaffiliated, or if the official register does not affirmatively identify the voter as either unaffiliated or affiliated with a registered political party, and the voter, as an unaffiliated voter, is not authorized to vote the ballot that the voter requests, the poll worker shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(6)(b)(i): ask the voter if the voter wishes to vote another registered political party ballot that the voter, as unaffiliated, is authorized to vote, or remain unaffiliated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(6)(b)(ii): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(6)(b)(ii)(A): (3) if the voter wishes to vote another registered political party ballot that the unaffiliated voter is authorized to vote, the poll worker shall proceed as required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(6)(b)(ii)(B): if the voter wishes to remain unaffiliated and does not wish to vote another ballot that unaffiliated voters are authorized to vote, the poll worker shall instruct the voter that the voter may not vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(7): (6)(b)(ii)(B); (6) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(7)(a): direct the voter to sign the voter's name in the official register;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(7)(b): provide to the voter the ballot that the voter is qualified to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-203(7)(c): allow the voter to enter the voting booth.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204 Marking and depositing ballots.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1): (6); (6); 20A-3a-206(1); (6) To vote by mail:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(a): (6) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(b): if a ballot proposition is submitted to a vote of the people, the voter shall mark the appropriate space with a mark opposite the answer the voter intends to make;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(c): (6); 20A-3a-206(1) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(d): (6) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e): the voter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e)(i): complete and sign the affidavit on the return envelope;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e)(ii): place the voted ballot in the return envelope;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e)(iii): if required, place a copy of the voter's valid voter identification in the return envelope;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e)(iv): securely seal the return envelope; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e)(v): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e)(v)(A): attach postage, if necessary, and deposit the return envelope in the mail; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(1)(e)(v)(B): place the return envelope in a ballot drop box, designated by the election officer, for the precinct where the voter resides.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2): 20A-16-404; (2)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(a): 20A-16-404 Except as otherwise provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(a)(i): clearly postmarked before election day, or otherwise clearly marked by the post office as received by the post office before election day; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(a)(ii): received in the office of the election officer before noon on the day of the official canvass following the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(b): (2)(c) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(b)(i): a ballot box at a polling place; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(b)(ii): a ballot drop box designated by an election officer for the jurisdiction to which the ballot relates.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(c): An election officer may, but is not required to, forward a ballot deposited in a ballot drop box in the wrong jurisdiction to the correct jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(2)(d): An election officer shall ensure that a voter who is, at or before 8 p.m., in line at a ballot drop box, with a sealed return envelope containing a ballot in the voter's possession, to deposit the ballot in the ballot drop box.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(3): (4); (1)(a); (d) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(3)(a): sign the official register or pollbook; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(3)(b)(i): place the ballot in the ballot box; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(3)(b)(ii): if the ballot is a provisional ballot, place the ballot in the provisional ballot envelope, complete the information printed on the provisional ballot envelope, and deposit the provisional ballot envelope in the provisional ballot box.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(4)(a): An individual with a disability may vote a mechanical ballot at a polling place.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(4)(b): An individual other than an individual with a disability may vote a mechanical ballot at a polling place if permitted by the election officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(5): (6) To vote a mechanical ballot, the voter shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(5)(a): make the selections according to the instructions provided for the voting device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(5)(b): (6) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(5)(b)(i): selecting the appropriate position for entering a write-in candidate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(5)(b)(ii): using the voting device to enter the name of the valid write-in candidate for whom the voter wishes to vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(6): Title 20A, Chapter 4, Part 6, Municipal Alternate Voting Methods Pilot Project To vote in an instant runoff voting race under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(6)(a): shall indicate, as directed on the ballot, the name of the candidate who is the voter's first preference for the office; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(6)(b): may indicate, as directed on the ballot, the names of the remaining candidates in order of the voter's preference.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(7): 20A-3a-208 A voter who votes at a polling place:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(7)(a): shall mark and cast or deposit the ballot without delay and shall leave the voting area after voting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(7)(b): 20A-3a-208 may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(7)(b)(i): 20A-3a-208 occupy a voting booth occupied by another, except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(7)(b)(ii): remain within the voting area more than 10 minutes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(7)(b)(iii): occupy a voting booth for more than five minutes if all booths are in use and other voters are waiting to occupy a voting booth.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(8): If the official register shows any voter as having voted, that voter may not reenter the voting area during that election unless that voter is an election official or watcher.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(9): A poll worker may not, at a polling place, allow more than four voters more than the number of voting booths into the voting area at one time unless those excess voters are:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(9)(a): election officials;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(9)(b): watchers; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-204(9)(c): assisting voters with a disability.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205 Manner of voting -- Provisional ballot.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(1): 20A-3a-803; 20A-3a-805 The poll workers shall follow the procedures and requirements of this section when:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(1)(a): 20A-3a-803; 20A-3a-805 the individual's right to vote is challenged as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(1)(b): the individual's name is not found on the official register; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(1)(c): the poll worker is not satisfied that the voter has provided valid voter identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(2): (1)(a); (b) When faced with one of the circumstances described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(2)(a): request that the individual provide valid voter identification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(2)(b): review the identification provided by the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3): If the poll worker is satisfied that the individual has provided valid voter identification that establishes the individual's identity and residence in the voting precinct:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3)(a): the poll worker in charge of the official register shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3)(a)(i): record in the official register the type of identification that established the individual's identity and place of residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3)(a)(ii): record the provisional ballot envelope number in association with the name of the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3)(a)(iii): direct the individual to sign the individual's name in the official register or pollbook; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3)(b): the poll worker having charge of the ballots shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3)(b)(i): give the individual a provisional ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(3)(b)(ii): allow the individual to enter the voting booth.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4): If the poll worker is not satisfied that the individual has provided valid voter identification that establishes the individual's identity and residence in the voting precinct:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(a): the poll worker in charge of the official register shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(a)(i): record in the official register that the voter did not provide valid voter identification;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(a)(ii): record in the official register the type of identification that was provided by the individual, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(a)(iii): record the provisional ballot envelope number in association with the name of the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(a)(iv): direct the individual to sign the individual's name in the official register or pollbook; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(b): the poll worker having charge of the ballots shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(b)(i): give the individual a provisional ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(4)(b)(ii): allow the individual to enter the voting booth.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-205(5): When, at a polling place, the election officer is required to furnish more than one version of a ballot, the poll workers at that polling place shall give the registered voter the version of the ballot that the voter is qualified to vote.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-206 Writing in names -- Effect of unnecessary marking of cross.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-206(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-206(1)(a): A voter may cast a write-in vote on a manual ballot by writing the name of a valid write-in candidate in the blank write-in section of the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-206(1)(b): A voter may not cast a write-in vote on a manual ballot by affixing a sticker or label with the name of a write-in candidate in the blank write-in section of the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-206(2): A voter may cast a write-in vote on a mechanical ballot by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-206(2)(a): marking the appropriate position opposite the area for entering a write-in candidate for the office sought by the candidate for whom the voter wishes to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-206(2)(b): entering the name of a valid write-in candidate in the write-in selection area.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-207 Spoiled ballots.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-207(1): If any voter spoils a ballot, the voter may successively obtain others, one at a time, not exceeding three in all, upon returning each spoiled one.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-207(2): If any ballot is spoiled by the printer or a poll worker, the poll worker shall give the voter a new ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-207(3): The poll worker shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-207(3)(a): immediately write the word "spoiled" across the face of the ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-207(3)(b): place the ballot in the envelope for spoiled ballots.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208 Assisting disabled, illiterate, or blind voters.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208(1): Any voter who has a disability, or is blind, unable to read or write, unable to read or write the English language, or is physically unable to enter a polling place, may be given assistance by an individual of the voter's choice.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208(2): The individual providing assistance may not be:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208(2)(a): the voter's employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208(2)(b): an agent of the employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208(2)(c): an officer or agent of the voter's union; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208(2)(d): a candidate.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-208(3): The person providing assistance may not request, persuade, or otherwise induce the voter to vote for or vote against any particular candidate or issue or release any information regarding the voter's selection.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-209 Instructions to voters.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-209(1): If any voter, after entering a voting booth, asks for further instructions concerning the manner of voting, two poll workers, each from a different political party, shall instruct the voter.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-209(2): After instructing the voter, and before the voter casts a vote, the poll worker shall leave the voting booth so that the voter may vote in secret.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-209(3): A poll worker instructing a voter about the voting process may not request, suggest, or seek to persuade or induce the voter to vote for or against any particular ticket, any particular candidate, or for or against any ballot proposition.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301 Emergency ballots.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(1): As used in this section, "hospitalized voter" means a registered voter who:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(1)(a): is hospitalized or otherwise confined to a medical or long-term care institution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(1)(b): does not have a manual ballot in the voter's immediate possession;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(1)(c): is able to vote a manual ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(1)(d): is not able to acquire a manual ballot without the assistance of another individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(2): A hospitalized voter may, in accordance with this section, obtain a manual ballot to use as an emergency ballot and vote at any time after the election officer mails manual ballots to the majority of voters and before the close of polls on election day.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(3)(a): Any individual may obtain an emergency ballot application, a manual ballot, and a manual ballot envelope from the election officer on behalf of a hospitalized voter by requesting a ballot and application in person at the election officer's office during business hours.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(3)(b): The election officer shall require the individual to sign a statement identifying the individual and the hospitalized voter.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(4): 20A-1-308 To vote, the hospitalized voter shall complete the emergency ballot application, complete and sign the affidavit on the manual ballot envelope, mark the voter's votes on the manual ballot, place the manual ballot into the envelope, and seal the envelope unless a different method is authorized under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-301(5): To be counted, the emergency voter application and the sealed manual ballot envelope must be returned to the election officer's office in accordance with the requirements of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401 Custody of voted ballots mailed or deposited in a ballot drop box -- Disposition -- Notice -- Disclosures relating to unresolved ballots.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(1): This section governs ballots returned by mail or via a ballot drop box.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(2)(a): Poll workers shall open return envelopes containing manual ballots that are in the custody of the poll workers in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(2)(b): The poll workers shall, first, compare the signature of the voter on the affidavit of the return envelope to the signature of the voter in the voter registration records.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3): After complying with Subsection (2), the poll workers shall determine whether:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3)(a): the signatures correspond;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3)(b): the affidavit is sufficient;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3)(c): the voter is registered to vote in the correct precinct;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3)(d): the voter's right to vote the ballot has been challenged;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3)(e): the voter has already voted in the election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3)(f): the voter is required to provide valid voter identification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(3)(g): if the voter is required to provide valid voter identification, whether the voter has provided valid voter identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a): The poll workers shall take the action described in Subsection (4)(b) if the poll workers determine:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(i): in accordance with the rules made under Subsection (11):
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(i)(A): that the signature on the affidavit of the return envelope is reasonably consistent with the individual's signature in the voter registration records; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(i)(B): for an individual who checks the box described in Subsection (5)(c)(v), that the signature is verified by alternative means;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(ii): that the affidavit is sufficient;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(iii): that the voter is registered to vote in the correct precinct;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(iv): that the voter's right to vote the ballot has not been challenged;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(v): that the voter has not already voted in the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(a)(vi): for a voter required to provide valid voter identification, that the voter has provided valid voter identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(b): If the poll workers make all of the findings described in Subsection (4)(a), the poll workers shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(b)(i): remove the manual ballot from the return envelope in a manner that does not destroy the affidavit on the return envelope;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(b)(ii): ensure that the ballot does not unfold and is not otherwise examined in connection with the return envelope; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(b)(iii): place the ballot with the other ballots to be counted.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(c): If the poll workers do not make all of the findings described in Subsection (4)(a), the poll workers shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(c)(i): disallow the vote;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(c)(ii): without opening the return envelope, record the ballot as "rejected" and state the reason for the rejection; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(4)(c)(iii): place the return envelope, unopened, with the other rejected return envelopes.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5): 20A-2-502
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(a): If the poll workers reject an individual's ballot because the poll workers determine, in accordance with rules made under Subsection (11), that the signature on the return envelope is not reasonably consistent with the individual's signature in the voter registration records, the election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(a)(i): contact the individual in accordance with Subsection (6); and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(a)(ii): inform the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(a)(ii)(A): that the individual's signature is in question;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(a)(ii)(B): how the individual may resolve the issue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(a)(ii)(C): that, in order for the ballot to be counted, the individual is required to deliver to the election officer a correctly completed affidavit, provided by the county clerk, that meets the requirements described in Subsection (5)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(b): The election officer shall ensure that the notice described in Subsection (5)(a) includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(b)(i): when communicating the notice by mail, a printed copy of the affidavit described in Subsection (5)(c) and a courtesy reply envelope;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(b)(ii): when communicating the notice electronically, a link to a copy of the affidavit described in Subsection (5)(c) or information on how to obtain a copy of the affidavit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(b)(iii): when communicating the notice by phone, either during a direct conversation with the voter or in a voicemail, arrangements for the voter to receive a copy of the affidavit described in Subsection (5)(c), either in person from the clerk's office, by mail, or electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(c): An affidavit described in Subsection (5)(a)(ii)(C) shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(c)(i): an attestation that the individual voted the ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(c)(ii): a space for the individual to enter the individual's name, date of birth, and driver license number or the last four digits of the individual's social security number;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(c)(iii): a space for the individual to sign the affidavit;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(c)(iv): a statement that, by signing the affidavit, the individual authorizes the lieutenant governor's and county clerk's use of the individual's signature on the affidavit for voter identification purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(c)(v): a check box accompanied by language in substantially the following form: "I am a voter with a qualifying disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act that impacts my ability to sign my name consistently. I can provide appropriate documentation upon request. To discuss accommodations, I can be contacted at __________________".
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(d): In order for an individual described in Subsection (5)(a) to have the individual's ballot counted, the individual shall deliver the affidavit described in Subsection (5)(c) to the election officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(e): 20A-2-502 An election officer who receives a signed affidavit under Subsection (5)(d) shall immediately:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(e)(i): 20A-2-502 scan the signature on the affidavit electronically and keep the signature on file in the statewide voter registration database developed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(e)(ii): if the election officer receives the affidavit no later than 5 p.m. three days before the day on which the canvass begins, count the individual's ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(5)(e)(iii): if the check box described in Subsection (5)(c)(v) is checked, comply with the rules described in Subsection (11)(c).
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6)(a): The election officer shall, within two business days after the day on which an individual's ballot is rejected, notify the individual of the rejection and the reason for the rejection, by phone, mail, email, or SMS text message, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6)(a)(i): the ballot is cured within one business day after the day on which the ballot is rejected; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6)(a)(ii): the ballot is rejected because the ballot is received late or for another reason that cannot be cured.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6)(b): If an individual's ballot is rejected for a reason described in Subsection (6)(a)(ii), the election officer shall notify the individual of the rejection and the reason for the rejection by phone, mail, email, or SMS text message, within the later of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6)(b)(i): 30 days after the day of the rejection; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6)(b)(ii): 30 days after the day of the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(6)(c): The election officer may, when notifying an individual by phone under this Subsection (6), use auto-dial technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7): An election officer may not count the ballot of an individual whom the election officer contacts under Subsection (5) or (6) unless, no later than 5 p.m. three days before the day on which the canvass begins, the election officer:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(a): receives a signed affidavit from the individual under Subsection (5); or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(i): contacts the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(ii): if the election officer has reason to believe that an individual, other than the voter to whom the ballot was sent, signed the ballot affidavit, informs the individual that it is unlawful to sign a ballot affidavit for another person, even if the person gives permission;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iii): verifies the identity of the individual by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iii)(A): requiring the individual to provide at least two types of personal identifying information for the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iii)(B): comparing the information provided under Subsection (7)(b)(iii)(A) to records relating to the individual that are in the possession or control of an election officer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iv): documenting the verification described in Subsection (7)(b)(iii), by recording:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iv)(A): the name and voter identification number of the individual contacted;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iv)(B): the name of the individual who conducts the verification;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iv)(C): the date and manner of the communication;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iv)(D): the type of personal identifying information provided by the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iv)(E): a description of the records against which the personal identifying information provided by the individual is compared and verified; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(7)(b)(iv)(F): other information required by the lieutenant governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(8): The election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(8)(a): retain and preserve the return envelopes in the manner provided by law for the retention and preservation of ballots voted at that election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(8)(b): retain and preserve the documentation described in Subsection (7)(b)(iv); and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(8)(c): if the election officer complies with Subsection (8)(b) by including the documentation in the voter's voter registration record, make, retain, and preserve a record of the name and voter identification number of each voter contacted under Subsection (7)(b).
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(9)(a): The election officer shall record the following in the database used to verify signatures:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(9)(a)(i): any initial rejection of a ballot under Subsection (4)(c), within one business day after the day on which the election officer rejects the ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(9)(a)(ii): any resolution of a rejection of a ballot under Subsection (7), within one business day after the day on which the ballot rejection is resolved.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(9)(b): An election officer shall include, in the canvass report, a final report of the disposition of all rejected and resolved ballots, including, for ballots rejected, the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(9)(b)(i): the number of ballots rejected because the voter did not sign the voter's ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(9)(b)(ii): the number of ballots rejected because the voter's signatures on the ballot, and in records on file, do not correspond.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(10): 20A-5-701 Willful failure to comply with this section constitutes willful neglect of duty under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(11): The director of elections within the Office of the Lieutenant Governor shall make rules, in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act, to establish:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(11)(a): criteria and processes for use by poll workers in determining if a signature corresponds with the signature on file for the voter under Subsections (3)(a) and (4)(a)(i)(A);
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(11)(b): training and certification requirements for election officers and employees of election officers regarding the criteria and processes described in Subsection (11)(a); and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(11)(c): in compliance with Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, 42 U.S.C. Secs. 12131 through 12165, an alternative means of verifying the identity of an individual who checks the box described in Subsection (5)(c)(v).
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(12): Subject to Subsection (13), if, in response to a request, and in accordance with the requirements of law, an election officer discloses the name or address of voters whose ballots have been rejected and not yet resolved, the election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(12)(a): make the disclosure within two business days after the day on which the request is made;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(12)(b): respond to each request in the order the requests were made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(12)(c): make each disclosure in a manner, and within a period of time, that does not reflect favoritism to one requestor over another.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401(13): 20A-2-104 A disclosure described in Subsection (12) may not include the name or address of a protected individual, as defined in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1 Ballot chain of custody.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(a): "Batch" means a grouping of a specified number of ballots:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(a)(i): that is assembled by poll workers, and given a number to distinguish the grouping from other groupings, when the ballots are first received for processing;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(a)(ii): that is kept together in the same grouping, and kept separate from other groupings, throughout ballot processing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(a)(iii): for which a log is kept to document the chain of custody of the grouping.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(b): "Processed" means an action taken in relation to a batch, a ballot in a batch, or a return envelope that a poll worker has not separated from a ballot, as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(b)(i): starting with receiving the ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(b)(ii): each step taken in relation to a ballot as part of conducting an election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(1)(b)(iii): ending after the ballots are counted and stored.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(2): An election officer shall preserve the chain of custody of all ballots in accordance with this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(3): An election officer shall maintain an accurate, updated count of the number of ballots that the election officer:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(3)(a): mails or otherwise provides to a voter;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(3)(b): receives from a voter;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(3)(c): counts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(3)(d): rejects;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(3)(e): resolves after rejecting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(3)(f): does not resolve after rejecting.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(4): Upon receiving ballots cast by voters, the election officer shall ensure that poll workers immediately count the number of ballots received and divide the ballots into batches.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5): (7) The election officer shall ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(a): ballots in each batch are kept separate from the ballots in other batches;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(b): a ballot is not separated from a batch, except as necessary to the election process;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(c): if a ballot is separated from a batch, the batch log indicates:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(c)(i): the ballot number;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(c)(ii): the date and time of removal;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(c)(iii): the identity of the individual who removes the ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(c)(iv): the reason the ballot is removed;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d): (7) poll workers shall keep for each batch a log that includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(i): a unique identifying code or number for the batch;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(ii): the number of ballots in the batch;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(iii): the date that the ballots were received; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(iv): (7) for each occasion that the batches, or any of the ballots in the batches, are handled:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(iv)(A): the date and time that the ballots are handled;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(iv)(B): a description of what is done with the ballots;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(iv)(C): the identity of the poll workers who handle the ballots; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(d)(iv)(D): (7) any other information required by rule under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(e): an election official who performs a ballot processing function performs the function in the presence of at least one other election official;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(f): to the extent reasonably possible, the poll workers who perform a ballot processing function for a batch complete performing that function for the entire batch; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(5)(g): each part of the processing of all ballots is monitored by recorded video, without audio.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6): (5)(g); (5)(g) An election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(a): (5)(g) keep the recordings described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(a)(i): the end of the calendar year in which the election was held; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(a)(ii): if the election is contested, when the contest is resolved; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(b): (5)(g) ensure that a camera, a video, or a recording of a video described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(b)(i): by the election officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(b)(ii): by a custodian of the camera, video, or recording;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(b)(iii): by the lieutenant governor;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(b)(iv): by the legislative auditor general, when performing an audit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(6)(b)(v): by, or pursuant to an order of, a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(7): (5)(g); (6)(b); (5)(g); (6) An individual may not view a video, or a recording of a video, described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(7)(a): (6)(b) unless the individual is an individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(7)(b): (5)(g); (6) the individual views the video to the extent necessary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(7)(b)(i): (5)(g); (6) ensure compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(7)(b)(ii): investigate a concern relating to the processing of ballots.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(8): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act; 20A-3a-402.5; 20A-4-304(2)(h) The director of elections within the Office of the Lieutenant Governor may make rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(8)(a): fulfill the chain of custody requirements described in this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(8)(b): 20A-3a-402.5 perform the signature verification audits described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.1(8)(c): 20A-4-304(2)(h) comply with the reconciliation requirements described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5 Ballot tracking system.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1): 20A-3a-202; 20A-3a-204; 20A-3a-204; 20A-2-501 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(a): "Ballot tracking system" means the system described in this section to track and confirm the status of trackable ballots.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(b): "Change in the status" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(b)(i): when a trackable ballot is mailed to a voter;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(b)(ii): when an election official receives a voted trackable ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(b)(iii): when a voted trackable ballot is counted.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(c): 20A-3a-202; 20A-3a-204; 20A-3a-204 "Trackable ballot" means a manual ballot that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(c)(i): 20A-3a-202 mailed to a voter in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(c)(ii): 20A-3a-204 deposited in the mail by a voter in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(c)(iii): 20A-3a-204 deposited in a ballot drop box by a voter in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(1)(d): 20A-2-501 "Voter registration database" means the database, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(2): The lieutenant governor shall operate and maintain a statewide or locally based system to track and confirm when there is a change in the status of a trackable ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(3): If a voter elects to receive electronic notifications regarding the status of the voter's trackable ballot, the ballot tracking system shall, when there is a change in the status of the voter's trackable ballot:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(3)(a): send a text message notification to the voter if the voter's information in the voter registration database includes a mobile telephone number;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(3)(b): send an email notification to the voter if the voter's information in the voter registration database includes an email address; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(3)(c): send a notification by another electronic means directed by the lieutenant governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(4): 20A-7-801 The lieutenant governor shall ensure that the ballot tracking system and the state-provided website described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(5): The ballot tracking system shall include a toll-free telephone number or other offline method by which a voter can confirm the status of the voter's trackable ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(6): The lieutenant governor shall ensure that the ballot tracking system:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(6)(a): is secure from unauthorized use by employing data encryption or other security measures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-401.5(6)(b): is only used for the purposes described in this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402 Custody of ballots voted at a polling place -- Disposition -- Counting ballots -- Release of tally.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1): 20A-3a-401
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1)(a): For ballots voted at a polling place:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1)(b): the election officer shall deliver all return envelopes containing valid ballots and valid provisional ballots that are in the election officer's custody to the counting center before noon on the day of the official canvass following the election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1)(c): valid ballots, including valid provisional ballots, may be processed and counted:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1)(c)(i): by the election officer, or poll workers acting under the supervision of the election officer, before the date of the canvass; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1)(c)(ii): at the canvass, by the election officer or poll workers, acting under the supervision of the official canvassers of the election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1)(d): 20A-3a-401 when processing ballots, the election officer and poll workers shall comply with the procedures and requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(1)(e): all valid ballots, including valid provisional ballots have been deposited, the ballots shall be counted in the usual manner.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(2): (2)(c); (2)(b); (2)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(2)(a): After the polls close on the date of the election, the election officer shall publicly release the results of all ballots, including provisional ballots, that have been counted on or before the date of the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(2)(b): (2)(c) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(2)(c): (2)(b); (2)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(2)(c)(i): (2)(b) If complying with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(2)(c)(ii): (2)(c)(i) The lieutenant governor shall grant a request made under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402(2)(d): On the date of the canvass, the election officer shall provide a tally of all ballots, including provisional ballots, counted, and the resulting tally shall be added to the official canvass of the election.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5 Signature verification audits.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(1): 20A-3a-106 An election officer shall, in accordance with this section and rules made under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(2): An individual who conducts an audit of signature comparisons may not audit the individual's own work.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(3): Before separating ballots from return envelopes, the election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(3)(a): audit 1% of all signature comparisons of the envelopes to be separated to determine the accuracy of the comparisons made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(3)(b): provide additional training or staff reassignments, as needed, based on the results of the audit.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(4): An election officer shall submit to the lieutenant governor and the board of canvassers a record of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(4)(a): the audits performed under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(4)(b): the results of the audits; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-402.5(4)(c): any remedial action taken.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403 Frauds and malfeasance in voting -- Penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(1): (1); Title 76, Chapter 8, Part 5, Falsification in Official Matters
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(1)(a): It is unlawful for any person to willfully falsify the voter affidavits required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(1)(b): (1); Title 76, Chapter 8, Part 5, Falsification in Official Matters Any person violating this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(2): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(2)(a): It is unlawful for any election officer to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(2)(a)(i): refuse or neglect to perform any of the duties required by this part; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(2)(a)(ii): violate any of the provisions of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-403(2)(b): (2) Any person who violates this Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-404(2): (1) Beginning in November 2022, an election officer shall include, with all election returns provided to a board of canvassers, an affidavit, signed by the election officer, certifying:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-404(2)(a): (1) compliance with the rules described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-404(2)(b): that the county clerk maintains the voter registration database in accordance with federal and state laws and rules.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501 Prohibited conduct at polling place -- Other prohibited activities.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(1)(a): "electioneering" includes any oral, printed, or written attempt to persuade persons to refrain from voting or to vote for or vote against any candidate or issue; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(1)(b): "polling place" means the physical place where ballots are cast and includes the physical place where a ballot drop box is located.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(2)(a): An individual may not, within a polling place or in any public area within 150 feet of the building where a polling place is located:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(2)(a)(i): do any electioneering;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(2)(a)(ii): circulate cards or handbills of any kind;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(2)(a)(iii): solicit signatures to any kind of petition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(2)(a)(iv): engage in any practice that interferes with the freedom of voters to vote or disrupts the administration of the polling place.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(2)(b): A county, municipality, school district, or special district may not prohibit electioneering that occurs more than 150 feet from the building where a polling place is located, but may regulate the place and manner of that electioneering to protect the public safety.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(3)(a): An individual may not obstruct the doors or entries to a building in which a polling place is located or prevent free access to and from any polling place.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(3)(b): A sheriff, deputy sheriff, or municipal law enforcement officer shall prevent the obstruction of the entrance to a polling place and may arrest an individual creating an obstruction.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(4): An individual may not solicit any voter to show the voter's ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5): 20A-3a-301; Chapter 16, Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act; 20A-3a-208; (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5)(a): 20A-3a-301; Chapter 16, Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act; 20A-3a-208 An individual may not knowingly possess or control another individual's voted manual ballot, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5)(a)(i): the individual is an election official or postal worker acting in the capacity of an election official or postal worker;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5)(a)(ii): 20A-3a-301 the individual possesses or controls the voted ballot in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5)(a)(iii): Chapter 16, Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act the possession or control is authorized in order to deliver a military-overseas ballot in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5)(a)(iv): 20A-3a-208 subject to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5)(a)(v): the individual resides in the same household as the voter.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(5)(b): (5)(a) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(6): 20A-1-609(2); (3) An individual who violates any provision of this section is, in addition to the penalties described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-501(7): A political subdivision may not prohibit political signs that are located more than 150 feet away from a polling place, but may regulate their placement to protect public safety.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502 Intimidation -- Undue influence.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(1): It is unlawful for a person to induce or compel an individual to vote or refrain from voting at an election provided by law or to vote or refrain from voting for a particular individual or measure at an election provided by law, directly or indirectly, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(1)(a): using force, violence, or restraint;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(1)(b): inflicting or threatening to inflict injury, damage, harm, or loss; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(1)(c): by intimidation.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(2): It is unlawful for a person to, by abduction, force, or fraud, impede, prevent, or otherwise interfere with the free exercise of the elective franchise of any voter, either in voting at any election provided by law or voting or refraining from voting for a particular individual or measure at an election provided by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(3): It is unlawful for a person to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(3)(a): enclose in the salary or wage envelopes of an employee of the person, political mottoes, devices, or arguments containing threats, express or implied, intended or calculated to influence the political opinion, views, or action of the employee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(3)(b): within 90 days before the day of an election provided by law, post or otherwise exhibit, in a location where the person's employees may be working or may be present in the course of employment, any handbill, notice, or placard containing any threat, notice, or information, that if any particular ticket or candidate is or is not elected:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(3)(b)(i): work performed by the person's employees will cease in whole or in part;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(3)(b)(ii): the workplace will close;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(3)(b)(iii): wages of workforce will be reduced; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(3)(b)(iv): other adverse consequences, under the control of the person, will result.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-502(4): Violation of this section is a class B misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-503 Influencing employee's vote.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-503(1): It is unlawful for any corporation, or any officer or agent of any corporation, to influence, or attempt to influence, induce, or compel by force, violence, or restraint, or by inflicting or threatening to inflict any injury, damage, harm, or loss, or by discharging from employment or promoting in employment, or by intimidation, or in any manner whatever, any employee to vote or refrain from voting at any election provided by law, or to vote or refrain from voting for any particular person or measure at that election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-503(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-503(2)(a): Any corporation or any officer or agent of that corporation who violates any of the provisions of this section is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-503(2)(b): Any corporation violating any of the provisions of this section shall forfeit its charter and right to do business in this state in addition to any other penalties imposed by law.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504 Violations -- Penalties.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(1): (3); 20A-3a-208 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(1)(a): allows the individual's ballot to be seen by another with the intent to reveal how the individual is about to vote;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(1)(b): states falsely that the individual is unable to mark the individual's ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(1)(c): interferes or attempts to interfere with any individual who is inside the voting booth or who is marking a ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(1)(d): induces or attempts to induce any voter who is inside a voting booth or who is marking a ballot to vote to show how the voter marked the voter's ballot; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(1)(e): takes a photograph of a ballot, other than the individual's own ballot, at a polling place.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(2): The election judges and clerks shall report any individual who violates this section to the county attorney or district attorney having state criminal jurisdiction for prosecution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-504(3): (1) Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505 False impersonation -- Double voting.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(1)(a): An individual may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(1)(a)(i): apply for a ballot in the name of another individual, regardless of whether the other individual is living or dead, or is a fictitious person;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(1)(a)(ii): after having voted once at an election, apply again at the same election for a ballot in the individual's own name or any other name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(1)(a)(iii): sign the affidavit on a return envelope for another individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(1)(b): (1)(a) An individual who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(2): (1)(a); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(2)(a): (1)(a) An individual may not aid, assist, counsel, or procure another individual to commit the felony described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-505(2)(b): (2)(a) An individual who violates Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-506 False information on provisional ballot envelope.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-506(1): An individual may not wilfully falsify information on a provisional ballot envelope.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-506(2): An individual who violates this section is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601 Early voting.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(1): 20A-7-609.5; 20A-2-207(6); 20A-2-207 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(1)(a): an individual who is registered to vote may vote at a polling place before the election date in accordance with this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(1)(b): 20A-2-207(6); 20A-2-207 except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(1)(b)(i): is otherwise legally entitled to vote the ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(1)(b)(ii): 20A-2-207 casts a provisional ballot in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(2): 20A-1-308; (3) Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(2)(a): begins on the date that is 14 days before the date of the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(2)(b): continues through the Friday before the election if the election date is a Tuesday.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3): 20A-3a-604; 20A-3a-604; 20A-3a-604
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(a): 20A-3a-604 An election officer may extend the end of the early voting period to the day before the election date if the election officer provides notice of the extension in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(b): 20A-3a-604 For a municipal election, the municipal clerk may reduce the early voting period described in this section if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(b)(i): the municipal clerk conducts early voting on at least four days;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(b)(ii): the early voting days are within the period beginning on the date that is 14 days before the date of the election and ending on the day before the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(b)(iii): 20A-3a-604 the municipal clerk provides notice of the reduced early voting period in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(c): 20A-3a-604 For a county election, the county clerk may reduce the early voting period described in this section if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(c)(i): the county clerk conducts early voting on at least four days;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(c)(ii): the early voting days are within the period beginning on the date that is 14 days before the date of the election and ending on the day before the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(3)(c)(iii): 20A-3a-604 the county clerk provides notice of the reduced early voting period in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(4): 20A-1-308 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(4)(a): for a local special election, a municipal primary election, and a municipal general election:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(4)(a)(i): shall conduct early voting on a minimum of four days during each week of the early voting period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(4)(a)(ii): shall conduct early voting on the last day of the early voting period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(4)(b): for all other elections:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(4)(b)(i): shall conduct early voting on each weekday; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(4)(b)(ii): may elect to conduct early voting on a Saturday, Sunday, or holiday.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-601(5): Part 6, Early Voting; 20A-1-308 Except as specifically provided in this

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603 Early voting polling places.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1): 20A-1-308; 20A-7-609.5; Chapter 5, Election Administration Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(a): at least one polling place shall be open on each day that polls are open during the early voting period;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(b): Chapter 5, Election Administration each polling place shall comply with the requirements for polling places under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(c): for all elections other than local special elections, municipal primary elections, and municipal general elections, at least 10% of the voting devices at a polling place shall be accessible for individuals with disabilities in accordance with Public Law 107-252, the Help America Vote Act of 2002; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(d): each polling place shall be located in a government building or office, unless the election officer determines that, in the area designated by the election officer, there is no government building or office available that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(d)(i): can be scheduled for use during early voting hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(d)(ii): has the physical facilities necessary to accommodate early voting requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(d)(iii): has adequate space for voting equipment, poll workers, and voters; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(1)(d)(iv): has adequate security, public accessibility, and parking.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2): 20A-1-308; 20A-3a-604; 20A-1-308
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(a): 20A-1-308; 20A-3a-604 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(a)(i): if necessary, change the location of an early voting place; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(a)(ii): if the election officer determines that the number of early voting polling places is insufficient due to the number of registered voters who are voting, designate additional polling places during the early voting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(b): 20A-1-308 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(b)(i): to the lieutenant governor, for posting on the Statewide Voter Information Website;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(b)(ii): by posting the information on the website of the election officer, if available; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(b)(iii): by posting notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(b)(iii)(A): for a change in the location of an early voting polling place, at the new location and, if possible, the old location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(2)(b)(iii)(B): for an additional early voting polling place, at the additional early voting polling place.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-603(3): 20A-1-308 Except as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604 Notice of time and place of early voting.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604(2): (1) Instead of specifying all dates, times, and locations of early voting, a notice required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604(2)(a): the county's website;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604(2)(b): the physical address of the county's offices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604(2)(c): a mailing address and telephone number.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604(3): (1) The election officer shall include in the notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604(3)(a): the address of the Statewide Electronic Voter Information Website and, if available, the address of the election officer's website, with a statement indicating that the election officer will post on the website the location of each early voting polling place, including any changes to the location of an early voting polling place and the location of additional early voting polling places; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-604(3)(b): a phone number that a voter may call to obtain information regarding the location of an early voting polling place.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605 Exemptions from early voting.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605(1): (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605(1)(a): This part does not apply to an election of a board member of a special district.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605(1)(b): (1)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605(2): 20A-3a-601; 10-2-301 Notwithstanding the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605(2)(a): a municipal primary election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605(2)(b): a municipal general election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-605(3): A municipality is not required to conduct early voting for the election.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-701 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-701(1): "Election day voting center" means a polling place designated by an election officer to provide for voting on election day for an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-701(1)(a): is eligible to vote; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-701(1)(b): resides within the political subdivision holding the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-701(2): "Voting center ballot" means a regular ballot that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-701(2)(a): is provided at an election day voting center; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-701(2)(b): may be retrieved by the election official during the canvass if the voter cast a ballot at another location or before election day.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702 Election day voting center -- Hours of operation -- Compliance with Election Code.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(1): 20A-7-609.5; 20A-3a-703 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2): 20A-5-403; 20A-5-403 An election officer shall provide for voting at an election day voting center by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a): 20A-5-403 regular ballot if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a)(i): 20A-5-403
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a)(i)(A): 20A-5-403 the election day voting center is designated under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a)(i)(B): the voter is eligible to vote a regular ballot at the election day voting center in accordance with this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a)(ii)(A): the voter resides within the political subdivision holding the election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a)(ii)(B): the voter is otherwise eligible to vote a regular ballot in accordance with this title; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(a)(ii)(C): the jurisdiction holding the election uses a method that confirms that the voter has not voted previously in the election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(b): 20A-5-403 voting center ballot if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(b)(i): 20A-5-403 the election day voting center is not designated under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(b)(ii): the voter resides within the political subdivision holding the election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(b)(iii): the voter is otherwise eligible to vote a regular ballot in accordance with this title; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(2)(c): provisional ballot if the voter is only eligible to vote using a provisional ballot in accordance with this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(3): 20A-1-302; 20A-1-302 An election officer shall ensure that an election day voting center:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(3)(a): 20A-1-302 is open on election day during the time period specified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(3)(b): 20A-1-302 allows an eligible voter to vote if the voter:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(3)(b)(i): resides within the political subdivision holding an election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(3)(b)(ii): 20A-1-302 arrives at the election day voting center by the designated closing time in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(3)(c): is administered according to the requirements of this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-702(4): An individual may submit a completed manual ballot at an election day voting center for the political subdivision in which the individual resides.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703 Election day voting centers as polling places -- Location -- Notification.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1): (2); Chapter 5, Election Administration The election officer may designate one or more polling places as an election day voting center if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1)(a): (2) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1)(b): Chapter 5, Election Administration the polling place meets the requirements for a polling place under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1)(c): the polling place is located in a government building or office, unless the election officer determines that there is no government building or office available, in the area designated by the election officer, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1)(c)(i): can be scheduled for use during election day voting hours;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1)(c)(ii): has the physical facilities necessary to accommodate election day voting requirements;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1)(c)(iii): has adequate space for voting equipment, poll workers, and voters; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(1)(c)(iv): has adequate security, public accessibility, and parking.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2): (1)(a); 20A-1-308
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(a): (1)(a) The election officer may, after the deadline described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(a)(i): if necessary, change the location of an election day voting center; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(a)(ii): if the election officer determines that the number of election day voting centers is insufficient due to the number of registered voters who are voting, designate additional election day voting centers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(b): 20A-1-308 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(b)(i): to the lieutenant governor, for posting on the Statewide Electronic Voter Information Website;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(b)(ii): by posting the information on the website of the election officer, if available; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(b)(iii): by posting notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(b)(iii)(A): of a change in the location of an election day voting center, at the new location and, if possible, the old location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-703(2)(b)(iii)(B): of an additional election day voting center, at the additional election day voting center.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801 Watchers.
------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(1): As used in this section, "administering election officer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(1)(a): the election officer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(1)(b): if the election officer is the lieutenant governor, the county clerk of the county in which an individual will act as a watcher.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(2): (2)(a); (3); (4); (2)(c); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(2)(a): Any individual who is registered or preregistered to vote in Utah may become a watcher in an election at any time by registering as a watcher with the administering election officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(2)(b): (2)(a); (3) An individual who registers under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(2)(c): An individual who registers as a watcher shall notify the administering election officer of the dates, times, and locations that the individual intends to act as a watcher.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(2)(d): (4); (2)(c) An election official may not prohibit a watcher from performing a function described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(2)(e): (2) An administering election officer shall provide a copy of this section, or instructions on how to access an electronic copy of this section, to a watcher at the time the watcher registers under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(3): (2)(a); (3)(a); (4); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(3)(a): (2)(a) A person that is a candidate whose name will appear on the ballot, a qualified write-in candidate for the election, a registered political party, or a political issues committee may certify an individual as an official watcher for the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(3)(a)(i): by filing an affidavit with the administering election officer responsible to designate an individual as an official watcher for the certifying person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(3)(a)(ii): (2)(a) if the individual registers as a watcher under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(3)(b): (3)(a); (4) A watcher who is certified by a person under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(3)(c): (3)(a) A watcher who is certified by a person under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4): 20A-16-102; 20A-5-802; Title 20A, Chapter 4, Part 3, Canvassing Returns A watcher may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(a): observe the setup or takedown of a polling place;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(b): observe a voter checking in at a polling place;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(c): 20A-16-102 observe the collection, receipt, and processing of a ballot, including a provisional ballot or a ballot cast by a covered voter as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(d): observe the transport or transmission of a ballot that is in an election official's custody;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(e): observe the opening and inspection of a manual ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(f): observe ballot replication;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(g): 20A-5-802 observe the conduct of logic and accuracy testing described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(h): observe ballot tabulation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(i): observe the process of storing and securing a ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(j): observe a post-election audit;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(k): Title 20A, Chapter 4, Part 3, Canvassing Returns observe a canvassing board meeting described in
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(l): observe the certification of the results of an election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(m): observe a recount; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(4)(n): observe signature verification.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(5): (4); (4)(d); (k) An administering election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(5)(a): permit uniform, nondiscriminatory access for a watcher to observe each stage of an election process;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(5)(b): (4); (4)(d); (k) establish locations for a watcher to observe an event described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(5)(c): except for a county of the fourth, fifth, or sixth class, for any ballot adjudication, or upload of votes from a voting machine or scanner, that is conducted on a computer screen, project the activity onto a screen that is large enough to be viewed by each watcher.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(6): (4); (4); 20A-3a-803; (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(6)(a): (4); (4); 20A-3a-803 A watcher may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(6)(a)(i): (4) record an activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(6)(a)(ii): (4); 20A-3a-803 interfere with an activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(6)(a)(iii): divulge information related to the number of votes counted, tabulated, or cast for a candidate or ballot proposition until after the election officer makes the information public.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(6)(b): (6) A person who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7): (2)(a); (4); (4); (4); (6)(a)(i); (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7)(a): (2)(a); (4); (4); (4) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7)(a)(i): limit the number of watchers at a single location;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7)(a)(ii): remove a watcher for violating a provision of this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7)(a)(iii): (4) remove a watcher for interfering with an activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7)(a)(iv): (4) designate areas for a watcher to reasonably observe the activities described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7)(a)(v): ensure that a voter's ballot secrecy is protected throughout the watching process.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-3a-801(7)(b): (6)(a)(i); (3) If an administering election officer limits the number of watchers at a single location under Subsection
