Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401 Official register -- Preparation -- Contents.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1): (1)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(a): Before the registration days for each regular general, municipal general, regular primary, municipal primary, or presidential primary election, each county clerk shall prepare an official register of all voters that will participate in the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b): (1)(d) The county clerk shall ensure that the official register is prepared and contains the following for each registered voter:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(i): name;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(ii): party affiliation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(iii): an entry field for a voter challenge, including the name of the individual making the challenge and the grounds for the challenge;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(iv): election name and date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(v): date of birth;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(vi): place of current residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(vii): street address of current residence;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(viii): zip code;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(ix): (1)(d) identification and provisional ballot information as required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(b)(x): space for the voter to sign the voter's name for the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(c): When preparing the official register for the presidential primary election, the county clerk shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(c)(i): an entry field to record the name of the political party whose ballot the voter voted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(c)(ii): an entry field for the poll worker to record changes in the voter's party affiliation.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(d): When preparing the official register for any regular general election, municipal general election, statewide special election, local special election, regular primary election, municipal primary election, special district election, or election for federal office, the county clerk shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(d)(i): an entry field for the poll worker to record the type of identification provided by the voter;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(d)(ii): a space for the poll worker to record the provisional envelope ballot number for voters who receive a provisional ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(1)(d)(iii): a space for the poll worker to record the type of identification that was provided by voters who receive a provisional ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(2)(a)(i): For regular and municipal elections, primary elections, regular municipal elections, special district elections, and bond elections, the county clerk shall make an official register only for voting precincts affected by the primary, municipal, special district, or bond election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(2)(a)(ii): If a polling place to be used in a bond election serves both voters residing in the local political subdivision calling the bond election and voters residing outside of that local political subdivision, the official register shall designate whether each voter resides in or outside of the local political subdivision.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(2)(a)(iii): Each county clerk, with the assistance of the clerk of each affected special district, shall provide a detailed map or an indication on the registration list or other means to enable a poll worker to determine the voters entitled to vote at an election of special district officers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-401(2)(b): Municipalities shall pay the costs of making the official register for municipal elections.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403 Polling places -- Booths -- Ballot boxes -- Inspections -- Arrangements.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(1): 20A-7-609.5 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(1)(a): designate polling places for each voting precinct in the jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(1)(b): obtain the approval of the county or municipal legislative body or special district governing board for those polling places.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2): Part 1, Election Notices and Instructions; 20A-5-102
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(a): Part 1, Election Notices and Instructions; 20A-5-102 For each polling place, the election officer shall provide:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(a)(i): an American flag;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(a)(ii): a sufficient number of voting booths or compartments;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(a)(iii): the voting devices, voting booths, ballots, ballot boxes, and any other records and supplies necessary to enable a voter to vote;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(a)(iv): Part 1, Election Notices and Instructions the constitutional amendment cards required by
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(a)(v): 20A-5-102 the instructions required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(a)(vi): a sign, to be prominently displayed in the polling place, indicating that valid voter identification is required for every voter before the voter may vote and listing the forms of identification that constitute valid voter identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(b): Each election officer shall ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(b)(i): each voting booth is at a convenient height for writing, and is arranged so that the voter can prepare the voter's ballot screened from observation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(b)(ii): there are a sufficient number of voting booths or voting devices to accommodate the voters at that polling place; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(b)(iii): there is at least one voting booth or voting device that is configured to accommodate persons with disabilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(2)(c): Each county clerk shall provide a ballot box for each polling place that is large enough to properly receive and hold the ballots to be cast.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3)(a): All polling places shall be physically inspected by each county clerk to ensure access by a person with a disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3)(b): (3)(a) Any issues concerning inaccessibility to polling places by a person with a disability discovered during the inspections referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3)(b)(i): forwarded to the Office of the Lieutenant Governor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3)(b)(ii): within six months of the time of the complaint, the issue of inaccessibility shall be either:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3)(b)(ii)(A): remedied at the particular location by the county clerk;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3)(b)(ii)(B): the county clerk shall designate an alternative accessible location for the particular precinct; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(3)(b)(ii)(C): if no practical solution can be identified, file with the Office of the Lieutenant Governor a written explanation identifying the reasons compliance cannot reasonably be met.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(4)(a): The municipality in which the election is held shall pay the cost of conducting each municipal election, including the cost of printing and supplies.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(4)(b)(i): Costs assessed by a county clerk to a municipality under this section may not exceed the actual costs incurred by the county clerk.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(4)(b)(ii): The actual costs shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(4)(b)(ii)(A): costs of or rental fees associated with the use of election equipment and supplies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(4)(b)(ii)(B): reasonable and necessary administrative costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(5): The county clerk shall make detailed entries of all proceedings had under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(6): (6)(b); (6)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(6)(a): Each county clerk shall, to the extent possible, ensure that the amount of time that an individual waits in line before the individual can vote at a polling place in the county does not exceed 30 minutes.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(6)(b): The lieutenant governor may require a county clerk to submit a line management plan before the next election if an individual waits in line at a polling place in the county longer than 30 minutes before the individual can vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(6)(c): (6)(b) The lieutenant governor may consider extenuating circumstances in deciding whether to require the county clerk to submit a plan described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403(6)(d): (6)(b) The lieutenant governor shall review each plan submitted under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5 Ballot drop boxes -- Notice.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1): (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(vi); (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(vi); (1)(c); (1)(a)(iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a): (1)(a)(iv) An election officer:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(i): shall designate at least one ballot drop box in each municipality and reservation located in the jurisdiction to which the election relates;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(ii): may designate additional ballot drop boxes for the election officer's jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(iii): shall clearly mark each ballot drop box as an official ballot drop box for the election officer's jurisdiction;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(iv): shall provide 24-hour recorded video surveillance, without audio, of each unattended ballot drop box;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(v): shall post a sign on or near each unattended ballot drop box indicating that the ballot drop box is under 24-hour video surveillance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(vi): (1)(a)(iv) shall ensure that a camera, a video, or a recording of a video described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(vi)(A): by the election officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(vi)(B): by a custodian of the camera, video, or recording;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(vi)(C): by the lieutenant governor;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(vi)(D): by the legislative auditor general, when performing an audit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(a)(vi)(E): by, or pursuant to an order of, a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(b): (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(vi); (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(vi); (1)(c) An individual may not view a video, or a recording of a video, described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(b)(i): (1)(a)(vi) is an individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(b)(ii): (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(vi); (1)(c) views the video to the extent necessary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(b)(ii)(A): (1)(a)(iv); (1)(a)(vi); (1)(c) ensure compliance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(b)(ii)(B): investigate a concern relating to ballots or the ballot box.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(c): (1)(a)(iv) The election officer, or the custodian of the recording, shall keep a recording described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(c)(i): the end of the calendar year in which the election was held; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(1)(c)(ii): if the election is contested, when the contest is resolved.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(2): 20A-1-308; (5); (1); 63G-30-102 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(3): (2) Instead of including the location of ballot drop boxes, a notice required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(3)(a): the jurisdiction's website;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(3)(b): the physical address of the jurisdiction's offices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(3)(c): a mailing address and telephone number.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(4): (2) The election officer shall include in the notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(4)(a): the address of the Statewide Electronic Voter Information Website and, if available, the address of the election officer's website, with a statement indicating that the election officer will post on the website the location of each ballot drop box, including any changes to the location of a ballot drop box and the location of additional ballot drop boxes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(4)(b): a phone number that a voter may call to obtain information regarding the location of a ballot drop box.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5): 20A-1-308; (2); 20A-1-308
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(a): 20A-1-308; (2) Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(a)(i): if necessary, change the location of a ballot drop box; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(a)(ii): if the election officer determines that the number of ballot drop boxes is insufficient due to the number of registered voters who are voting, designate additional ballot drop boxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(b): 20A-1-308 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(b)(i): to the lieutenant governor, for posting on the Statewide Voter Information Website;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(b)(ii): by posting the information on the website of the election officer, if available; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(b)(iii): by posting notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(b)(iii)(A): for a change in the location of a ballot drop box, at the new location and, if possible, the old location; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(5)(b)(iii)(B): for an additional ballot drop box location, at the additional ballot drop box location.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(6): An election officer may, at any time, authorize two or more poll workers to remove a ballot drop box from a location, or to remove ballots from a ballot drop box for processing.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(7)(a): At least two poll workers must be present when a poll worker collects ballots from a ballot drop box and delivers the ballots to the location where the ballots will be opened and counted.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-403.5(7)(b): An election officer shall ensure that the chain of custody of ballots placed in a ballot box are recorded and tracked from the time the ballots are removed from the ballot box until the ballots are delivered to the location where the ballots will be opened and counted.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404 Election forms -- Preparation and contents.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
"We, the undersigned, judges of an election held at ______ voting precinct, in _______ County, state of Utah, on __________(month\day\year), having first been sworn according to law, certify that the information in this form is a true statement of the number and names of the individuals voting in the voting precinct at the election, and that the total number of individuals voting at the election was ____.Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(1)(a): For each election, the election officer shall prepare, for each polling place:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(1)(a)(i): forms for poll workers to record and verify security seals, ballots cast, and the number of voters who voted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(1)(a)(ii): an official register or pollbook.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(1)(b): For each election, the election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(1)(b)(i): provide a copy of each form to each of those precincts using paper ballots; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(1)(b)(ii): provide a copy of the ballot disposition form and a pollbook to each of those voting precincts using an automated voting system.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(2): (1)(a)(i) The election officer shall ensure that the forms described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(2)(a): a space for the judges to identify:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(2)(a)(i): the number of ballots voted;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(2)(a)(ii): the number of registered voters listed in the official register or pollbook; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(2)(a)(iii): the total number of voters voting according to the official register or pollbook; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(2)(b): a certification, in substantially the following form:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(3): The election officer shall ensure that the official register or pollbook:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(3)(a): identifies the voting precinct number on the face of the official register or pollbook; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(3)(b): contains:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(3)(b)(i): a section to record individuals voting on election day; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-404(3)(b)(ii): a section in which to record voters who are challenged.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405 Election officer to provide ballots -- Notice of sample ballot.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1): 20A-3a-601; 63G-30-102; 20A-5-102 An election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(a): provide ballots for every election of public officers in which the voters, or any of the voters, within the election officer's jurisdiction participate;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(b): cause the name of every candidate whose nomination has been certified to or filed with the election officer in the manner provided by law to be included on each ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(c): cause any ballot proposition that has qualified for the ballot as provided by law to be included on each ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(d): 20A-3a-601 ensure that the ballots are prepared and in the possession of the election officer at least seven days before the commencement of early voting as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(e): allow candidates and their agents and the sponsors of ballot propositions that have qualified for the official ballot to inspect the ballots;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(f): 63G-30-102 no later than 45 days before the day of the election, make sample ballots available for inspection, in the same form as official ballots and that contain the same information as official ballots, by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(f)(i): posting a copy of the sample ballot in the election officer's office;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(f)(ii): sending a copy of the sample ballot to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(f)(ii)(A): each candidate listed on the ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(f)(ii)(B): the lieutenant governor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(f)(iii): 63G-30-102 providing a copy of the sample ballot for the jurisdiction holding the election, as a class A notice under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(g): 20A-5-102 deliver a copy of the sample ballot to poll workers for each polling place and direct the poll workers to post the sample ballot as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(1)(h): print and deliver, at the expense of the jurisdiction conducting the election, enough ballots, sample ballots, and instructions to meet the voting demands of the qualified voters in each voting precinct.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(2): (1)(f)(iii) Instead of posting the entire sample ballot under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(2)(a): is entitled, "sample ballot";
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(2)(b): includes the following: "A sample ballot for [indicate name of jurisdiction] for the upcoming [indicate type and date of election] may be obtained from the following sources:"; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(2)(c): specifies the following sources where an individual may view or obtain a copy of the sample ballot:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(2)(c)(i): if the jurisdiction has a website, the jurisdiction's website;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(2)(c)(ii): the physical address of the jurisdiction's offices; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(2)(c)(iii): a mailing address and telephone number.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(3)(a): Each election officer shall, without delay, correct any error discovered in any ballot, if the correction can be made without interfering with the timely distribution of the ballots.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(3)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(3)(b)(i): If the election officer discovers an error or omission in a manual ballot, and it is not possible to correct the error or omission, the election officer shall direct the poll workers to make the necessary corrections on the manual ballots before the ballots are distributed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(3)(b)(ii): If the election officer discovers an error or omission in an electronic ballot and it is not possible to correct the error or omission by revising the electronic ballot, the election officer shall direct the poll workers to post notice of each error or omission with instructions on how to correct each error or omission in a prominent position at each polling booth.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(a): If the election officer refuses or fails to correct an error or omission in a ballot, a candidate or a candidate's agent may file a verified petition with the district court asserting that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(a)(i): an error or omission has occurred in:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(a)(i)(A): the publication of the name or description of a candidate;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(a)(i)(B): the preparation or display of an electronic ballot; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(a)(i)(C): the posting of sample ballots or the printing of official manual ballots; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(a)(ii): the election officer has failed to correct or provide for the correction of the error or omission.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(b): The district court shall issue an order requiring correction of any error in a ballot or an order to show cause why the error should not be corrected if it appears to the court that the error or omission has occurred and the election officer has failed to correct or provide for the correction of the error or omission.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-405(4)(c): A party aggrieved by the district court's decision may appeal the matter to the Utah Supreme Court within five days after the day on which the district court enters the decision.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406 Delivery of ballots.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(1): An election officer shall deliver manual ballots to the poll workers of each voting precinct in the election officer's jurisdiction in an amount sufficient to meet voting needs during the voting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2): For mechanical ballots, an election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(a): deliver the voting devices and mechanical ballots before voting commences at the polling place;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(b): ensure that the voting devices, equipment, and mechanical ballots are properly secured before commencement of voting;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(c): when mechanical ballots or voting devices containing mechanical ballots are delivered to a polling place, ensure that security procedures, developed by the election officer, are followed to document chain of custody and to prevent unauthorized access; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(d): repair or provide substitute voting devices, equipment, or electronic ballots, if available, if any poll worker reports that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(d)(i): the voting devices or equipment were not delivered on time;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(d)(ii): the voting devices or equipment do not contain the appropriate electronic ballot information;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(d)(iii): the safety devices on the voting devices, equipment, or electronic ballots appear to have been tampered with;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(d)(iv): the voting devices or equipment do not appear to be functioning properly; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-406(2)(d)(v): after delivery, the voting devices, equipment, or electronic ballots were destroyed or stolen.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-407 Election officer to provide ballot boxes.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-407(1): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-407(1)(a): provide one ballot box with a lock and key for each polling place; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-407(1)(b): deliver the ballot boxes, locks, and keys to the polling place before the polls open.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-407(2): An election officer for a municipality or special district may obtain ballot boxes from the county clerk's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-407(3): If locks and keys are unavailable, the election officer shall ensure that the ballot box lid is secured by tape.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-408 Disposition of election returns.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-408(1): Each election officer shall produce the packages containing the election returns before the board of canvassers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-408(2): 20A-4-202 As soon as the returns are canvassed, the election officer shall file the election returns and papers produced before the board as required by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-409 Certification of candidates to county clerks.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
No later than August 31 of each regular general election year, the lieutenant governor shall certify to each county clerk the name of each candidate qualified to be printed on the regular general election ballot for that county clerk's county.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410 Election officer to provide voting history information and status.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(1): As used in this section, "voting history record" means the information about the existence and status of absentee ballot requests required by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(2): 63G-2-302(1)(k); Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(2)(a): Each election officer shall maintain, in the election officer's office, a voting history record of those voters registered to vote in the election officer's jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(2)(b): 63G-2-302(1)(k); Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act Except as it relates to a voter whose voter registration record is classified as private under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(3): 20A-2-104(4)(h); (4)(a); 20A-2-104(4)(h); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(3)(a): 20A-2-104(4)(h); (4)(a) When an election officer reports voting history for an election, the election officer shall, for each voter whose voter registration is classified as private under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(3)(a)(i): (4)(a) for voting by mail, the information described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(3)(a)(ii): for early voting, the date the individual voted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(3)(a)(iii): for voting on election day, the date the individual voted.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(3)(b): 20A-2-104(4)(h); (3)(a) In relation to the information of a voter whose voter registration is classified as private under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4): The election officer shall ensure that the voting history record for each voting precinct contains:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4)(a): for voting by mail:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4)(a)(i): the date that the manual ballot was mailed to the voter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4)(a)(ii): the date that the voted manual ballot was received by the election officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4)(b): for early voting:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4)(b)(i): the name and address of each individual who participated in early voting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4)(b)(ii): the date the individual voted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(4)(c): for voting on election day, the name and address of each individual who voted on election day.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(5): 63G-2-204; 63G-2-203
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(5)(a): 63G-2-204 Notwithstanding the time limits for response to a request for records under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-410(5)(b): 63G-2-203 Notwithstanding the fee requirements of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601 Appointment of poll workers in elections where candidates are distinguished by registered political parties.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(1)(a): This section governs appointment of poll workers in elections where candidates are distinguished by registered political parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(1)(b): On or before March 1 of each even-numbered year, an election officer shall provide to the county chair of each registered political party a list of the number of poll workers that the party must nominate for each polling place.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(1)(c): On or before April 1 of each even-numbered year, the county chair and secretary of each registered political party shall file a list with the election officer containing the names of individuals in the county who are willing to serve as poll workers, who are qualified to serve as poll workers in accordance with this section, and who are competent and trustworthy.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(1)(d): The county chair and secretary shall submit names equal in number to the number required by the election officer, plus one.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(2): Each election officer shall provide for the appointment of individuals to serve as poll workers at each election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(3)(a): For each election, each election officer shall provide for the appointment of at least three registered voters, or one individual who is 16 or 17 years old and two registered voters, one of whom is at least 21 years old, from the list to serve as poll workers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(3)(b): An election officer may appoint additional poll workers, as needed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(4): For each set of three poll workers appointed for a polling place for an election, the election officer shall ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(4)(a): two poll workers are appointed from the political party that cast the highest number of votes for governor, lieutenant governor, attorney general, state auditor, and state treasurer, excluding votes for unopposed candidates, in the jurisdiction holding the election at the last regular general election before the appointment of the poll workers; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(4)(b): one poll worker is appointed from the political party that cast the second highest number of votes for governor, lieutenant governor, attorney general, state auditor, and state treasurer, excluding votes for unopposed candidates, in the county, city, or special district, as applicable, at the last regular general election before the appointment of the poll workers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(5): The election officer shall provide for the appointment of any qualified county voter as a poll worker when:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(5)(a): a political party fails to file the poll worker list by the filing deadline; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(5)(b): the list is incomplete.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(6): A registered voter of the county may serve as a poll worker at any polling place in the county, municipality, or district, as applicable.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(7): An election officer may not appoint a candidate's parent, sibling, spouse, child, mother-in-law, father-in-law, sister-in-law, brother-in-law, daughter-in-law, or son-in-law to serve as a poll worker in a polling place where the candidate appears on the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(8): The election officer shall fill all poll worker vacancies.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(9): If a conflict arises over the right to certify the poll worker lists for any political party, the election officer may decide between conflicting lists, but may only select names from a properly submitted list.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(10): The clerk shall establish compensation for poll workers.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-601(11): The election officer may appoint additional poll workers to serve in the polling place as needed.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602 Appointment of poll workers in elections where candidates are not distinguished by registered political parties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(1)(a): This section governs appointment of poll workers in elections where candidates are not distinguished by registered political parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(1)(b): An election officer shall appoint the poll worker at least 15 days before the date of the local election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(2)(a): The election officer shall appoint, or provide for the appointment of, at least three poll workers as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(2)(a)(i): three registered voters; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(2)(a)(ii): two registered voters, one of whom is at least 21 years old, and one individual who is 16 or 17 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(2)(b): The election officer may appoint additional poll workers to serve in the polling place as needed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(3): The election officer may not appoint any candidate's parent, sibling, spouse, child, mother-in-law, father-in-law, sister-in-law, brother-in-law, daughter-in-law, or son-in-law to serve as a poll worker at a polling place where the candidate appears on the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(4)(a): The clerk shall compensate poll workers for their services.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-602(4)(b): The clerk of a municipality or special district may not compensate poll workers at a rate higher than that paid by the county to the county's poll workers.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603 Vacancies -- Removal of poll workers.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(1)(a): If a poll worker or alternate is unable to serve, that poll worker or alternate shall immediately notify the election officer, who shall fill the vacancy as provided in this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(1)(b): The election officer may fill a vacancy occurring under this section by appointing the alternate to serve or, if that is impossible, by appointing some other qualified person to fill the vacancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2): The election officer shall summarily remove any poll worker who:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2)(a): neglects the poll worker's duty;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2)(b): commits or encourages fraud in connection with any election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2)(c): violates any election law;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2)(d): knowingly permits any person to violate any election law;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2)(e): has been convicted of a felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2)(f): commits any act that interferes or tends to interfere with a fair and honest election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-603(2)(g): is incapable of performing the duties of a poll worker.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605 Duties of poll workers.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(1): Poll workers shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(1)(a): arrive at the polling place at a time determined by the election officer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(1)(b): remain until the official election returns are prepared for delivery.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(2): The election officer may designate the title and duties of each poll worker.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3): Upon arriving to open the polls, the poll workers shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(a): display the United States flag;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(b): examine the voting devices to see that they are in proper working order and that security devices have not been tampered with;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(c): place the voting devices, voting booths, and the ballot box in plain view of those poll workers and watchers that are present;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(d): check the ballots, supplies, records, and forms;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(e): if directed by the election officer:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(e)(i): make any necessary corrections to the official ballots before the ballots are distributed at the polls;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(e)(ii): post any necessary notice of errors in ballots before voting commences; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(e)(iii): post a sample ballot, instructions to voters, and constitutional amendments, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(f): open the ballot box in the presence of those assembled, turn the ballot box upside down to empty the ballot box of anything; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(3)(g): immediately before the polls open, lock the ballot box or, if locks and keys are not available, tape the ballot box securely.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(4)(a): If any poll worker fails to appear on the morning of the election, or fails or refuses to act:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(4)(a)(i): at least six qualified electors who are present at the polling place at the hour designated by law for the opening of the polls shall fill the vacancy by appointing another qualified individual from the voting precinct who is a member of the same political party as the poll worker who is being replaced to act as a poll worker; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(4)(a)(ii): the election officer shall appoint a qualified individual to act as a poll worker.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(4)(b): If a majority of the poll workers are present, the poll workers shall open the polls, even though a poll worker has not arrived.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(5)(a): If it is impossible or inconvenient to hold an election at the polling place designated, the poll workers, after having assembled at or as near as practicable to the designated place, and before receiving any vote, may move to the nearest convenient place for holding the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(5)(b): If the poll workers move to a new polling place, the poll workers shall display a proclamation of the change and station a peace officer or some other proper individual at the original polling place to notify voters of the location of the new polling place.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(6): If, for any reason, the official ballots are not ready for distribution at a polling place or, if the supply of ballots is exhausted before the polls are closed, the poll workers may use unofficial ballots, made as nearly as possible in the form of the official ballot, until the election officer provides additional ballots.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(7): 20A-1-302; 20A-3a-602 When it is time to open the polls, one of the poll workers shall announce that the polls are open as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8): Chapter 3a, Voting
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8)(a): Chapter 3a, Voting The poll workers shall comply with the voting procedures and requirements of
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8)(b): The poll workers may not allow an individual, other than election officials and those admitted to vote, within six feet of voting devices, voting booths, or the ballot box.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8)(c): Besides the poll workers and watchers, the poll workers may not allow more than four voters in excess of the number of voting booths provided within six feet of voting devices, voting booths, or the ballot box.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8)(d): If necessary, the poll workers shall instruct each voter permitted to use a voting device how to operate the voting device before the voter enters the voting booth.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8)(e): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8)(e)(i): If the voter requests additional instructions after entering the voting booth, two poll workers may, if necessary, enter the booth and give the voter additional instructions.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-605(8)(e)(ii): In regular general elections and regular primary elections, the two poll workers who enter the voting booth to assist the voter shall be of different political parties.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-606 Closing the polls -- Preparation and delivery of election returns.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The election judges shall close the polls and prepare and deliver the election returns as provided in

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-701 Willful neglect of duty or corrupt conduct -- Penalty.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-701(1): It is unlawful for an election officer or poll worker to willfully neglect the election officer's or poll worker's duty or to willfully act corruptly in discharging the election officer's or poll worker's duty.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-701(2): An election officer or poll worker who violates this section is guilty of a third degree felony.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-702 Destroying or concealing ballots.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-702(1): It is unlawful for any person, or officer having charge of official ballots, to destroy, suppress, or conceal them, except authorized by this title.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-702(2): Any person who violates this section is guilty of a third degree felony.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-703 Neglect or refusal to deliver ballots or returns.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-703(1): It is unlawful for any person or officer who has undertaken to deliver official ballots or election returns to any voting precinct or to any poll worker or election officer to neglect, refuse, or fail to do so.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-703(2): Any person who violates this subsection is guilty of a class A misdemeanor and shall be imprisoned for not less than six months, and fined not less than $250.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-705 Officer or watcher revealing vote.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-705(1): It is unlawful for any election official or watcher to reveal to any other person the name of any candidate for whom a voter has voted, or to communicate to another the election official's or watcher's opinion, belief, or impression as to how or for whom a voter has voted.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-705(2): A person who violates this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-706 Damage, alteration, or theft of election equipment -- Penalty.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-706(1): It is unlawful for any person to intentionally or knowingly damage, modify, steal, tamper with, or destroy a voting device, voting equipment, or an automated voting system.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-706(2): Any person who violates this section is guilty of a third degree felony.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-801 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-801(1): "New voting equipment system" means voting equipment that is operated in a materially different way or that functions in a materially different way than the equipment being replaced.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-801(2): "Voting equipment" means the following equipment used for an election:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-801(2)(a): automatic tabulating equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-801(2)(b): a voting device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-801(2)(c): a voting machine.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802 Certification of voting equipment.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(1): (2) For the voting equipment used in the jurisdiction over which an election officer has authority, the election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(1)(a): before each election, use logic and accuracy tests to ensure that the voting equipment performs the voting equipment's functions accurately;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(1)(b): develop and implement a procedure to protect the physical security of the voting equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(1)(c): (2) ensure that the voting equipment is certified by the lieutenant governor under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2): (2)(b)(ii); (2)(a)(ii); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a); Title 20A, Chapter 4, Part 6, Municipal Alternate Voting Methods Pilot Project
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a): (2)(b)(ii); (2)(a)(ii); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(i): (2)(a)(ii) the lieutenant governor shall ensure that all voting equipment used in the state is independently tested using security testing protocols and standards that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(i)(A): are generally accepted in the industry at the time the lieutenant governor reviews the voting equipment for certification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(i)(B): (2)(a)(ii) meet the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a)(i) the testing protocols and standards described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(ii)(A): is accurate and reliable;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(ii)(B): possesses established and maintained access controls;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(ii)(C): has not been fraudulently manipulated or tampered with;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(ii)(D): is able to identify fraudulent or erroneous changes to the voting equipment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(ii)(E): protects the secrecy of a voter's ballot; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(iii): (2)(a) The lieutenant governor may comply with the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(iii)(A): the United States Election Assistance Commission; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(a)(iii)(B): a laboratory that has been accredited by the United States Election Assistance Commission to test voting equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(b): Title 20A, Chapter 4, Part 6, Municipal Alternate Voting Methods Pilot Project
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(b)(i): Voting equipment used in the state may include technology that allows for ranked-choice voting.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-802(2)(b)(ii): Title 20A, Chapter 4, Part 6, Municipal Alternate Voting Methods Pilot Project The lieutenant governor may, for voting equipment used for ranked-choice voting under


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803 Voting Equipment Selection Committee.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1): Before selecting or purchasing a new voting equipment system, the lieutenant governor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1)(a): appoint a Voting Equipment Selection Committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1)(b): ensure that the committee includes persons having experience in:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1)(b)(i): election procedures and administration;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1)(b)(ii): computer technology;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1)(b)(iii): data security;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1)(b)(iv): auditing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(1)(b)(v): access for persons with disabilities.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(2): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107; 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 A member may not receive compensation or benefits for the member's service, but may receive per diem and travel expenses in accordance with:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(2)(a): 63A-3-106 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(2)(b): 63A-3-107 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(2)(c): 63A-3-106; 63A-3-107 rules made by the Division of Finance pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(3): The lieutenant governor shall select a chair from the committee membership.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(4): The lieutenant governor may fill any vacancies that occur on the committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(5): The Office of the Lieutenant Governor shall provide staffing for the committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(6): The Voting Equipment Selection Committee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(6)(a): evaluate new voting equipment systems proposed for purchase by the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(6)(b): provide information and recommendations to assist the lieutenant governor with the purchase of new voting equipment systems.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(7): The lieutenant governor may designate individuals, including committee members, to inspect and review proprietary software as part of an evaluation of new voting equipment systems under consideration for purchase.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-803(8): Before making any selection or purchase, the lieutenant governor shall provide for a period of public review and comment on new voting equipment systems under consideration for purchase by the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901 Voter registration audit.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(1): The lieutenant governor shall, on at least an annual basis, conduct an audit of the voter registration database.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(2): The audit shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(2)(a): a random selection of at least .02% of the active registered voters statewide; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(2)(b): at least one active registered voter from each county.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(3): For each voter selected for the audit, the auditor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(3)(a): verify that the voter is eligible for registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(3)(b): verify that the voter's registration information is accurate and supported by the documentation on file;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(3)(c): verify that there is a signature on file for the voter;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(3)(d): check for duplicate voter registrations; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(3)(e): search available resources to determine whether the voter is deceased.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(4): The audit report shall identify areas of concern or training needed in response to the audit findings.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(5): (4) The lieutenant governor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(5)(a): (4) share the audit results with the county clerks and verify that the county clerks address the concerns and fulfill the training identified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-901(5)(b): beginning in 2023, report biennially to the Government Operations Interim Committee on the results of the audits conducted under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902 Security of election equipment.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902(1): Except when divesting election equipment as surplus property or providing for maintenance, an election officer may not permit an individual, other than an election official, access to election equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902(2): An election officer shall keep a record of service work done on voting equipment, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902(2)(a): a designation of the specific equipment serviced;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902(2)(b): the date of service;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902(2)(c): the names of all individuals who perform or supervise the service;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902(2)(d): the name of each vendor that performs the service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-902(2)(e): a description of the service performed.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903 Cyber security.
-----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(1): An election officer shall ensure that the following election equipment is never connected to the Internet:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(1)(a): tabulation servers;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(1)(b): tabulation equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(1)(c): ballot scanners, including central, precinct, and mobile scanners; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(1)(d): ballot marking devices.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(2): Title 20A, Chapter 16, Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act; 20A-6-103 This section does not prohibit Internet connection of equipment used for voting if the equipment's use of voting is solely for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(2)(a): Title 20A, Chapter 16, Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act complying with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-903(2)(b): 20A-6-103 administering the Internet Voting Pilot Project, described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-904 Voter fraud.
--------------------------------------------
An election officer shall:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-904(1): check available resources to determine whether an individual registers to vote, or votes, in more than one state or precinct; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-904(2): report the information to law enforcement or a prosecutor if the election officer has reason to believe that an individual has intentionally committed election fraud.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-905 Software validation -- Database security.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-905(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Before November 2022, the director of elections within the Office of the Lieutenant Governor shall make rules, in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-905(2): The lieutenant governor and each county clerk shall ensure that a record is made, and stored for at least 22 months, of each time a voter database is accessed by a person, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-905(2)(a): the name of the person accessing the voter database;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-905(2)(b): the date and time of the access; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-5-905(2)(c): any changes made to the voter database.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 20A - Chapter 6 - Ballot Form
*********************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101 General requirements for manual ballots.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101(1): 20A-9-601 An election officer shall ensure that manual ballots:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101(1)(a): are printed using precisely the same quality and tint of plain white paper through which the printing or writing cannot be seen;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101(1)(b): are printed using precisely the same quality and kind of type;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101(1)(c): are printed using precisely the same quality and tint of plain black ink;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101(1)(d): are uniform in size for all the voting precincts within the election officer's jurisdiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101(1)(e): 20A-9-601 include, on a ticket for a race in which a voter is authorized to cast a write-in vote and in which a write-in candidate is qualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-101(2): Whenever the vote for candidates is to be limited to the voters of a particular political division, the election officer shall ensure that the names of those candidates are printed only upon those ballots provided to that political division.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102 General requirements for machine counted ballots.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(1): An election officer shall ensure that ballots are printed:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(1)(a): to a size and arrangement that fits the construction of the ballot counting device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(1)(b): in plain, clear type in black ink on clear white stock; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(1)(c): in plain, clear type in black ink on stock of different colors if it is necessary to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(1)(c)(i): identify different ballots or parts of the ballot; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(1)(c)(ii): differentiate between political parties.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(2): 20A-9-601 For a race in which a voter is authorized to cast a write-in vote and in which a write-in candidate is qualified under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-102(3): Notwithstanding any other provisions of this section, the election officer may authorize any ballots that are to be counted by means of electronic or electromechanical devices to be printed to a size, layout, texture, and in any type of ink or combination of inks that will be suitable for use in the counting devices in which they are intended to be placed.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-103 Internet voting pilot project.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Notwithstanding any provision of this title to the contrary, a county may allow a covered voter, as defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105 Provisional ballot envelopes.
-------------------------------------------------------------
"AFFIRMATIONUtah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105(1): 20A-3a-506; 20A-2-401 Each election officer shall ensure that provisional ballot envelopes are printed in substantially the following form:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105(2): 20A-6-105.5; 20A-3a-401.5 The provisional ballot envelope shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105(2)(a): a unique number;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105(2)(b): a detachable part that includes the unique number;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105(2)(c): 20A-6-105.5 a telephone number, internet address, or other indicator of a means, in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105(2)(d): 20A-3a-401.5 an insert containing written instructions on how a voter may sign up to receive ballot status notifications via the ballot tracking system described in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-105.5 Voter access to provisional ballot information.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Each county clerk shall implement, through an internet website, toll-free telephone number, or other means, a system where an individual who voted a provisional ballot may, free of charge, determine if the voter's vote was counted, and, if the vote was not counted, the reason the vote was not counted.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-106 Deadline for submission of ballot titles.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unless otherwise specifically provided for by statute, the certified ballot title of each ballot proposition, ballot question, or ballot issue shall be submitted to the election officer before 5 p.m. no later than 65 days before the date of the election at which the matter will be submitted to the voters.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107 Numbering of ballot propositions and bond propositions -- Duties of election officer and lieutenant governor.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(1): (1)(b); (1)(c); 11-14-206
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(1)(a): (1)(b); (1)(c) Except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(1)(b): Each proposed amendment to the Utah Constitution shall be listed on the ballot under the heading "Constitutional Amendment ___", with a letter placed in the blank.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(1)(c): 11-14-206 Each bond proposition that has qualified for the ballot shall be listed on the ballot under the title assigned to each bond proposition under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2): (2)(b)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2)(a): When an election officer or other person given authority to prepare or number ballot propositions receives a ballot proposition that is eligible for inclusion on the ballot, they shall ask the lieutenant governor to assign a number to the ballot proposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2)(b): (2)(b)(iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2)(b)(i): (2)(b)(iii) Upon request from an election officer or other person given authority to prepare or number ballot propositions, the lieutenant governor shall assign each ballot proposition a unique number, except as provided under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2)(b)(ii): Ballot proposition numbers shall be assigned sequentially, in the order requests for ballot proposition numbers are received.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2)(b)(iii): The same ballot proposition number may be assigned to multiple ballot propositions if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2)(b)(iii)(A): the sponsors of each ballot proposition agree, in writing, to share the number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-6-107(2)(b)(iii)(B): the ballot propositions sharing the same number are identical in their terms, purpose, and effect, with jurisdiction being the only significant difference between the ballot propositions.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
