Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(27)(b): declares oneself to be a candidate for, or actively campaigns for, the position of speaker of the House of Representatives, president of the Senate, or the leader, whip, and assistant whip of any party caucus in either house of the Legislature; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(27)(c): receives contributions, makes expenditures, or gives consent for any other person to receive contributions or make expenditures to bring about the person's nomination, election, or appointment to a legislative office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(28): "Loan" means any of the following provided by a person that benefits a filing entity if the person expects repayment or reimbursement:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(28)(a): an expenditure made using any form of payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(28)(b): money or funds received by the filing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(28)(c): the provision of a good or service with an agreement or understanding that payment or reimbursement will be delayed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(28)(d): use of any line of credit.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(29): "Major political party" means either of the two registered political parties that have the greatest number of members elected to the two houses of the Legislature.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(30): "Officeholder" means a person who holds a public office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(31): "Party committee" means any committee organized by or authorized by the governing board of a registered political party.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(32): 20A-11-1501 "Person" means both natural and legal persons, including individuals, business organizations, personal campaign committees, party committees, political action committees, political issues committees, and labor organizations, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(33): "Personal campaign committee" means the committee appointed by a candidate to act for the candidate as provided in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(34): 20A-11-104 "Personal use expenditure" has the same meaning as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(a): "Political action committee" means an entity, or any group of individuals or entities within or outside this state, a major purpose of which is to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(a)(i): solicit or receive contributions from any other person, group, or entity for political purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(a)(ii): make expenditures to expressly advocate for any person to refrain from voting or to vote for or against any candidate or person seeking election to a municipal or county office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(b): "Political action committee" includes groups affiliated with a registered political party but not authorized or organized by the governing board of the registered political party that receive contributions or makes expenditures for political purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(c): "Political action committee" does not mean:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(c)(i): a party committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(c)(ii): any entity that provides goods or services to a candidate or committee in the regular course of its business at the same price that would be provided to the general public;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(c)(iii): an individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(c)(iv): individuals who are related and who make contributions from a joint checking account;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(c)(v): a corporation, except a corporation a major purpose of which is to act as a political action committee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(35)(c)(vi): a personal campaign committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(36): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(36)(a): "Political consultant" means a person who is paid by a reporting entity, or paid by another person on behalf of and with the knowledge of the reporting entity, to provide political advice to the reporting entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(36)(b): "Political consultant" includes a circumstance described in Subsection (36)(a), where the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(36)(b)(i): has already been paid, with money or other consideration;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(36)(b)(ii): expects to be paid in the future, with money or other consideration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(36)(b)(iii): understands that the person may, in the discretion of the reporting entity or another person on behalf of and with the knowledge of the reporting entity, be paid in the future, with money or other consideration.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(37): "Political convention" means a county or state political convention held by a registered political party to select candidates.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(38): "Political entity" means a candidate, a political party, a political action committee, or a political issues committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(a): "Political issues committee" means an entity, or any group of individuals or entities within or outside this state, a major purpose of which is to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(a)(i): solicit or receive donations from any other person, group, or entity to assist in placing a ballot proposition on the ballot, assist in keeping a ballot proposition off the ballot, or to advocate that a voter refrain from voting or vote for or vote against any ballot proposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(a)(ii): make expenditures to expressly advocate for any person to sign or refuse to sign a ballot proposition or incorporation petition or refrain from voting, vote for, or vote against any proposed ballot proposition or an incorporation in an incorporation election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(a)(iii): make expenditures to assist in qualifying or placing a ballot proposition on the ballot or to assist in keeping a ballot proposition off the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b): "Political issues committee" does not mean:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(i): a registered political party or a party committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(ii): any entity that provides goods or services to an individual or committee in the regular course of its business at the same price that would be provided to the general public;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(iii): an individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(iv): individuals who are related and who make contributions from a joint checking account;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(v): a corporation, except a corporation a major purpose of which is to act as a political issues committee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(vi): a group of individuals who:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(vi)(A): associate together for the purpose of challenging or supporting a single ballot proposition, ordinance, or other governmental action by a county, city, town, special district, special service district, or other local political subdivision of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(vi)(B): have a common liberty, property, or financial interest that is directly impacted by the ballot proposition, ordinance, or other governmental action;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(vi)(C): do not associate together, for the purpose described in Subsection (39)(b)(vi)(A), via a legal entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(vi)(D): do not receive funds for challenging or supporting the ballot proposition, ordinance, or other governmental action from a person other than an individual in the group; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(39)(b)(vi)(E): do not expend a total of more than $5,000 for the purpose described in Subsection (39)(b)(vi)(A).
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(a): "Political issues contribution" means any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(a)(i): a gift, subscription, unpaid or partially unpaid loan, advance, or deposit of money or anything of value given to a political issues committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(a)(ii): an express, legally enforceable contract, promise, or agreement to make a political issues donation to influence the approval or defeat of any ballot proposition;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(a)(iii): any transfer of funds received by a political issues committee from a reporting entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(a)(iv): compensation paid by another reporting entity for personal services rendered without charge to a political issues committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(a)(v): goods or services provided to or for the benefit of a political issues committee at less than fair market value.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(b): "Political issues contribution" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(b)(i): services provided without compensation by individuals volunteering a portion or all of their time on behalf of a political issues committee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(40)(b)(ii): money lent to a political issues committee by a financial institution in the ordinary course of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a): "Political issues expenditure" means any of the following when made by a political issues committee or on behalf of a political issues committee by an agent of the reporting entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(i): any payment from political issues contributions made for the purpose of influencing the approval or the defeat of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(i)(A): a ballot proposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(i)(B): an incorporation petition or incorporation election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(ii): a purchase, payment, distribution, loan, advance, deposit, or gift of money made for the express purpose of influencing the approval or the defeat of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(ii)(A): a ballot proposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(ii)(B): an incorporation petition or incorporation election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(iii): an express, legally enforceable contract, promise, or agreement to make any political issues expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(iv): compensation paid by a reporting entity for personal services rendered by a person without charge to a political issues committee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(a)(v): goods or services provided to or for the benefit of another reporting entity at less than fair market value.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(b): "Political issues expenditure" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(b)(i): services provided without compensation by individuals volunteering a portion or all of their time on behalf of a political issues committee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(41)(b)(ii): money lent to a political issues committee by a financial institution in the ordinary course of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(42): "Political purposes" means an act done with the intent or in a way to influence or tend to influence, directly or indirectly, any person to refrain from voting or to vote for or against any:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(42)(a): candidate or a person seeking a municipal or county office at any caucus, political convention, or election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(42)(b): judge standing for retention at any election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(43): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(43)(a): "Poll" means the survey of a person regarding the person's opinion or knowledge of an individual who has filed a declaration of candidacy for public office, or of a ballot proposition that has legally qualified for placement on the ballot, which is conducted in person or by telephone, facsimile, Internet, postal mail, or email.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(43)(b): "Poll" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(43)(b)(i): a ballot; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(43)(b)(ii): an interview of a focus group that is conducted, in person, by one individual, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(43)(b)(ii)(A): the focus group consists of more than three, and less than thirteen, individuals; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(43)(b)(ii)(B): all individuals in the focus group are present during the interview.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(44): "Primary election" means any regular primary election held under the election laws.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(45): "Publicly identified class of individuals" means a group of 50 or more individuals sharing a common occupation, interest, or association that contribute to a political action committee or political issues committee and whose names can be obtained by contacting the political action committee or political issues committee upon whose financial statement the individuals are listed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(46): "Public office" means the office of governor, lieutenant governor, state auditor, state treasurer, attorney general, state school board member, state senator, state representative, speaker of the House of Representatives, president of the Senate, and the leader, whip, and assistant whip of any party caucus in either house of the Legislature.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(a): "Public service assistance" means the following when given or provided to an officeholder to defray the costs of functioning in a public office or aid the officeholder to communicate with the officeholder's constituents:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(a)(i): a gift, subscription, donation, unpaid or partially unpaid loan, advance, or deposit of money or anything of value to an officeholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(a)(ii): goods or services provided at less than fair market value to or for the benefit of the officeholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(b): "Public service assistance" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(b)(i): anything provided by the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(b)(ii): services provided without compensation by individuals volunteering a portion or all of their time on behalf of an officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(b)(iii): money lent to an officeholder by a financial institution in the ordinary course of business;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(b)(iv): news coverage or any publication by the news media; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(47)(b)(v): any article, story, or other coverage as part of any regular publication of any organization unless substantially all the publication is devoted to information about the officeholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(48): "Receipts" means contributions and public service assistance.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(49): "Registered lobbyist" means a person licensed under Title 36, Chapter 11, Lobbyist Disclosure and Regulation Act.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(50): "Registered political action committee" means any political action committee that is required by this chapter to file a statement of organization with the Office of the Lieutenant Governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(51): "Registered political issues committee" means any political issues committee that is required by this chapter to file a statement of organization with the Office of the Lieutenant Governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(52): "Registered political party" means an organization of voters that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(52)(a): participated in the last regular general election and polled a total vote equal to 2% or more of the total votes cast for all candidates for the United States House of Representatives for any of its candidates for any office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(52)(b): has complied with the petition and organizing procedures of Chapter 8, Political Party Formation and Procedures.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(a): "Remuneration" means a payment:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(a)(i): made to a legislator for the period the Legislature is in session; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(a)(ii): that is approximately equivalent to an amount a legislator would have earned during the period the Legislature is in session in the legislator's ordinary course of business.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(b): "Remuneration" does not mean anything of economic value given to a legislator by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(b)(i): the legislator's primary employer in the ordinary course of business; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(b)(ii): a person or entity in the ordinary course of business:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(b)(ii)(A): because of the legislator's ownership interest in the entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(53)(b)(ii)(B): for services rendered by the legislator on behalf of the person or entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(54): 20A-11-1501 "Reporting entity" means a candidate, a candidate's personal campaign committee, a judge, a judge's personal campaign committee, an officeholder, a party committee, a political action committee, a political issues committee, a corporation, or a labor organization, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(55): "School board office" means the office of state school board.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(56): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(56)(a): "Source" means the person or entity that is the legal owner of the tangible or intangible asset that comprises the contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(56)(b): "Source" means, for political action committees and corporations, the political action committee and the corporation as entities, not the contributors to the political action committee or the owners or shareholders of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(57): "State office" means the offices of governor, lieutenant governor, attorney general, state auditor, and state treasurer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(58): "State office candidate" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(58)(a): files a declaration of candidacy for a state office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(58)(b): receives contributions, makes expenditures, or gives consent for any other person to receive contributions or make expenditures to bring about the person's nomination, election, or appointment to a state office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(59): "Summary report" means the year end report containing the summary of a reporting entity's contributions and expenditures.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101(60): "Supervisory board" means the individual or group of individuals that allocate expenditures from a political issues committee.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3 Detailed listing and report requirements -- Rulemaking authority.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(a): "Advertising" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(a)(i): website development and maintenance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(a)(ii): social media;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(a)(iii): television, newspaper, or radio; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(a)(iv): a convention booth.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(b): "Association expense" means a membership fee for:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(b)(i): a political association; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(b)(ii): an association related to an activity of a candidate or an officeholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c): "Campaign Expense" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(i): district mapping;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(ii): voter data;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(iii): a phone bank;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(iv): fund-raising expenses;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(v): campaign assistance or consulting;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(vi): campaign technology;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(vii): campaign management;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(viii): campaign interns; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(ix): food, and related expenses, purchased:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(ix)(A): for a campaign event; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(c)(ix)(B): for consumption by a candidate or campaign staff while conducting work relating to a campaign.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(d): "Donations" includes giving to a charitable organization.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(e): "Loans" includes repaying loans.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f): "Office expense" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(i): an email server;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(ii): phones;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(iii): phone service;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(iv): computers;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(v): printers;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(vi): furniture;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(vii): tools and hardware; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(f)(viii): food, and related expenses, purchased for consumption during an officeholder activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(g): "Political support" includes contributions made to other candidates or political action committees.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h): "Supplies" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(i): signs;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(ii): sign holders;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(iii): parade supplies;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(iv): t-shirts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(v): other campaign goods;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(vi): repair or replacement of clothing that is damaged while the candidate or officeholder is engaged in an activity of a candidate or an officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(vii): printed materials; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(h)(viii): postage.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(i): "Travel expenses" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(i)(i): political conference registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(i)(ii): airfare;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(i)(iii): hotels;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(i)(iv): food, and related expenses, purchased for consumption during travel;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(i)(v): vehicle mileage reimbursement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(1)(i)(vi): incidental expenses while traveling.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2): (2)(a); (l) As it relates to an expenditure, a detailed listing includes identifying the expenditure as falling within one of the following categories:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(a): advertising;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(b): association expense;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(c): campaign expense;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(d): constituent services;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(e): donations;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(f): loans;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(g): office;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(h): political support;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(i): return of a contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(j): signature gathering;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(k): supplies;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(l): travel expenses; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(2)(m): (2)(a); (l) other expenditures that do not fall within a category described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.3(3): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The director of elections, within the Lieutenant Governor's Office, may make rules, in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.5 Disclosure of actual source or recipient required.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.5(1): As used in this section, "transactional intermediary" means a person, including a credit card company, a financial institution, or a money transfer service, that pays or transfers money to a person on behalf of another person.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.5(2): When, under this chapter, a person makes a detailed listing, discloses or reports the source of a contribution, discloses or reports the person or entity to whom a disbursement is made, or discloses or reports the identity of a donor, the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.5(2)(a): shall reveal the actual source of the contribution, the actual person or entity to whom the disbursement is ultimately made, or the actual identity of the donor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.5(2)(b): may not merely list, disclose, or report the transactional intermediary.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.7 Concealing contributor's identity.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
A person is guilty of a class B misdemeanor if the person conspires with another to make a contribution through one or more persons with the intent that:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.7(1): the contribution will ultimately be made to a filing entity specified by the original contributor or a designee of the original contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-101.7(2): by making the contribution through one or more persons, the original contributor's identity will not be disclosed in a manner that would be required by law.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103 Notice of pending interim and summary reports -- Form of submission -- Public availability -- Notice of reporting and filing requirements.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1): 20A-7-204.1; 20A-11-1501
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(a): Except as provided under Subsection (1)(b), 10 days before an interim report or summary report is due under this chapter or Chapter 12, Part 2, Judicial Retention Elections, the chief election officer shall inform the filing entity by electronic mail unless postal mail is requested:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(a)(i): that the financial statement is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(a)(ii): of the date that the financial statement is due; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(a)(iii): of the penalty for failing to file the financial statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(b): 20A-7-204.1; 20A-11-1501 The chief election officer is not required to provide notice:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(b)(i): to a candidate or political party of the financial statement that is due before the candidate's or political party's political convention;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(b)(ii): 20A-7-204.1 of a financial statement due in connection with a public hearing for an initiative under the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(1)(b)(iii): 20A-11-1501 to a corporation or labor organization, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(2): A filing entity shall electronically file a financial statement via electronic mail or the Internet according to specifications established by the chief election officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(3)(a): A financial statement is considered timely filed if the financial statement is received by the chief election officer's office before midnight, Mountain Time, at the end of the day on which the financial statement is due.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(3)(b): For a county clerk's office that is not open until midnight at the end of the day on which a financial statement is due, the county clerk shall permit a candidate to file the financial statement via email or another electronic means designated by the county clerk.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(3)(c): A chief election officer may extend the time in which a filing entity is required to file a financial statement if a filing entity notifies the chief election officer of the existence of an extenuating circumstance that is outside the control of the filing entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(4): 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5; 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5 Notwithstanding any provision of Title 63G, Chapter 2, Government Records Access and Management Act, the lieutenant governor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(4)(a): make each campaign finance statement filed by a candidate available for public inspection and copying no later than one business day after the statement is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(4)(b): 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5; 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5 post on a website established by the lieutenant governor:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(4)(b)(i): an electronic copy or the contents of each summary report or interim report filed under the requirements of this chapter or Chapter 12, Part 2, Judicial Retention Elections, no later than three business days after the date on which the summary report or interim report is electronically filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(4)(b)(ii): 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5; 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5 for a campaign finance statement filed under the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(4)(b)(ii)(A): 10-3-208 the municipal clerk or recorder, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(4)(b)(ii)(B): 17-16-6.5 the county clerk, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-103(5): Between January 1 and January 15 of each year, the chief election officer shall provide notice, by postal mail or email, to each filing entity for which the chief election officer has a physical or email address, of the reporting and filing requirements described in this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104 Personal use expenditure -- Authorized and prohibited uses of campaign funds -- Enforcement -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(a): As used in this chapter, "personal use expenditure" means an expenditure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(a)(i)(A): is not excluded from the definition of personal use expenditure by Subsection (2); and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(a)(i)(B): primarily furthers a personal interest of a candidate or officeholder or a candidate's or officeholder's family, which interest is not connected with the performance of an activity as a candidate or an activity or duty of an officeholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(a)(ii): would likely cause the candidate or officeholder to recognize the expenditure as taxable income under federal or state law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b): "Personal use expenditure" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(i): a mortgage, rent, utility, or vehicle payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(ii): a household food item or supply;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(iii): a clothing expense, except:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(iii)(A): clothing bearing the candidate's name or campaign slogan or logo that is used in the candidate's campaign;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(iii)(B): clothing bearing the logo or name of a jurisdiction, district, government organization, government entity, caucus, or political party that the officeholder represents or of which the officeholder is a member; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(iii)(C): repair or replacement of clothing that is damaged while the candidate or officeholder is engaged in an activity of a candidate or officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(iv): an admission to a sporting, artistic, or recreational event or other form of entertainment;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(v): dues, fees, or gratuities at a country club, health club, or recreational facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(vi): a salary payment made to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(vi)(A): a candidate or officeholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(vi)(B): a person who has not provided a bona fide service to a candidate or officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(vii): a vacation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(viii): a vehicle expense;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(ix): a meal expense;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(x): a travel expense;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(xi): a payment of an administrative, civil, or criminal penalty;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(xii): a satisfaction of a personal debt;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(xiii): a personal service, including the service of an attorney, accountant, physician, or other professional person;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(xiv): a membership fee for a professional or service organization; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(1)(b)(xv): a payment in excess of the fair market value of the item or service purchased.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2): 63A-3-107; 59-13-102; 13-22-2; 13-22-2 As used in this chapter, "personal use expenditure" does not include an expenditure made:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(a): for a political purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(b): for candidacy for public office;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(c): to fulfill a duty or activity of an officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(d): for a donation to a registered political party;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(e): for a contribution to another candidate's campaign account, including sponsorship of or attendance at an event, the primary purpose of which is to solicit a contribution for another candidate's campaign account;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(f): to return all or a portion of a contribution to a contributor;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g): 63A-3-107; 59-13-102 for the following items, if made in connection with the candidacy for public office or an activity or duty of an officeholder:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(i): 63A-3-107; 59-13-102
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(i)(A): 63A-3-107 a mileage allowance at the rate established by the Division of Finance under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(i)(B): 59-13-102 for motor fuel or special fuel, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(ii): a food expense, including food or beverages:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(ii)(A): served at a campaign event;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(ii)(B): served at a charitable event;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(ii)(C): consumed, or provided to others, by a candidate while the candidate is engaged in campaigning;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(ii)(D): consumed, or provided to others, by an officeholder while the officeholder is acting in the capacity of an officeholder; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(ii)(E): provided as a gift to an individual who works on a candidate's campaign or who assists an officeholder in the officeholder's capacity as an officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(iii): a travel expense of a candidate, if the primary purpose of the travel is related to the candidate's campaign, including airfare, car rental, other transportation, hotel, or other expenses incidental to the travel;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(iv): a travel expense of an individual assisting a candidate, if the primary purpose of the travel by the individual is to assist the candidate with the candidate's campaign, including an expense described in Subsection (2)(g)(iii);
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(v): a travel expense of an officeholder, if the primary purpose of the travel is related to an activity or duty of the officeholder, including an expense described in Subsection (2)(g)(iii);
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(vi): a travel expense of an individual assisting an officeholder, if the primary purpose of the travel by the individual is to assist the officeholder in an activity or duty of an officeholder, including an expense described in Subsection (2)(g)(iii);
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(vii): a payment for a service provided by an attorney or accountant;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(viii): a tuition payment or registration fee for participation in a meeting or conference;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(ix): a gift;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(x): a payment for the following items in connection with an office space:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(x)(A): rent;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(x)(B): utilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(x)(C): a supply; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(x)(D): furnishing;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(xi): a booth at a meeting or event;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(xii): educational material; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(g)(xiii): an item purchased for a purpose related to a campaign or to an activity or duty of an officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(h): to purchase or mail informational material, a survey, or a greeting card;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(i): 13-22-2; 13-22-2 for a donation to a charitable organization, as defined by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(j): to repay a loan a candidate makes from the candidate's personal account to the candidate's campaign account;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(k): to pay membership dues to a national organization whose primary purpose is to address general public policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(l): for admission to or sponsorship of an event, the primary purpose of which is to promote the social, educational, or economic well-being of the state or the candidate's or officeholder's community;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(m): for one or more guests of an officeholder or candidate to attend an event, meeting, or conference described in this Subsection (2), including related travel expenses and other expenses, if attendance by the guest is for a primary purpose described in Subsection (2)(g)(iv) or (vi); or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(n): to pay childcare expenses of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(n)(i): a candidate while the candidate is engaging in campaign activity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(2)(n)(ii): an officeholder while the officeholder is engaging in the duties of an officeholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3)(a): The lieutenant governor shall enforce this chapter prohibiting a personal use expenditure by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3)(a)(i): evaluating a financial statement to identify a personal use expenditure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3)(a)(ii): commencing an informal adjudicative proceeding in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act, if the lieutenant governor has probable cause to believe a candidate or officeholder has made a personal use expenditure.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3)(b): Following the proceeding, the lieutenant governor may issue a signed order requiring a candidate or officeholder who has made a personal use expenditure to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3)(b)(i): remit an administrative penalty of an amount equal to 50% of the personal use expenditure to the lieutenant governor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3)(b)(ii): deposit the amount of the personal use expenditure in the campaign account from which the personal use expenditure was disbursed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-104(3)(c): The lieutenant governor shall deposit money received under Subsection (3)(b)(i) in the General Fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-105 Deadline for payment of fine.
--------------------------------------------------------------
A person against whom the lieutenant governor imposes a fine under this chapter shall pay the fine before 5 p.m. within 30 days after the day on which the lieutenant governor imposes the fine.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201 State office -- Separate bank account for campaign funds -- No personal use -- State office candidate reporting deadline -- Report other accounts -- Anonymous contributions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(a): Each state office candidate or the candidate's personal campaign committee shall deposit each contribution received in one or more separate campaign accounts in a financial institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(b): A state office candidate or a candidate's personal campaign committee may not use money deposited in a campaign account for:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(b)(i): a personal use expenditure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(b)(ii): an expenditure prohibited by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(c): Each state officeholder or the state officeholder's personal campaign committee shall deposit each contribution and public service assistance received in one or more separate campaign accounts in a financial institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(d): A state officeholder or a state officeholder's personal campaign committee may not use money deposited in a campaign account for:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(d)(i): a personal use expenditure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(1)(d)(ii): an expenditure prohibited by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(2)(a): A state office candidate or the candidate's personal campaign committee may not deposit or mingle any contributions received into a personal or business account.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(2)(b): A state officeholder or the state officeholder's personal campaign committee may not deposit or mingle any contributions or public service assistance received into a personal or business account.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(3): 20A-11-203; 20A-11-205 If a person who is no longer a state office candidate chooses not to expend the money remaining in a campaign account, the person shall continue to file the year-end summary report required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(4): (4)(b); 20A-11-402
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(4)(a): (4)(b); 20A-11-402 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(4)(b): A person who is no longer a state office candidate may transfer the money in a campaign account in a manner that would cause the former state office candidate to recognize the money as taxable income under federal tax law if the transfer is made to a campaign account for federal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5): (5); 20A-11-204(1)(b); (5)(b)(ii); (5)(d); (5)(b); (5)(b); (5)(b); (5)(c); (5)(c); (5)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(a): (5); 20A-11-204(1)(b) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(b): (5)(b)(ii) Each state office candidate shall report to the lieutenant governor each contribution received by the state office candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(b)(i): (5)(b)(ii) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(b)(ii): within seven business days after the day on which the contribution is received, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(b)(ii)(A): the state office candidate is contested in a convention and the contribution is received within 30 days before the day on which the convention is held;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(b)(ii)(B): the state office candidate is contested in a primary election and the contribution is received within 30 days before the day on which the primary election is held; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(b)(ii)(C): the state office candidate is contested in a general election and the contribution is received within 30 days before the day on which the general election is held.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(c): (5)(d); (5)(b); (5)(b); (5)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(c)(i): (5)(b) 10% of the amount of the contribution, if the state office candidate reports the contribution within 60 days after the day on which the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(c)(ii): (5)(b) 20% of the amount of the contribution, if the state office candidate fails to report the contribution within 60 days after the day on which the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(d): (5)(c); (5)(c) The lieutenant governor may waive the fine described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(d)(i): the contribution that the state office candidate fails to report is paid by the state office candidate from the state office candidate's personal funds;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(d)(ii): (5)(c) the state office candidate has not previously violated Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(d)(iii): the lieutenant governor determines that the failure to timely report the contribution is due to the state office candidate not understanding that the reporting requirement includes a contribution paid by a state office candidate from the state office candidate's personal funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(e): (5)(c) The lieutenant governor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(e)(i): (5)(c) deposit money received under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(e)(ii): report on the lieutenant governor's website, in the location where reports relating to each state office candidate are available for public access:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(e)(ii)(A): each fine imposed by the lieutenant governor against the state office candidate;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(e)(ii)(B): the amount of the fine;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(e)(ii)(C): the amount of the contribution to which the fine relates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(5)(e)(ii)(D): the date of the contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6): (6); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(a): (6); (1)(a) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(a)(i): (1)(a) that is not described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(a)(ii): into which or from which a person who, as a candidate for an office, other than the state office for which the person files a declaration of candidacy or federal office, or as a holder of an office, other than a state office for which the person files a declaration of candidacy or federal office, deposits a contribution or makes an expenditure.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(b): A state office candidate shall include on any financial statement filed in accordance with this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(b)(i): a contribution deposited in an account:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(b)(i)(A): since the last campaign finance statement was filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(b)(i)(B): that has not been reported under a statute or ordinance that governs the account; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(b)(ii): an expenditure made from an account:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(b)(ii)(A): since the last campaign finance statement was filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(6)(b)(ii)(B): that has not been reported under a statute or ordinance that governs the account.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-201(7): Within 31 days after receiving a contribution that is cash or a negotiable instrument, exceeds $50, and is from an unknown source, a state office candidate shall disburse the amount of the contribution to an organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202 State office candidate -- Personal campaign committee required -- Candidate as a political action committee officer.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1): 20A-11-601; Part 6, Political Action Committee Registration and Financial Reporting Requirements
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1)(a): 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1)(a)(i): Each state office candidate shall select no more than one personal campaign committee, consisting of one or more persons, to receive contributions, make expenditures, and file reports connected with the candidate's campaign.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1)(a)(ii): A state office candidate may serve as the candidate's own campaign committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1)(a)(iii): 20A-11-601 A state office candidate may be designated by a political action committee as an officer who has primary decision-making authority as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1)(b): Part 6, Political Action Committee Registration and Financial Reporting Requirements Except for expenses made by a registered political party to benefit a party's candidates generally, a state office candidate or other person acting in concert with or with the knowledge of the state office candidate may not receive any contributions or make any expenditures on behalf of a state office candidate other than through:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1)(b)(i): a personal campaign committee established under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(1)(b)(ii): Part 6, Political Action Committee Registration and Financial Reporting Requirements a political action committee established under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(a): The state office candidate shall file a written statement signed by the candidate or authorized member of the candidate's personal campaign committee with the lieutenant governor that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(a)(i): informs the lieutenant governor that the state office candidate's personal campaign committee has been selected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(a)(ii): provides the name and address of each member and the secretary of the committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(b): A state office candidate or the candidate's personal campaign committee may not make any expenditures on behalf of the candidate until the statement has been filed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(c): A state office candidate may revoke the selection of any member of the campaign committee by:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(c)(i): revoking that individual's appointment or election in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(c)(ii): personally serving the written revocation on the member whose selection is revoked; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(c)(iii): filing a copy of the written revocation with the lieutenant governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(d)(i): The state office candidate may select a replacement to fill any vacancy on the campaign committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(2)(d)(ii): The state office candidate shall file that replacement's name and address with the lieutenant governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(3): A member of a state office candidate's personal campaign committee may not make an expenditure of more than $1,000 unless the state office candidate or the secretary of the personal campaign committee authorizes the expenditure in writing.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-202(4): A state office candidate or the candidate's personal campaign committee may not make any expenditures prohibited by law.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203 State office candidate -- Financial reporting requirements -- Year-end summary report.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(1): (1)(a); 20A-11-205
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(1)(a): Each state office candidate shall file a summary report by January 10 of the year after the regular general election year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(1)(b): (1)(a); 20A-11-205 In addition to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2): 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a): 20A-11-601 Each summary report shall include the following information as of December 31 of the previous year:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(i): the net balance of the last financial statement, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(ii): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all interim reports, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(iii): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all interim reports, if any, filed during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(iv): a detailed listing of each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(v): for each nonmonetary contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(v)(A): the fair market value of the contribution with that information provided by the contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(v)(B): a specific description of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(vi): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(vii): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(viii): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts minus all expenditures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(a)(ix): 20A-11-601 the name of a political action committee for which the state office candidate is designated as an officer who has primary decision-making authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(b): In preparing the report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of December 31 of the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(2)(c): A check or negotiable instrument received by a state office candidate or a state office candidate's personal campaign committee on or before December 31 of the previous year shall be included in the summary report.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-203(3): An authorized member of the state office candidate's personal campaign committee or the state office candidate shall certify in the summary report that, to the best of the person's knowledge, all receipts and all expenditures have been reported as of December 31 of the previous year and that there are no bills or obligations outstanding and unpaid except as set forth in that report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204 State office candidate and state officeholder -- Financial reporting requirements -- Interim reports.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1): 20A-11-201(1)(a); (c) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(a): 20A-11-201(1)(a); (c) "Campaign account" means a separate campaign account required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b): "Received" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b)(i): for a cash contribution, that the cash is given to a state office candidate or a member of the state office candidate's personal campaign committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b)(ii): for a contribution that is a negotiable instrument or check, that the negotiable instrument or check is negotiated;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b)(iii): for a direct deposit made into a campaign account by a person not associated with the campaign, the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b)(iii)(A): the day on which the state office candidate or a member of the state office candidate's personal campaign committee becomes aware of the deposit and the source of the deposit;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b)(iii)(B): the day on which the state office candidate or a member of the state office candidate's personal campaign committee receives notice of the deposit and the source of the deposit by mail, email, text, or similar means; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b)(iii)(C): 31 days after the day on which the direct deposit occurs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(1)(b)(iv): for any other type of contribution, that any portion of the contribution's benefit inures to the state office candidate.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(2)(a)(i): seven days before the candidate's political convention; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(2)(a)(ii): for an unaffiliated candidate, the fourth Saturday in March;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(2)(b): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(2)(c): September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(2)(d): seven days before the regular general election date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(3): 20A-1-504; 20A-1-504(1)(b)(i); (1) If a state office candidate is a state office candidate seeking appointment for a midterm vacancy, the state office candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(3)(a): 20A-1-504; 20A-1-504(1)(b)(i) shall file an interim report:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(3)(a)(i): 20A-1-504; 20A-1-504(1)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(3)(a)(i)(A): 20A-1-504 no later than seven days before the day on which the political party of the party for which the state office candidate seeks nomination meets to declare a nominee for the governor to appoint in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(3)(a)(i)(B): 20A-1-504(1)(b)(i) two days before the day on which the political party of the party for which the state office candidate seeks nomination meets to declare a nominee for the governor to appoint in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(3)(a)(ii): if a state office candidate decides to seek the appointment with less than seven days before the party meets, or the political party schedules the meeting to declare a nominee less than seven days before the day of the meeting, no later than 5 p.m. on the last day of business before the day on which the party meets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(3)(b): (1) is not required to file an interim report at the times described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4): 20A-11-601 Each interim report shall include the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(a): the net balance of the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(b): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all prior interim reports, if any, during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(c): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all prior interim reports, if any, filed during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(d): a detailed listing of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(d)(i): for a state office candidate, each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(d)(ii): for a state officeholder, each contribution and public service assistance received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(e): for each nonmonetary contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(e)(i): the fair market value of the contribution with that information provided by the contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(e)(ii): a specific description of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(f): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(g): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(h): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts since the last summary report minus all expenditures since the last summary report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(i): a summary page in the form required by the lieutenant governor that identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(i)(i): beginning balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(i)(ii): total contributions and public service assistance received during the period since the last statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(i)(iii): total contributions and public service assistance received to date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(i)(iv): total expenditures during the period since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(i)(v): total expenditures to date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(4)(j): 20A-11-601 the name of a political action committee for which the state office candidate or state officeholder is designated as an officer who has primary decision-making authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(5)(a): In preparing each interim report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of five days before the required filing date of the report.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-204(5)(b): Any negotiable instrument or check received by a state office candidate or state officeholder more than five days before the required filing date of a report required by this section shall be included in the interim report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205 State office candidate -- Financial reporting requirements -- Termination of duty to report.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(1): Each state office candidate and the candidate's personal campaign committee is active and subject to interim reporting requirements until:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(1)(a): the candidate withdraws or is eliminated in a convention or primary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(1)(b): if seeking appointment as a midterm vacancy state office candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(1)(b)(i): the political party liaison fails to forward the person's name to the governor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(1)(b)(ii): the governor fails to appoint the person to fill the vacancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(2): 20A-11-201; 20A-11-203 Each state office candidate and the candidate's personal campaign committee is active and subject to year-end summary reporting requirements until the candidate has filed a statement of dissolution with the lieutenant governor stating that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(2)(a): the state office candidate or the personal campaign committee is no longer receiving contributions and is no longer making expenditures;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(2)(b): 20A-11-201 the ending balance on the last summary report filed is zero and the balance in the separate bank account required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(2)(c): 20A-11-203 a final summary report in the form required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(3): A statement of dissolution and a final summary report may be filed at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-205(4): 20A-11-203 Each state office candidate and the candidate's personal campaign committee shall continue to file the year-end summary report required by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206 State office candidate -- Failure to file reports -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(1): 20A-11-1005 A state office candidate who fails to file a financial statement before the deadline is subject to a fine imposed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(2): 20A-11-204(2)(b); (d) If a state office candidate fails to file an interim report described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(2)(a): that the state office candidate failed to timely file the report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(2)(b): that, if the state office candidate fails to file the report within 24 hours after the deadline for filing the report, the state office candidate will be disqualified and the political party will not be permitted to replace the candidate.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(3): 20A-11-204(2)(b); (d); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(3)(a): 20A-11-204(2)(b); (d) The lieutenant governor shall disqualify a state office candidate and  inform the county clerk and other appropriate election officials that the state office candidate is disqualified  if the state office candidate fails to file an interim report described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(3)(b): (3)(a) The political party of a state office candidate who is disqualified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(4): (3)(a) If a state office candidate is disqualified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(4)(a): notify every opposing candidate for the state office that the state office candidate is disqualified;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(4)(b): send an email notification to each voter who is eligible to vote in the state office race for whom the lieutenant governor has an email address informing the voter that the state office candidate is disqualified and that votes cast for the state office candidate will not be counted;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(4)(c): post notice of the disqualification on the lieutenant governor's website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(4)(d): if practicable, remove the state office candidate's name from the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(5): (4) An election officer may fulfill the requirement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(6): 20A-11-204(2)(b); (d); (6)(b) A state office candidate is not disqualified if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(6)(a): 20A-11-204(2)(b); (d) the state office candidate timely files the reports described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(6)(b): the reports are completed, detailing accurately and completely the information required by this part except for inadvertent omissions or insignificant errors or inaccuracies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(6)(c): (6)(b) the omissions, errors, or inaccuracies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7): (7); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(ii); (7)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(a): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of a summary report, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed summary report to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(a)(i): each state office candidate that is required to file a summary report has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(a)(ii): each summary report contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(b): If it appears that any state office candidate has failed to file the summary report required by law, if it appears that a filed summary report does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any summary report, the lieutenant governor shall, within five days of discovery of a violation or receipt of a written complaint, notify the state office candidate of the violation or written complaint and direct the state office candidate to file a summary report correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(c): (7); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(ii); (7)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(c)(i): (7) It is unlawful for a state office candidate to fail to file or amend a summary report within seven days after receiving notice from the lieutenant governor described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(c)(ii): (7)(c)(i) Each state office candidate who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(c)(iii): (7)(c)(i) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-206(7)(c)(iv): (7)(c)(ii); (7)(c)(i) In addition to the criminal penalty described in Subsection

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(1)(a): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(1)(a)(i): Each legislative office candidate shall deposit each contribution received in one or more separate accounts in a financial institution that are dedicated only to that purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(1)(a)(ii): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601 A legislative office candidate may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(1)(a)(ii)(A): 20A-11-601 receive a contribution from a political action committee registered under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(1)(b)(i): a personal use expenditure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(1)(b)(ii): an expenditure prohibited by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(1)(c): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(2):

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(2)(b): A legislative officeholder may not deposit or mingle any contributions or public service assistance received into a personal or business account.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-301(6): Within 31 days after receiving a contribution that is cash or a negotiable instrument, exceeds $50, and is from an unknown source, a legislative office candidate shall disburse the amount of the contribution to an organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code.
