Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302 Legislative office candidate -- Financial reporting requirements -- Year-end summary report.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(1): (1)(a); 20A-11-304
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(1)(a): Each legislative office candidate shall file a summary report by January 10 of the year after the regular general election year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(1)(b): (1)(a); 20A-11-304 In addition to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2): 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a): 20A-11-601 Each summary report shall include the following information as of December 31 of the previous year:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(i): the net balance of the last financial statement, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(ii): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all interim reports, if any, during the calendar year in which the summary report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(iii): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all interim reports, if any, filed during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(iv): a detailed listing of each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(v): for each nonmonetary contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(v)(A): the fair market value of the contribution with that information provided by the contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(v)(B): a specific description of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(vi): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(vii): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(viii): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts minus all expenditures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(a)(ix): 20A-11-601 the name of a political action committee for which the legislative office candidate is designated as an officer who has primary decision-making authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(b): In preparing the report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of December 31 of the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(2)(c): A check or negotiable instrument received by a legislative office candidate on or before December 31 of the previous year shall be included in the summary report.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-302(3): The legislative office candidate shall certify in the summary report that to the best of the candidate's knowledge, all receipts and all expenditures have been reported as of December 31 of the previous year and that there are no bills or obligations outstanding and unpaid except as set forth in that report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303 Legislative office candidate and legislative officeholder -- Financial reporting requirements -- Interim reports.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1): 20A-11-301(1)(a)(i); (c)(i) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(a): 20A-11-301(1)(a)(i); (c)(i) "Campaign account" means a separate campaign account required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b): "Received" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b)(i): for a cash contribution, that the cash is given to a legislative office candidate or a member of the legislative office candidate's personal campaign committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b)(ii): for a contribution that is a negotiable instrument or check, that the negotiable instrument or check is negotiated;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b)(iii): for a direct deposit made into a campaign account by a person not associated with the campaign, the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b)(iii)(A): the day on which the legislative office candidate or a member of the legislative office candidate's personal campaign committee becomes aware of the deposit and the source of the deposit;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b)(iii)(B): the day on which the legislative office candidate or a member of the legislative office candidate's personal campaign committee receives notice of the deposit and the source of the deposit by mail, email, text, or similar means; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b)(iii)(C): 31 days after the day on which the direct deposit occurs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(1)(b)(iv): for any other type of contribution, that any portion of the contribution's benefit inures to the legislative office candidate.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(2)(a)(i): seven days before the candidate's political convention; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(2)(a)(ii): for an unaffiliated candidate, the fourth Saturday in March;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(2)(b): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(2)(c): September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(2)(d): seven days before the regular general election date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(3): 20A-1-503; 20A-1-503; (2)(a) If a legislative office candidate is a legislative office candidate seeking appointment for a midterm vacancy, the legislative office candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(3)(a): 20A-1-503; 20A-1-503 shall file an interim report:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(3)(a)(i): 20A-1-503; 20A-1-503
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(3)(a)(i)(A): 20A-1-503 seven days before the day on which the political party of the party for which the legislative office candidate seeks nomination meets to declare a nominee for the governor to appoint in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(3)(a)(i)(B): 20A-1-503 two days before the day on which the political party of the party for which the legislative office candidate seeks nomination meets to declare a nominee for the governor to appoint in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(3)(a)(ii): if the legislative office candidate decides to seek the appointment with less than seven days before the party meets, or the political party schedules the meeting to declare a nominee less than seven days before the day of the meeting, two days before the day on which the party meets; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(3)(b): (2)(a) is not required to file an interim report at the times described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4): 20A-11-601 Each interim report shall include the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(a): the net balance of the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(b): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all prior interim reports, if any, during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(c): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all prior interim reports, if any, filed during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(d): a detailed listing of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(d)(i): for a legislative office candidate, each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(d)(ii): for a legislative officeholder, each contribution and public service assistance received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(e): for each nonmonetary contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(e)(i): the fair market value of the contribution with that information provided by the contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(e)(ii): a specific description of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(f): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(g): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(h): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts since the last summary report minus all expenditures since the last summary report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(i): a summary page in the form required by the lieutenant governor that identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(i)(i): beginning balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(i)(ii): total contributions and public service assistance received during the period since the last statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(i)(iii): total contributions and public service assistance received to date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(i)(iv): total expenditures during the period since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(i)(v): total expenditures to date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(4)(j): 20A-11-601 the name of a political action committee for which the legislative office candidate or legislative officeholder is designated as an officer who has primary decision-making authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(5)(a): In preparing each interim report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of five days before the required filing date of the report.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-303(5)(b): Any negotiable instrument or check received by a legislative office candidate or legislative officeholder more than five days before the required filing date of a report required by this section shall be included in the interim report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304 Legislative office candidate -- Financial reporting requirements -- Termination of duty to report.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(1): Each legislative office candidate is subject to interim reporting requirements until:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(1)(a): the candidate withdraws or is eliminated in a convention or primary; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(1)(b): if seeking appointment as a midterm vacancy legislative office candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(1)(b)(i): the political party liaison fails to forward the person's name to the governor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(1)(b)(ii): the governor fails to appoint the person to fill the vacancy.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(2): 20A-11-301; 20A-11-302 Each legislative office candidate is subject to year-end summary reporting requirements until the candidate has filed a statement of dissolution with the lieutenant governor stating that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(2)(a): the legislative office candidate is no longer receiving contributions and is no longer making expenditures;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(2)(b): 20A-11-301 the ending balance on the last summary report filed is zero and the balance in the separate bank account required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(2)(c): 20A-11-302 a final summary report in the form required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(3): A statement of dissolution and a final summary report may be filed at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-304(4): 20A-11-302 Each legislative office candidate shall continue to file the year-end summary report required by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305 Legislative office candidate -- Failure to file report -- Penalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(1): 20A-11-1005 A legislative office candidate who fails to file a financial statement before the deadline is subject to a fine imposed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(2): 20A-11-303(2)(b); (d) If a legislative office candidate fails to file an interim report described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(2)(a): that the legislative office candidate failed to timely file the report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(2)(b): that, if the legislative office candidate fails to file the report within 24 hours after the deadline for filing the report, the legislative office candidate will be disqualified and the political party will not be permitted to replace the candidate.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(3): 20A-11-303(2)(b); (d); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(3)(a): 20A-11-303(2)(b); (d) The lieutenant governor shall disqualify a legislative office candidate and  inform the county clerk and other appropriate election officials that the legislative office candidate is disqualified  if the legislative office candidate fails to file an interim report described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(3)(b): (3)(a) The political party of a legislative office candidate who is disqualified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(4): (3)(a) If a legislative office candidate is disqualified under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(4)(a): notify every opposing candidate for the legislative office that the legislative office candidate is disqualified;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(4)(b): send an email notification to each voter who is eligible to vote in the legislative office race for whom the election officer has an email address informing the voter that the legislative office candidate is disqualified and that votes cast for the legislative office candidate will not be counted;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(4)(c): post notice of the disqualification on the election officer's website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(4)(d): if practicable, remove the legislative office candidate's name from the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(5): (4) An election officer may fulfill the requirement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(6): 20A-11-303(2)(b); (d); (6)(b) A legislative office candidate is not disqualified if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(6)(a): 20A-11-303(2)(b); (d) the legislative office candidate files the reports described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(6)(b): the reports are completed, detailing accurately and completely the information required by this part except for inadvertent omissions or insignificant errors or inaccuracies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(6)(c): (6)(b) the omissions, errors, or inaccuracies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7): (7); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(ii); (7)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(a): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of a summary report, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed summary report to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(a)(i): each legislative office candidate that is required to file a summary report has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(a)(ii): each summary report contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(b): If it appears that any legislative office candidate has failed to file the summary report required by law, if it appears that a filed summary report does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any summary report, the lieutenant governor shall, within five days of discovery of a violation or receipt of a written complaint, notify the legislative office candidate of the violation or written complaint and direct the legislative office candidate to file a summary report correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(c): (7); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(ii); (7)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(c)(i): (7) It is unlawful for a legislative office candidate to fail to file or amend a summary report within seven days after receiving notice from the lieutenant governor described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(c)(ii): (7)(c)(i) Each legislative office candidate who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(c)(iii): (7)(c)(i) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-305(7)(c)(iv): (7)(c)(ii); (7)(c)(i) In addition to the criminal penalty described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401 Officeholder financial reporting requirements -- Year-end summary report -- Officeholder as a political action committee officer -- Anonymous contribution or public service assistance.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(1)(a): Each officeholder shall file a summary report by January 10 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(1)(b): An officeholder that is required to file a summary report both as an officeholder and as a candidate for office under the requirements of this chapter may file a single summary report as a candidate and an officeholder, provided that the combined report meets the requirements of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(1)(b)(i): this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(1)(b)(ii): the section that provides the requirements for the summary report filed by the officeholder in the officeholder's capacity of a candidate for office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2): 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a): 20A-11-601 Each summary report shall include the following information as of December 31 of the previous year:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(i): the net balance of the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(ii): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts received since the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(iii): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures made since the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(iv): a detailed listing of each contribution and public service assistance received since the last summary report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(v): for each nonmonetary contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(v)(A): the fair market value of the contribution with that information provided by the contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(v)(B): a specific description of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(vi): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(vii): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(viii): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report plus all receipts minus all expenditures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(a)(ix): 20A-11-601 the name of a political action committee for which the officeholder is designated as an officer who has primary decision-making authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(2)(b): In preparing the report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of December 31 of the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(3): The summary report shall contain a paragraph signed by the officeholder certifying that, to the best of the officeholder's knowledge, all receipts and all expenditures have been reported as of December 31 of the last calendar year and that there are no bills or obligations outstanding and unpaid except as set forth in that report.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(4): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601 An officeholder may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(4)(a): 20A-11-601 receive public service assistance from a political action committee registered under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(4)(b): 20A-11-601 be designated by a political action committee as an officer who has primary decision-making authority as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(5): Within 31 days after receiving a contribution or public service assistance that is cash or a negotiable instrument, exceeds $50, and is from an unknown source, an officeholder shall disburse the amount of the contribution or public service assistance to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(5)(a): the treasurer of the state or a political subdivision for deposit into the state's or political subdivision's general fund; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-401(5)(b): an organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402 Officeholder financial reporting requirements -- Statement of dissolution.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(1): 20A-11-201; 20A-11-301; 20A-11-1301; 20A-11-401 An officeholder or former officeholder is active and subject to reporting requirements until the officeholder or former officeholder has filed a statement of dissolution with the lieutenant governor stating that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(1)(a): the officeholder or former officeholder is no longer receiving contributions or public service assistance and is no longer making expenditures;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(1)(b): 20A-11-201; 20A-11-301; 20A-11-1301 the ending balance on the last summary report filed is zero and the balance in the separate bank account required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(1)(c): 20A-11-401 a final summary report in the form required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(2): A statement of dissolution and a final summary report may be filed at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(3): (3)(a); (3)(a); (3)(a); 20A-11-401
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(3)(a): Each officeholder shall report to the lieutenant governor each contribution or public service assistance received by the state officeholder within 31 days after the day on which the officeholder receives the contribution or public service assistance.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(3)(b): (3)(a); (3)(a); (3)(a) For each contribution or public service assistance that an officeholder fails to report within the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(3)(b)(i): (3)(a) 10% of the amount of the contribution or public service assistance if the officeholder reports the contribution or public service assistance within 60 days after the day on which the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(3)(b)(ii): (3)(a) 20% of the amount of the contribution or public service assistance if the officeholder fails to report the contribution or public service assistance within 60 days after the day on which the time period described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(3)(c): 20A-11-401 Each officeholder or former officeholder shall continue to file the year-end summary report required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(4): An officeholder or former officeholder may not use a contribution or public service assistance deposited in an account in accordance with this chapter for:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(4)(a): a personal use expenditure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(4)(b): an expenditure prohibited by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(5): (5)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(5)(a): (5)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-402(5)(b): A former officeholder may transfer the money in a campaign account in a manner that would cause the former officeholder to recognize the money as taxable income under federal tax law if the transfer is made to a campaign account for federal office.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403 Failure to file -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(1): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of a summary report, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed summary report to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(1)(a): each officeholder that is required to file a summary report has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(1)(b): each summary report contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(2): 20A-11-1005 If it appears that any officeholder has failed to file the summary report required by law, if it appears that a filed summary report does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any summary report, the lieutenant governor shall, if the lieutenant governor determines that a violation has occurred:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(2)(a): 20A-11-1005 impose a fine against the filing entity in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(2)(b): within five days of discovery of a violation or receipt of a written complaint, notify the officeholder of the violation or written complaint and direct the officeholder to file a summary report correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(3): (3)(a); (3)(a); (3)(b); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(3)(a): It is unlawful for any officeholder to fail to file or amend a summary report within seven days after receiving notice from the lieutenant governor under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(3)(b): (3)(a) Each officeholder who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(3)(c): (3)(a) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-403(3)(d): (3)(b); (3)(a) In addition to the criminal penalty described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.5 Political party financial reporting requirements -- General requirements.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this part requires a registered political party to report contributions and expenditures made to benefit federal candidates and filed with the Federal Election Commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.7 Separate account for contributions for registered political party -- Anonymous contributions to registered political party or county political party.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.7(1): A registered political party shall deposit a contribution received in one or more separate campaign accounts in a financial institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.7(2): A registered political party may not deposit or mingle a contribution received into a personal or business account.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.7(3): A registered political party or county political party may not expend a contribution for political purposes or a political issues expenditure if the contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.7(3)(a): is cash or a negotiable instrument;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.7(3)(b): exceeds $50; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-505.7(3)(c): is from an unknown source.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506 Political party financial reporting requirements -- Year-end summary report.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(1): The party committee of each registered political party shall file a summary report by January 10 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a): Each summary report shall include the following information as of December 31 of the previous year:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(i): the net balance of the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(ii): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all interim reports, if any, during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(iii): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all interim reports, if any, filed during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(iv): a detailed listing of each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(v): for each nonmonetary contribution, the fair market value of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(vi): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(vii): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(a)(viii): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts minus all expenditures.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(b)(i): For all individual contributions of $50 or less, a single aggregate figure may be reported without separate detailed listings.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(b)(ii): Two or more contributions from the same source that have an aggregate total of more than $50 may not be reported in the aggregate, but shall be reported separately.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(2)(c): In preparing the report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of December 31 of the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-506(3): The summary report shall contain a paragraph signed by the treasurer of the party committee certifying that, to the best of the treasurer's knowledge, all receipts and all expenditures have been reported as of December 31 of the previous year and that there are no bills or obligations outstanding and unpaid except as set forth in that report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507 Political party financial reporting requirements -- Interim reports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(1): The party committee of each registered political party shall file an interim report at the following times in any year in which there is a regular general election:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(1)(a): seven days before the registered political party's political convention;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(1)(b): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(1)(c): September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(1)(d): seven days before the general election date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2): Each interim report shall include the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(a): the net balance of the last financial statement, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(b): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all prior interim reports, if any, during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(c): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all prior interim reports, if any, filed during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(d): a detailed listing of each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(e): for each nonmonetary contribution, the fair market value of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(f): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(g): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(h): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts since the last summary report minus all expenditures since the last summary report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(i): a summary page in the form required by the lieutenant governor that identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(i)(i): beginning balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(i)(ii): total contributions during the period since the last statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(i)(iii): total contributions to date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(i)(iv): total expenditures during the period since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(2)(i)(v): total expenditures to date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(3)(a): For all individual contributions of $50 or less, a single aggregate figure may be reported without separate detailed listings.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(3)(b): Two or more contributions from the same source that have an aggregate total of more than $50 may not be reported in the aggregate, but shall be reported separately.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-507(4): In preparing each interim report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of five days before the required filing date of the report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508 Political party reporting requirements -- Criminal penalties -- Fines.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(1): 20A-11-1005; 20A-11-507(1)(b); (d); (1)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(1)(a): 20A-11-1005 Each registered political party that fails to file a financial statement by the deadline is subject to a fine imposed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(1)(b): 20A-11-507(1)(b); (d) Each registered political party that fails to file an interim report described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(1)(c): (1)(b) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(2): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of a summary report required by this part, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed report to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(2)(a): each political party that is required to file a report has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(2)(b): each report contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(3): If it appears that any political party has failed to file a report required by law, if it appears that a filed report does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any report, the lieutenant governor shall, within five days of discovery of a violation or receipt of a written complaint, notify the political party of the violation or written complaint and direct the political party to file a summary report correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(4): (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(b); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(4)(a): It is unlawful for any political party to fail to file or amend a summary report within seven days after receiving notice from the lieutenant governor under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(4)(b): (4)(a) Each political party who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(4)(c): (4)(a) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-508(4)(d): (4)(b); (4)(a) In addition to the criminal penalty described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-509 Separate account for contributions for county political party.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-509(1): A county political party officer shall deposit a contribution received in one or more separate campaign accounts in a financial institution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-509(2): A county political party officer may not deposit or mingle a contribution received into a personal or business account.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510 County political party financial reporting requirements -- Year-end summary report.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(1): A county political party officer of a county political party that has received contributions totaling at least $750, or disbursed expenditures totaling at least $750, during a calendar year shall file a summary report by January 10 of the following year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a): Each summary report shall include the following information as of December 31 of the previous year:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(i): the net balance of the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(ii): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all interim reports, if any, filed during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(iii): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all interim reports, if any, filed during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(iv): a detailed listing of each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(v): for each nonmonetary contribution, the fair market value of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(vi): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(vii): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(a)(viii): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts minus all expenditures.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(b)(i): For all individual contributions of $50 or less, a single aggregate figure may be reported without separate detailed listings.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(b)(ii): Two or more contributions from the same source that have an aggregate total of more than $50 may not be reported in the aggregate, but shall be reported separately.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(2)(c): In preparing the report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of December 31 of the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-510(3): The county political party officer shall certify in the summary report that, to the best of the officer's knowledge, all receipts and all expenditures have been reported as of December 31 of the previous year and that there are no bills or obligations outstanding and unpaid except as set forth in that report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511 County political party financial reporting requirements -- Interim reports.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(1)(a): A county political party officer of a county political party that has received contributions totaling at least $750, or disbursed expenditures totaling at least $750, during a calendar year shall file an interim report at the following times in any year in which there is a regular general election:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(1)(a)(i): seven days before the county political party's convention;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(1)(a)(ii): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(1)(a)(iii): September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(1)(a)(iv): seven days before the general election date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(1)(b): A county political party officer need not file an interim report if it received no contributions or made no expenditures during the reporting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2): Each interim report shall include the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(a): the net balance of the last financial statement, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(b): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all prior interim reports, if any, during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(c): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all prior interim reports, if any, filed during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(d): a detailed listing of each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(e): for each nonmonetary contribution, the fair market value of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(f): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(g): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(h): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts since the last summary report minus all expenditures since the last summary report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(i): a summary page in the form required by the lieutenant governor that identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(i)(i): beginning balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(i)(ii): total contributions during the period since the last statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(i)(iii): total contributions to date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(i)(iv): total expenditures during the period since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(2)(i)(v): total expenditures to date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(3)(a): For all individual contributions of $50 or less, a single aggregate figure may be reported without separate detailed listings.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(3)(b): Two or more contributions from the same source that have an aggregate total of more than $50 may not be reported in the aggregate, but shall be reported separately.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-511(4): In preparing each interim report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of five days before the required filing date of the report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512 County political party -- Criminal penalties -- Fines.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(1): 20A-11-511(1)(a)(i); (iv); 20A-11-1005 A county political party that fails to file an interim report described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(2): 20A-11-510; 20A-11-510 Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of the January 10 statement required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(2)(a): a county political party officer who is required to file a statement has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(2)(b): 20A-11-510 each statement contains the information required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(3): If it appears that any county political party officer has failed to file a financial statement before the deadline, if it appears that a filed financial statement does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any financial statement, the lieutenant governor shall, within five days after the day on which the lieutenant governor discovers the violation or receives the written complaint, notify the county political party officer of the violation or written complaint and direct the county political party officer to file a financial statement correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(4)(a): A county political party that fails to file or amend a financial statement within seven days after the day on which the county political party receives notice from the lieutenant governor under this section is subject to a fine of the lesser of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(4)(a)(i): 10% of the total contributions received, and the total expenditures made, by the county political party during the reporting period for the financial statement that the county political party failed to file or amend; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(4)(a)(ii): $1,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-512(4)(b): (4)(a) The chief election officer shall deposit a fine collected under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-513 Termination of duty to report.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-513(1): A registered political party or county political party is subject to year-end summary reporting requirements until the registered political party or county political party has filed a statement of dissolution with the lieutenant governor stating that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-513(1)(a): the political party is no longer receiving contributions and is no longer making expenditures;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-513(1)(b): the ending balance on the last summary report filed is zero; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-513(1)(c): a final summary report in the form required by this part showing a zero balance is filed with the statement of dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-513(2): A statement of dissolution and a final summary report may be filed at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-513(3): A registered political party or county political party shall continue to file the year-end summary report required by this part until the statement of dissolution and final summary report required by this section are filed with the lieutenant governor.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601 Political action committees -- Registration -- Name or acronym used by political action committee -- Criminal penalty for providing false information or accepting unlawful contribution.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1): (7)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1)(a): A political action committee shall file an initial statement of organization with the lieutenant governor's office no later than 5 p.m. seven days after the day on which the political action committee:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1)(a)(i): receives contributions totaling at least $750; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1)(a)(ii): distributes expenditures for political purposes totaling at least $750.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1)(b): (7) Unless the political action committee has filed a notice of dissolution under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1)(b)(i): before 5 p.m. on January 10; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1)(b)(ii): electronically, before midnight on January 10.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(1)(c): After filing an initial statement of organization, a political action committee shall, before January 10 each year after the year in which the political action committee files an initial statement of organization, file an updated statement of organization with the lieutenant governor's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2): (1); (5) A statement of organization described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2)(a): the full name of the political action committee, a second name, if any, and an acronym, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2)(b): the address and phone number of the political action committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2)(c): (5) the name, address, telephone number, title, and occupation of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2)(c)(i): (5) the two officers described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2)(c)(ii): all other officers, advisory members, and governing board members of the political action committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2)(c)(iii): each individual or entity represented by, or affiliated with, the political action committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(2)(d): other relevant information requested by the lieutenant governor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3): (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(d)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(a): A political action committee may not use a name or acronym:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(a)(i): other than a name or acronym disclosed in the political action committee's latest statement of organization;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(a)(ii): that is the same, or deceptively similar to, the name or acronym of another political action committee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(a)(iii): that is likely to mislead a potential donor regarding the individuals or entities represented by, or affiliated with, the political action committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(b): (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(a)(ii); (iii) Within seven days after the day on which a political action committee files an initial statement of organization, the lieutenant governor's office shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(b)(i): (3)(a)(ii); (iii) review the statement and determine whether a name or acronym used by the political action committee violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(b)(ii): (3)(a)(ii); (iii); (3)(a)(ii); (iii) if the lieutenant governor's office determines that a name or acronym used by the political action committee violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(b)(ii)(A): immediately cease and desist use of the name or acronym; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(b)(ii)(B): (3)(a)(ii); (iii) within seven days after the day of the order, file an updated statement of organization with a name and acronym that does not violate Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(c): (3)(a)(ii); (iii) If a political action committee uses a name or acronym that is the same, or deceptively similar to, the name or acronym of another political action committee, the lieutenant governor shall determine which political action committee has been using the name the longest and shall order, in writing, any other political action committee using the same, or a deceptively similar, name or acronym to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(c)(i): immediately cease and desist use of the name or acronym; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(c)(ii): (3)(a)(ii); (iii) within seven days after the day of the order, file an updated statement of organization with a name and acronym that does not violate Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(d): (3)(d)(i) If a political action committee uses a name or acronym other than a name or acronym disclosed in the political action committee's latest statement of organization:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(d)(i): the lieutenant governor shall order, in writing, that the political action committee cease and desist use of the name or acronym; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(3)(d)(ii): (3)(d)(i) the political action committee shall immediately comply with the order described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4): (3); (4)(a)(i); (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)(i)(B)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(a): (3) The lieutenant governor may, in addition to any other penalty provided by law, impose a $100 fine against a political action committee, or against an individual who forms a political action committee, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(a)(i): fails to timely file a complete and accurate statement of organization or subsequent statement of organization; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(a)(ii): (3) fails to comply with an order described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(b): (4)(a)(i); (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)(i)(B) If the lieutenant governor imposes a fine described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(b)(i): the person against whom the fine is imposed shall, within seven days after the day on which the lieutenant governor imposes the fine:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(b)(i)(A): pay the fine; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(b)(i)(B): file a complete and accurate statement, or subsequent statement, of organization, as applicable; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(b)(ii): (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)(i)(B) the lieutenant governor shall provide written notice to the person against whom the fine is imposed:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(b)(ii)(A): (4)(b)(i) of the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(b)(ii)(B): (4)(b)(i)(B) that failure to timely comply with the requirement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(c): The attorney general, or a political action committee that is harmed by the action of a political action committee in violation of this section, may bring an action for an injunction against the violating political action committee, or an officer of the violating political action committee, to enforce the provisions of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(4)(d): A political action committee may bring an action for damages against another political action committee that uses a name or acronym that is the same, or deceptively similar to, the name or acronym of the political action committee bringing the action.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(5)(a): Each political action committee shall designate two officers who have primary decision-making authority for the political action committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(5)(b): (5)(a) An individual may not exercise primary decision-making authority for a political action committee if the individual is not designated under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(6): A political action committee shall deposit each contribution received in one or more separate accounts in a financial institution that are dedicated only to that purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7): (6)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(a): A registered political action committee that intends to permanently cease operations shall file a notice of dissolution with the lieutenant governor's office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(b): A notice of dissolution filed by a political action committee does not exempt the political action committee from complying with the financial reporting requirements described in this chapter in relation to all contributions received, and all expenditures made, before, at, or after dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(c): (6) A political action committee shall, before filing a notice of dissolution, dispose of any money remaining in an account described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(c)(i): returning the money to the donors;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(c)(ii): donating the money to the campaign account of a candidate or officeholder;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(c)(iii): donating the money to another political action committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(c)(iv): donating the money to a political party;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(c)(v): donating the money to an organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(c)(vi): making another lawful expenditure of the money for a political purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(7)(d): A political action committee shall report all money donated or expended in a financial report to the lieutenant governor, in accordance with the financial reporting requirements described in this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(8): (7); (5)(a); (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(8)(a): (7); (5)(a) Unless the political action committee has filed a notice of dissolution under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(8)(b): A political action committee may not accept a contribution from a political issues committee, but may donate money to a political issues committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(8)(c): (5)(a) A political action committee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(8)(c)(i): (5)(a) file a notice of a change of a primary officer described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(8)(c)(ii): include in the notice of change the name and title of the officer being replaced, and the name, address, occupation, and title of the new officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(9): (5)(a); (8)(c); 20A-11-704; (9)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(9)(a): A person is guilty of providing false information in relation to a political action committee if the person intentionally or knowingly gives false or misleading material information in a statement of organization or the notice of change of primary officer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(9)(b): (5)(a); (8)(c); 20A-11-704 Each primary officer designated in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(9)(b)(i): was organized less than 90 days before the date of the general election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(9)(b)(ii): 20A-11-704 at the time the political action committee accepts the contribution, has failed to file a statement of organization with the lieutenant governor's office as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-601(9)(c): (9) A violation of this Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602 Political action committees -- Financial reporting.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1): (1)(b)(ii); (1)(a)(ii); (v)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a): (1)(b)(ii) Each registered political action committee that has received contributions totaling at least $750, or disbursed expenditures totaling at least $750, during a calendar year shall file a verified financial statement with the lieutenant governor's office:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(i): on January 10, reporting contributions and expenditures as of December 31 of the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(ii): seven days before the state political convention of each major political party;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(iii): (1)(b)(ii) seven days before the county political convention of a political party, if the political action committee makes an expenditure on or before the day described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(iv): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(v): on September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(vi): seven days before:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(vi)(A): the municipal general election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(a)(vi)(B): the regular general election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(b): (1)(a)(ii); (v) The registered political action committee shall report:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(b)(i): a detailed listing of all contributions received and expenditures made since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(b)(ii): (1)(a)(ii); (v) for a financial statement described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(1)(c): The registered political action committee need not file a statement under this section if it received no contributions and made no expenditures during the reporting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2): Part 17, Independent Expenditures; 20A-11-1704
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a): The verified financial statement shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(i): the name and address of any individual who makes a contribution to the reporting political action committee, if known, and the amount of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(ii): the identification of any publicly identified class of individuals that makes a contribution to the reporting political action committee, if known, and the amount of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(iii): the name and address of any political action committee, group, or entity, if known, that makes a contribution to the reporting political action committee, and the amount of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(iv): for each nonmonetary contribution, the fair market value of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(v): the name and address of each reporting entity that received an expenditure from the reporting political action committee, and the amount of each expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(vi): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(vii): the total amount of contributions received and expenditures disbursed by the reporting political action committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(viii): a statement by the political action committee's treasurer or chief financial officer certifying that, to the best of the person's knowledge, the financial report is accurate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(ix): a summary page in the form required by the lieutenant governor that identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(ix)(A): beginning balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(ix)(B): total contributions during the period since the last statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(ix)(C): total contributions to date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(ix)(D): total expenditures during the period since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(a)(ix)(E): total expenditures to date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(b)(i): Contributions received by a political action committee that have a value of $50 or less need not be reported individually, but shall be listed on the report as an aggregate total.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(b)(ii): Two or more contributions from the same source that have an aggregate total of more than $50 may not be reported in the aggregate, but shall be reported separately.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(c): Part 17, Independent Expenditures; 20A-11-1704 A political action committee is not required to report an independent expenditure under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(c)(i): includes the independent expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(c)(ii): identifies the independent expenditure as an independent expenditure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(2)(c)(iii): 20A-11-1704 provides the information, described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(3): A group or entity may not divide or separate into units, sections, or smaller groups for the purpose of avoiding the financial reporting requirements of this chapter, and substance shall prevail over form in determining the scope or size of a political action committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(4): (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(4)(a): (4) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(4)(a)(i): for a cash contribution, that the cash is given to a political action committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(4)(a)(ii): for a contribution that is a negotiable instrument or check, that the negotiable instrument or check is negotiated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(4)(a)(iii): for any other type of contribution, that any portion of the contribution's benefit inures to the political action committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(4)(b): A political action committee shall report each contribution to the lieutenant governor within 31 days after the contribution is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(5): A political action committee may not expend a contribution for political purposes if the contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(5)(a): is cash or a negotiable instrument;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(5)(b): exceeds $50; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(5)(c): is from an unknown source.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(6): Within 31 days after receiving a contribution that is cash or a negotiable instrument, exceeds $50, and is from an unknown source, a political action committee shall disburse the amount of the contribution to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(6)(a): the treasurer of the state or a political subdivision for deposit into the state's or political subdivision's general fund; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-602(6)(b): an organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603 Criminal penalties -- Fines.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(1): (1); (1)(a); 20A-11-1005; 20A-11-602(1)(a)(iv); (vi); (1)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(1)(a): (1); (1)(a) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(1)(a)(i): the financial statement accurately and completely details the information required by this part except for inadvertent omissions or insignificant errors or inaccuracies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(1)(a)(ii): (1)(a) the political action committee corrects the omissions, errors, or inaccuracies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(1)(b): 20A-11-1005 Each political action committee that fails to file a completed financial statement before the deadline is subject to a fine imposed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(1)(c): 20A-11-602(1)(a)(iv); (vi) Each political action committee that fails to file a completed financial statement described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(1)(d): (1)(c) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(2): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of the January 10 statement required by this part, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed statement to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(2)(a): each political action committee that is required to file a statement has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(2)(b): each statement contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(3): If it appears that any political action committee has failed to file the January 10 statement, if it appears that a filed statement does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any statement, the lieutenant governor shall, within five days after the day on which the lieutenant governor discovers the violation or receives the written complaint, notify the political action committee of the violation or written complaint and direct the political action committee to file a statement correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(4): (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(b); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(4)(a): It is unlawful for any political action committee to fail to file or amend a statement within seven days after the day on which the political action committee receives notice from the lieutenant governor under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(4)(b): (4)(a) Each political action committee that violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(4)(c): (4)(a) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(4)(d): (4)(b); (4)(a) In addition to the criminal penalty described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(5): 20A-11-601(4)(b)(ii); (5)(a); (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(5)(a): 20A-11-601(4)(b)(ii) It is unlawful for a person to fail to file a complete and accurate statement of organization, or a complete and accurate subsequent statement of organization, within seven days after the day on which the person receives the notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(5)(b): (5)(a) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-603(5)(c): (5)(a) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.1 Definitions.
-----------------------------------------------
As used in this part, "political purposes" means an act done with the intent or in a way to influence or tend to influence, directly or indirectly:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.1(1): any person to refrain from voting or to vote for or against any:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.1(1)(a): candidate or a person seeking a municipal or county office at any caucus, political convention, or election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.1(1)(b): judge standing for retention at any election;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.1(1)(c): ballot proposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.1(1)(d): incorporation election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.1(2): any person to sign, refrain from signing, remove the person's signature from, or refrain from removing the person's signature from, a petition for a ballot proposition or an incorporation petition.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5 Campaign financial reporting by corporations -- Filing requirements -- Statement contents.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1): (1)(a)(ii); (v); 63G-6a-103; 63G-6a-103; 63G-6a-103; Chapter 12, Part 2, Judicial Retention Elections; 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(a): Each corporation that has made expenditures for political purposes that total at least $750 during a calendar year shall file a verified financial statement with the lieutenant governor's office:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(a)(i): on January 10, reporting expenditures as of December 31 of the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(a)(ii): seven days before the state political convention for each major political party;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(a)(iii): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(a)(iv): on September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(a)(v): seven days before the regular general election date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(b): (1)(a)(ii); (v); 63G-6a-103; 63G-6a-103; 63G-6a-103 The corporation shall report:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(b)(i): a detailed listing of all expenditures made since the last financial statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(b)(ii): (1)(a)(ii); (v) for a financial statement described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(b)(iii): 63G-6a-103; 63G-6a-103; 63G-6a-103 whether the  corporation, including an officer of the  corporation, director of the  corporation, or person with at least 10% ownership in the  corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(b)(iii)(A): 63G-6a-103 has bid since the last financial statement on a contract, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(b)(iii)(B): 63G-6a-103 is currently bidding on a contract, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(b)(iii)(C): 63G-6a-103 is a party to a contract, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(c): The corporation need not file a financial statement under this section if the  corporation made no expenditures during the reporting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(1)(d): Chapter 12, Part 2, Judicial Retention Elections; 10-3-208; 17-16-6.5 The corporation is not required to report an expenditure made to, or on behalf of, a reporting entity that the reporting entity is required to include in a financial statement described in this chapter,
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(2): The financial statement shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(2)(a): the name and address of each reporting entity that received an expenditure from the  corporation, and the amount of each expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(2)(b): the total amount of expenditures disbursed by the  corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-701.5(2)(c): a statement by the corporation's treasurer or chief financial officer certifying the accuracy of the financial statement.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702 Campaign financial reporting of political issues expenditures by corporations -- Financial reporting.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1): (1)(a)(ii); (v)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(a): Each corporation that has made political issues expenditures on current or proposed ballot issues that total at least $750 during a calendar year shall file a verified financial statement with the lieutenant governor's office:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(a)(i): on January 10, reporting expenditures as of December 31 of the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(a)(ii): seven days before the state political convention of each major political party;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(a)(iii): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(a)(iv): on September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(a)(v): seven days before the regular general election date.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(b)(i): a detailed listing of all expenditures made since the last financial statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(b)(ii): (1)(a)(ii); (v) for a financial statement described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(1)(c): The corporation need not file a statement under this section if it made no expenditures during the reporting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(2): That statement shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(2)(a): the name and address of each individual, entity, or group of individuals or entities that received a political issues expenditure of more than $50 from the corporation, and the amount of each political issues expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(2)(b): the total amount of political issues expenditures disbursed by the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-702(2)(c): a statement by the corporation's treasurer or chief financial officer certifying the accuracy of the verified financial statement.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703 Criminal penalties -- Fines.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(1): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of any statement required by this part, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed statement to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(1)(a): each corporation that is required to file a statement has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(1)(b): each statement contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(2): 20A-11-1005 If it appears that any corporation has failed to file any statement, if it appears that a filed statement does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any statement, the lieutenant governor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(2)(a): 20A-11-1005 impose a fine against the corporation in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(2)(b): within five days of discovery of a violation or receipt of a written complaint, notify the corporation of the violation or written complaint and direct the corporation to file a statement correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(3): (3)(a); (3)(a); (3)(b); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(3)(a): It is unlawful for any corporation to fail to file or amend a statement within seven days after receiving notice from the lieutenant governor under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-703(3)(b): (3)(a) Each corporation that violates Subsection
