Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704 Statement of organization required for certain new corporations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(1): A corporation that is incorporated, organized, or otherwise created less than 90 days before the date of a general election shall file a statement of organization with the lieutenant governor's office before making a contribution to a political action committee or a political issues committee in association with the election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(2): The statement of organization shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(2)(a): the name and street address of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(2)(b): the name, street address, phone number, occupation, and title of one or more individuals that have primary decision-making authority for the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(2)(c): the name, street address, phone number, occupation, and title of the corporation's chief financial officer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(2)(d): the name, street address, occupation, and title of all other officers or managers of the corporation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(2)(e): the name, street address, and occupation of each member of the corporation's governing and advisory boards, if any.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(3): (1); (1); (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(3)(a): (1); (1) A corporation shall file with the lieutenant governor's office a notice of intent to cease making contributions, if the corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(3)(a)(i): (1) has made a contribution described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(3)(a)(ii): (1) intends to permanently cease making contributions described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-704(3)(b): (3)(a) A notice filed under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705 Notice of in-kind contributions.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(1): (2) A corporation that makes an in-kind contribution to a reporting entity shall, in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(1)(a): the name and address of the corporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(1)(b): the date of the in-kind expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(1)(c): a description of the in-kind expenditure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(1)(d): the value, in dollars, of the in-kind expenditure.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(2): (1); (2)(b) A corporation shall provide the written notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(2)(a): (2)(b) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(2)(b): within seven business days after the day on which the corporation makes the in-kind contribution, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(2)(b)(i): the in-kind contribution is to a candidate who is contested in a convention and the corporation makes the in-kind contribution within 30 days before the day on which the convention is held;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(2)(b)(ii): the in-kind contribution is to a candidate who is contested in a primary election and the corporation makes the in-kind contribution within 30 days before the day on which the primary election is held; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(2)(b)(iii): the in-kind contribution is to a candidate who is contested in a general election and the corporation makes the in-kind contribution within 30 days before the day on which the general election is held.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(3): (1) A corporation that provides, and a reporting entity that receives, the written notice described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(4): A corporation or reporting entity that fails to comply with the requirements of this section is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-705(5): A person that intentionally or knowingly provides, or conspires to provide, false information on a written notice described in this section is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(1): (4); (1)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(1)(a)(ii): electronically, before midnight on January 10 of each year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(1)(b): (1)(a) If a political issues committee is organized after the filing deadline described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(1)(b)(i): receives political issues contributions totaling at least $750; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(1)(b)(ii): distributes political issues expenditures totaling at least $750.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(1)(c): Each political issues committee shall deposit each contribution received into one or more separate accounts in a financial institution that are dedicated only to that purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(2)(a): Each political issues committee shall designate two officers that have primary decision-making authority for the political issues committee.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(4)(b): A political issues committee may not donate money to a political action committee, but may accept a contribution from a political action committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(4)(c): Any notice of dissolution filed by a political issues committee does not exempt that political issues committee from complying with the financial reporting requirements of this chapter in relation to all contributions received, and all expenditures made, before, at, or after dissolution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(4)(d): (4)(a) A political issues committee shall report all money donated or expended under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-801(5): (4); (2); (2)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802 Political issues committees -- Financial reporting.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1): 20A-7-204.1; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-105
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a): 20A-7-204.1; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-105 Each registered political issues committee that has received political issues contributions totaling at least $750, or disbursed political issues expenditures totaling at least $750, during a calendar year, shall file a verified financial statement with the lieutenant governor's office:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(i): on January 10, reporting contributions and expenditures as of December 31 of the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(ii): seven days before the state political convention of each major political party;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(iii): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(iv): seven days before the date of an incorporation election, if the political issues committee has received or expended funds to affect an incorporation;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(v): 20A-7-204.1 at least three days before the first public hearing held as required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(vi): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-105 if the political issues committee has received or expended funds in relation to an initiative or referendum, five days before the deadline for the initiative or referendum sponsors to submit:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(vi)(A): 20A-7-105 the verified and certified initiative packets under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(vi)(B): 20A-7-105 the signed and verified referendum packets under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(vii): on September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(viii): seven days before:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(viii)(A): the municipal general election; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(a)(viii)(B): the regular general election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(b): The political issues committee shall report:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(b)(i): a detailed listing of all contributions received and expenditures made since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(b)(ii): all contributions and expenditures as of five days before the required filing date of the financial statement, except for a financial statement filed on January 10.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(1)(c): The political issues committee need not file a statement under this section if it received no contributions and made no expenditures during the reporting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2): (2)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a): (2)(c) That statement shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(i): the name and address, if known, of any individual who makes a political issues contribution to the reporting political issues committee, and the amount of the political issues contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(ii): the identification of any publicly identified class of individuals that makes a political issues contribution to the reporting political issues committee, and the amount of the political issues contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(iii): the name and address, if known, of any political issues committee, group, or entity that makes a political issues contribution to the reporting political issues committee, and the amount of the political issues contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(iv): the name and address of each reporting entity that makes a political issues contribution to the reporting political issues committee, and the amount of the political issues contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(v): for each nonmonetary contribution, the fair market value of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(vi): (2)(c) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(vii): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(viii): the total amount of political issues contributions received and political issues expenditures disbursed by the reporting political issues committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(ix): a statement by the political issues committee's treasurer or chief financial officer certifying that, to the best of the person's knowledge, the financial statement is accurate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(x): a summary page in the form required by the lieutenant governor that identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(x)(A): beginning balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(x)(B): total contributions during the period since the last statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(x)(C): total contributions to date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(x)(D): total expenditures during the period since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(a)(x)(E): total expenditures to date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(b)(i): Political issues contributions received by a political issues committee that have a value of $50 or less need not be reported individually, but shall be listed on the report as an aggregate total.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(b)(ii): Two or more political issues contributions from the same source that have an aggregate total of more than $50 may not be reported in the aggregate, but shall be reported separately.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(c): When reporting political issue expenditures made to circulators of initiative petitions, the political issues committee:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(c)(i): need only report the amount paid to each initiative petition circulator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(2)(c)(ii): need not report the name or address of the circulator.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(3): (3)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(3)(a): (3) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(3)(a)(i): for a cash contribution, that the cash is given to a political issues committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(3)(a)(ii): for a contribution that is a negotiable instrument or check, that the negotiable instrument or check is negotiated; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(3)(a)(iii): for any other type of contribution, that any portion of the contribution's benefit inures to the political issues committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(3)(b): A political issues committee shall report each contribution to the lieutenant governor within 31 days after the contribution is received.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(4): A political issues committee may not expend a contribution for a political issues expenditure if the contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(4)(a): is cash or a negotiable instrument;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(4)(b): exceeds $50; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(4)(c): is from an unknown source.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(5): Within 31 days after receiving a contribution that is cash or a negotiable instrument, exceeds $50, and is from an unknown source, a political issues committee shall disburse the amount of the contribution to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(5)(a): the treasurer of the state or a political subdivision for deposit into the state's or political subdivision's general fund; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-802(5)(b): an organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803 Criminal penalties -- Fines.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(1): (1); (1)(a); 20A-11-1005; 20A-11-802(1)(a)(vii); (viii); (1)(c)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(1)(a): (1); (1)(a) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(1)(a)(i): the financial statement accurately and completely details the information required by this part except for inadvertent omissions or insignificant errors or inaccuracies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(1)(a)(ii): (1)(a) the political issues committee corrects the omissions, errors, or inaccuracies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(1)(b): 20A-11-1005 Each political issues committee that fails to file a completed financial statement before the deadline is subject to a fine imposed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(1)(c): 20A-11-802(1)(a)(vii); (viii) Each political issues committee that fails to file a completed financial statement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(1)(d): (1)(c) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(2): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of the January 10 statement, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed statement to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(2)(a): each political issues committee that is required to file a statement has filed one; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(2)(b): each statement contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(3): If it appears that any political issues committee has failed to file the January 10 statement, if it appears that a filed statement does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any statement, the lieutenant governor shall, within five days after the day on which the lieutenant governor discovers the violation or receives the written complaint, notify the political issues committee of the violation or written complaint and direct the political issues committee to file a statement correcting the problem.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(4): (4)(a); (4)(a); (4)(b); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(4)(a): It is unlawful for any political issues committee to fail to file or amend a statement within seven days after the day on which the political issues committee receives notice from the lieutenant governor under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(4)(b): (4)(a) Each political issues committee that violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(4)(c): (4)(a) The lieutenant governor shall report all violations of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-803(4)(d): (4)(b); (4)(a) In addition to the criminal penalty described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901 Political advertisements -- Requirement that ads designate responsibility and authorization -- Report to lieutenant governor -- Unauthorized use of endorsements.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(1)(a): Whenever any person makes an expenditure for the purpose of financing an advertisement expressly advocating for the election or defeat of a clearly identified candidate, or solicits any contribution through any broadcasting station, newspaper, magazine, outdoor advertising facility, direct mailing, or any other type of general public political advertising, the advertisement:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(1)(a)(i): if paid for and authorized by a candidate or the candidate's campaign committee, shall clearly state that the advertisement has been paid for by the candidate or the campaign committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(1)(a)(ii): if paid for by another person but authorized by a candidate or the candidate's campaign committee, shall clearly state who paid for the advertisement and that the candidate or the campaign committee authorized the advertisement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(1)(a)(iii): if not authorized by a candidate or a candidate's campaign committee, shall clearly state the name of the person who paid for the advertisement and state that the advertisement is not authorized by any candidate or candidate's committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2): (2)(b); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(a): (2)(b) A person that makes an expenditure for the purpose of financing an advertisement related to a ballot proposition shall ensure that the advertisement complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(a)(i): for placing a ballot proposition on the ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(a)(ii): for keeping a ballot proposition off the ballot;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(a)(iii): that a voter refrain from voting on a ballot proposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(a)(iv): that a voter vote for or against a ballot proposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(b): (2)(a) An advertisement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(b)(i): if paid for by a political issues committee, clearly state that the advertisement was paid for by the political issues committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(b)(ii): if paid for by another person but authorized by a political issues committee, clearly state who paid for the advertisement and that the political issues committee authorized the advertisement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(2)(b)(iii): if not authorized by a political issues committee, clearly state the name of the person who paid for the advertisement and state that the advertisement is not authorized by any political issues committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(3): (1); (2) The requirements of Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(3)(a): lawn signs with dimensions of four by eight feet or smaller;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(3)(b): bumper stickers;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(3)(c): campaign pins, buttons, and pens; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(3)(d): similar small items upon which the disclaimer cannot be conveniently printed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4): (4)(a); (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4)(a): A person who is not a reporting entity and pays for an electioneering communication shall file a report with the lieutenant governor within 24 hours of making the payment or entering into a contract to make the payment.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4)(b): (4)(a); (4)(a) The report shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4)(b)(i): (4)(a) the name and address of the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4)(b)(ii): (4)(a) the name and address of each person contributing at least $100 to the person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4)(b)(iii): the amount spent on the electioneering communication;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4)(b)(iv): the name of the identified referenced candidate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(4)(b)(v): the medium used to disseminate the electioneering communication.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(5): A person may not, in order to promote the success of any candidate for nomination or election to any public office, or in connection with any question submitted to the voters, include or cause to be included the name of any person as endorser or supporter in any political advertisement, circular, poster, or publication without the express consent of that person.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(6)(a): It is unlawful for a person to pay the owner, editor, publisher, or agent of any newspaper or other periodical to induce the owner, editor, publisher, or agent to advocate or oppose editorially any candidate for nomination or election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-901(6)(b): It is unlawful for any owner, editor, publisher, or agent to accept any payment to advocate or oppose editorially any candidate for nomination or election.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-903 Rate of charge.
------------------------------------------------
Any person or persons accepting expenditures from a candidate or a personal campaign committee shall provide services and furnish goods, materials, or things of value at a rate that does not exceed the charges made for comparable use to any other person considering amount of use, frequency of use, and applicable discounts.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-904 Contribution given in another's name prohibited.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person may not:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-904(1): make a contribution in the name of another;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-904(2): knowingly permit another to make a contribution in the person's name; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-904(3): knowingly accept a contribution made by one person in the name of another.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-905 Election polls -- Disclosure required.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-905(1): A person who conducts a poll shall disclose to the person being surveyed who paid for the poll before or at the conclusion of the poll.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-905(2): (1); (2)(a) The lieutenant governor shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-905(2)(a): (1) impose a $100 fine on a person who fails to make the disclosure required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-905(2)(b): (2)(a) deposit the fine described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-905(3): (1) A person does not violate Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1001 Electronic form prepared by chief election officer.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The chief election officer shall:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1001(1): Chapter 12, Part 2, Judicial Retention Elections develop and prepare an electronic form for all financial statements required by this chapter and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1001(2): provide access to the electronic form to the secretary of every committee, to every candidate, and to all others who request a form.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002 Retention and public inspection of financial statements -- Written complaint if statement is false or unlawful.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002(1): Chapter 12, Part 2, Judicial Retention Elections; 20A-11-103 The chief election officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002(1)(a): Chapter 12, Part 2, Judicial Retention Elections; 20A-11-103 make each financial statement required by this chapter or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002(1)(a)(i): open to public inspection in the office of the chief election officer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002(1)(a)(ii): 20A-11-103 available for viewing on the Internet in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002(1)(b): preserve those statements for at least five years; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002(1)(c): provide certified copies of the financial statements in the same manner as for other public records.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1002(2): Any candidate or voter may file a written complaint with the chief election officer alleging that a filed financial statement does not conform to law or to the truth.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004 Summary of financial reports of political action committees and corporations.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(1): The lieutenant governor's office shall prepare a summary of each financial report submitted by each corporation, political action committee, and political issues committee.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2): Each summary shall include the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(a): for each candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(a)(i): the name of each political action committee and corporation that made expenditures to the candidate; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(a)(ii): the aggregate total of expenditures made by each political action committee and corporation to the candidate;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(b): for each political action committee:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(b)(i): the name of each individual or organization listed on the financial report that made contributions to the political action committee and the aggregate total of contributions made by each individual or organization listed on the financial report to the political action committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(b)(ii): the name of each candidate, personal campaign committee, and political action committee that received expenditures from a political action committee and the aggregate total of expenditures made to each candidate, personal campaign committee, and political action committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(c): for each corporation:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(c)(i): the name of each candidate, personal campaign committee, and political action committee that received expenditures from the corporation, and the aggregate total of expenditures made by the corporation to each candidate, personal campaign committee, and political action committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(c)(ii): the name of each individual, entity, or group of individuals or entities that received disbursements from the corporation, and the aggregate total of disbursements made by the corporation to each individual, entity, or group of individuals or entities;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(d): for each political issues committee:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(d)(i): the name of each individual or organization listed on the financial report that made political issues contributions to the political issues committee and the aggregate total of political issues contributions made by each individual or organization listed on the financial report to the political issues committee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1004(2)(d)(ii): the name of each individual, entity, or group of individuals or entities that received political issues expenditures from a political issues committee and the aggregate total of political issues expenditures made to each individual, entity, or group of individuals or entities.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1005 Fines for failing to file a financial statement.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1005(1): 20A-11-512(4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1005(2): 20A-9-201(8)(d) If a filing entity is unable to pay the fine or files an affidavit of impecuniosity in a manner similar to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1005(3): The chief election officer shall deposit fines collected under this chapter in the General Fund.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1102 Paid advertisements permitted.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1102(1): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1102(2): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1102(3): The prohibitions contained in this section do not apply if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1102(3)(a): the matter is inserted in the newspaper or periodical as a paid advertisement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1102(3)(b): the matter is designated as a "paid advertisement" in the copy of the advertisement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1102(3)(c): the compensation paid to the newspaper or periodical for inserting the paid advertisement is not more than the regular rate charged by the newspaper or periodical for that service.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1103 False statements in relation to candidates forbidden.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person may not knowingly make or publish, or cause to be made or published, any false statement in relation to any candidate, proposed constitutional amendment, or other measure, that is intended or tends to affect any voting at any primary, convention, or election.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104 Disclosure of synthetic media.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(a): "Artificial intelligence" means a machine-based system that can, for a given set of human-defined objectives, make predictions, recommendations, or decisions influencing real or virtual environments.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(b)(i): "Creator" means a person that uses artificial intelligence to generate synthetic media.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(b)(ii): "Creator" does not include a person that solely provides the technology used in the creation of the synthetic media.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(c): "Digital content provenance" means purely factual information that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(c)(i): details a digital resource's creator, origin, context, history, and editing process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(c)(ii): conforms to an open industry technical standard.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(d): "Generative artificial intelligence" means artificial intelligence technology that is capable of creating content such as text, audio, image, or video based on patterns learned from large volumes of data rather than being explicitly programmed with rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(e): "Sponsor" means a person that pays for the content that uses artificial intelligence to generate synthetic media.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(f): "Synthetic audio media" means audio content that was substantially produced by generative artificial intelligence.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(1)(g): "Synthetic visual media" means an image or video that was substantially produced by generative artificial intelligence.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(2): This section applies to an audio or visual communication that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(2)(a): is paid for by a candidate campaign committee, political action committee, political issues committee, political party, or a person using a contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(2)(b): is intended to influence voting for or against a candidate or ballot proposition in an election or primary in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(2)(c): contains synthetic media.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(3): An audio communication described in Subsection (2) that contains synthetic audio media shall include audibly at the beginning and end of the communication the words, "Contains content generated by AI."
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(4): A visual communication described in Subsection (2) that contains synthetic media shall display throughout the duration of each portion of the communication containing synthetic media, in legible writing, the words:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(4)(a): "This video content generated by AI," if the content is a video that includes synthetic visual media but not synthetic audio media;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(4)(b): "This image generated by AI," if the content is an image that includes synthetic visual media but not synthetic audio media;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(4)(c): "This audio content generated by AI," if the video includes synthetic audio media but not synthetic visual media; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(4)(d): "This content generated by AI," if the communication includes both synthetic audio media and synthetic visual media.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(5): In addition to the requirements in Subsections (3) and (4), a creator or sponsor who publishes an online digital audio or visual communication described in Subsection (2) that is viewable, audible, or accessible in the state shall ensure the advertisement carries embedded tamper-evident digital content provenance that discloses:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(5)(a): the initial author and creator of the content;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(5)(b): any subsequent entities that edited, altered, or otherwise modified the content; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(5)(c): any use of generative artificial intelligence in generating or modifying the substantive content.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(6)(a): In a civil action brought against the creator or the sponsor of content that includes synthetic media by a person to enforce this section, the court may impose a civil penalty not to exceed $1,000 against a person for each violation of this section that the court finds a person has committed.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1104(6)(b): Compliance with this section does not exempt a person from civil or criminal liability for violations of other applicable law.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1201 Title.
----------------------------------------
This part is known as the "Political Activities of Public Entities Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202 Definitions.
----------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(1): "Applicable election officer" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(1)(a): a county clerk, if the email relates only to a local election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(1)(b): the lieutenant governor, if the email relates to an election other than a local election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(2): "Ballot proposition" means constitutional amendments, initiatives, referenda, judicial retention questions, opinion questions, bond approvals, or other questions submitted to the voters for their approval or rejection.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3): "Campaign contribution" means any of the following when done for a political purpose or to advocate for or against a ballot proposition:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(a): a gift, subscription, donation, loan, advance, deposit of money, or anything of value given to a filing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(b): an express, legally enforceable contract, promise, or agreement to make a gift, subscription, donation, unpaid or partially unpaid loan, advance, deposit of money, or anything of value to a filing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(c): any transfer of funds from another reporting entity to a filing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(d): compensation paid by any person or reporting entity other than the filing entity for personal services provided without charge to the filing entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(e): remuneration from:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(e)(i): any organization or the organization's directly affiliated organization that has a registered lobbyist; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(e)(ii): any agency or subdivision of the state, including a school district; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(3)(f): an in-kind contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(4)(a): "Commercial interlocal cooperation agency" means an interlocal cooperation agency that receives its revenues from conduct of its commercial operations.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(4)(b): "Commercial interlocal cooperation agency" does not mean an interlocal cooperation agency that receives some or all of its revenues from:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(4)(b)(i): government appropriations;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(4)(b)(ii): taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(4)(b)(iii): government fees imposed for regulatory or revenue raising purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(4)(b)(iv): interest earned on public funds or other returns on investment of public funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(5): "Expenditure" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(5)(a): a purchase, payment, donation, distribution, loan, advance, deposit, gift of money, or anything of value;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(5)(b): an express, legally enforceable contract, promise, or agreement to make any purchase, payment, donation, distribution, loan, advance, deposit, gift of money, or anything of value;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(5)(c): a transfer of funds between a public entity and a candidate's personal campaign committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(5)(d): a transfer of funds between a public entity and a political issues committee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(5)(e): goods or services provided to or for the benefit of a candidate, a candidate's personal campaign committee, or a political issues committee for political purposes at less than fair market value.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(6): 20A-11-101 "Filing entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(7): "Governmental interlocal cooperation agency" means an interlocal cooperation agency that receives some or all of its revenues from:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(7)(a): government appropriations;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(7)(b): taxes;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(7)(c): government fees imposed for regulatory or revenue raising purposes; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(7)(d): interest earned on public funds or other returns on investment of public funds.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(8): "Influence" means to campaign or advocate for or against a ballot proposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(9): Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act "Interlocal cooperation agency" means an entity created by interlocal agreement under the authority of
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(10): "Political purposes" means an act done with the intent or in a way to influence or intend to influence, directly or indirectly, any person to refrain from voting or to vote for or against any:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(10)(a): candidate for public office at any caucus, political convention, primary, or election; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(10)(b): judge standing for retention at any election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(11): 20A-7-202; 20A-7-502 "Proposed initiative" means an initiative proposed in an application filed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(12): 20A-7-302; 20A-7-602 "Proposed referendum" means a referendum proposed in an application filed under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(13): Title 26A, Local Health Authorities
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(13)(a): "Public entity" includes the state, each state agency, each county, municipality, school district, special district, governmental interlocal cooperation agency, and each administrative subunit of each of them.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(13)(b): "Public entity" does not include a commercial interlocal cooperation agency.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(13)(c): Title 26A, Local Health Authorities "Public entity" includes local health departments created under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(14): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(14)(a): "Public funds" means any money received by a public entity from appropriations, taxes, fees, interest, or other returns on investment.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(14)(b): "Public funds" does not include money donated to a public entity by a person or entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(15)(a): "Public official" means an elected or appointed member of government with authority to make or determine public policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(15)(b): "Public official" includes the person or group that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(15)(b)(i): has supervisory authority over the personnel and affairs of a public entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(15)(b)(ii): approves the expenditure of funds for the public entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(16): 20A-11-101 "Reporting entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(17): Title 17B, Limited Purpose Local Government Entities - Special Districts; Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(17)(a): Title 17B, Limited Purpose Local Government Entities - Special Districts "Special district" means an entity under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(17)(b): Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act "Special district" includes a special service district under
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(18): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(18)(a): "State agency" means each department, commission, board, council, agency, institution, officer, corporation, fund, division, office, committee, authority, laboratory, library, unit, bureau, panel, or other administrative unit of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1202(18)(b): "State agency" includes the legislative branch, the Utah Board of Higher Education, each institution of higher education board of trustees, and each higher education institution.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203 Public entity prohibited from expending public funds on certain electoral matters.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(1): 20A-11-1206 Unless specifically required by law, and except as provided in Subsection (5) or Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(1)(a): make an expenditure from public funds for political purposes, to influence a ballot proposition, or to influence a proposed initiative or proposed referendum; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(1)(b): publish on the public entity's website an argument for or against a ballot proposition, a proposed initiative, or a proposed referendum.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(2): A violation of this section does not invalidate an otherwise valid election.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(3): This section does not prohibit the reasonable expenditure of public funds to gather information for, and respond directly to, an individual who makes an inquiry regarding a ballot proposition, a proposed initiative, or a proposed referendum.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4): 20A-7-401.5 This section does not prohibit:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(a): a public entity from conducting research, or collecting and compiling information or arguments in relation to, a ballot proposition, a proposed initiative, or a proposed referendum;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(b): an elected or appointed official of the public entity described in Subsection (4)(a) from using the research, information, or arguments described in Subsection (4)(a) for the purpose of advocating for or against a ballot proposition, proposed initiative, or proposed referendum via a website, or another medium, not owned or controlled by the public entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(c): a public entity from posting on the public entity's website a link to another website, with a brief description, that is not owned or controlled by a public entity, or from publishing in any medium owned, controlled, or paid for by a public entity a website address, with a brief description, where an individual may view research, information, and arguments for or against a ballot proposition, proposed initiative, or proposed referendum if the public entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(c)(i): before posting the link or publishing the address, provides at least seven days written notice to the sponsors of the ballot proposition, proposed initiative, or proposed referendum:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(c)(i)(A): of the public entity's intent to post the link or publish the address;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(c)(i)(B): a description of each medium in which the public entity intends to post the link or publish the address; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(c)(i)(C): the dates of the publication or posting; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(c)(ii): posts, immediately adjacent to the link or address, and brief description described in Subsection (4)(c)(i), a link to, or an address for, a website, with a brief description, containing the sponsors' research, information, and arguments for or against the ballot proposition, proposed initiative, or proposed referendum, if the sponsors provide a link or address within seven days after the day on which the sponsors receive the notice described in Subsection (4)(c)(i); or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(4)(d): 20A-7-401.5 a public entity from posting on the public entity's website, or any medium, a complete copy of a proposition information pamphlet described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1203(5): Subsection (1) does not prohibit a public entity from taking an action under Title 53G, Chapter 3, Part 3, Creating a New School District, that is necessary for the public entity to seek the creation of a new school district.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1204 Criminal penalty.
---------------------------------------------------
Each public official who violates Section

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205 Use of public email for a political purpose.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(1): (5) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(1)(a): for a political purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(1)(b): to advocate for or against a proposed initiative, initiative, proposed referendum, referendum, a proposed bond, a bond, or any ballot proposition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(1)(c): to solicit a campaign contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(2): (1); (3); (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(2)(a): (1); (3) The lieutenant governor shall, after giving the person and the complainant notice and an opportunity to be heard, impose a civil fine against a person who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(2)(a)(i): up to $250 for a first violation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(2)(a)(ii): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(2)(b): (2) A person may, within 30 days after the day on which the lieutenant governor imposes a fine against the person under this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(3): The lieutenant governor shall consider a violation of this section as a first violation if the violation is committed more than seven years after the day on which the person last committed a violation of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(4): For purposes of this section, one violation means one act of sending an email, regardless of the number of recipients of the email.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5): (1); 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; (5)(d)(v) A person does not violate this section if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(a): (1) the lieutenant governor finds that the email described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(b): the person is directly providing information solely to another person or a group of people in response to a question asked by the other person or group of people;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(c): 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402 the information the person emails is an argument or rebuttal argument prepared under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(c)(i): relates to the same proposed initiative, initiative, proposed referendum, or referendum; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(c)(ii): 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402 complies with the requirements of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(d)(i): an internal communication solely within the public entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(d)(ii): a communication solely with another public entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1205(5)(d)(iii): a communication solely with legal counsel;

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206 Exclusions.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(1): Nothing in this chapter prohibits a public official from speaking, campaigning, contributing personal money, or otherwise exercising the public official's individual First Amendment rights for political purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(2)(a): (2)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(2)(b): A county or municipality may not provide any information to the public about a proposed initiative, initiative, proposed referendum, or referendum unless the county or municipality:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(2)(b)(i): provides the information in a manner required, or expressly permitted, by law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(2)(b)(ii): is directly providing information solely to a person or a group of people in response to a question asked by the person or group of people.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(3): Nothing in this chapter prohibits a public entity from the neutral encouragement of voters to vote.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(4): Nothing in this chapter prohibits an elected official from campaigning or advocating for or against a ballot proposition.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(5): (6); 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; 59-1-1604; 20A-7-405; 59-1-1605 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(5)(a): 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; 59-1-1604 prepare and publish a written argument or written rebuttal argument in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(5)(b): 20A-7-405; 59-1-1605 prepare an argument for, and present an argument at, a public meeting under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(6): 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402 A county or municipality may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(6)(a): 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402; 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402 publish an argument or rebuttal argument prepared under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(6)(a)(i): relates to the same proposed initiative, initiative, proposed referendum, or referendum; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(6)(a)(ii): 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402 complies with the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(6)(b): 20A-7-401.5; 20A-7-402 publish an argument or rebuttal argument for or against a proposed initiative, initiative, proposed referendum, or referendum that was not prepared and submitted in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1206(6)(c): present an argument or rebuttal argument for or against a proposed initiative, initiative, proposed referendum, or referendum at a public meeting, unless the county or municipality provides equal opportunity for persons to present opposing arguments and rebuttal arguments at the public meeting.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301 School board office -- Campaign finance requirements -- Candidate as a political action committee officer -- No personal use -- Contribution reporting deadline -- Report other accounts -- Anonymous contributions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601; (1)(a)(i); 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601; (1)(a)(i); (1)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(a): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(a)(i): Each school board office candidate shall deposit each contribution received in one or more separate accounts in a financial institution that are dedicated only to that purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(a)(ii): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601 A school board office candidate may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(a)(ii)(A): 20A-11-601 receive a contribution from a political action committee registered under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(a)(ii)(B): 20A-11-601 be designated by a political action committee as an officer who has primary decision-making authority as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(b): (1)(a)(i) A school board office candidate may not use money deposited in an account described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(b)(i): a personal use expenditure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(b)(ii): an expenditure prohibited by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(c): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(c)(i): Each school board officeholder shall deposit each contribution and public service assistance received in one or more separate accounts in a financial institution that are dedicated only to that purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(c)(ii): 20A-11-601; 20A-11-601 A school board officeholder may:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(c)(ii)(A): 20A-11-601 receive a contribution or public service assistance from a political action committee registered under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(c)(ii)(B): 20A-11-601 be designated by a political action committee as an officer who has primary decision-making authority as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(d): (1)(a)(i); (1)(c)(i) A school board officeholder may not use money deposited in an account described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(d)(i): a personal use expenditure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(1)(d)(ii): an expenditure prohibited by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(2)(a): A school board office candidate may not deposit or mingle any contributions received into a personal or business account.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(2)(b): A school board officeholder may not deposit or mingle any contributions or public service assistance received into a personal or business account.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(3): A school board office candidate or school board officeholder may not make any political expenditures prohibited by law.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(4): 20A-11-1302; 20A-11-1304 If a person who is no longer a school board office candidate chooses not to expend the money remaining in a campaign account, the person shall continue to file the year-end summary report required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(5): (5)(b); 20A-11-402

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(5)(b): A person who is no longer a school board office candidate may transfer the money in a campaign account in a manner that would cause the former school board office candidate to recognize the money as taxable income under federal tax law if the transfer is made to a campaign account for federal office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(6): (6); 20A-11-1303(1)(a); (6)(d); (6)(b)(ii); (6)(b); (6)(b); (6)(b); (6)(c); (6)(c); (6)(c)

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(6)(b)(ii): within seven business days after the day on which the contribution is received, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(6)(b)(ii)(A): the school board office candidate is contested in a convention and the contribution is received within 30 days before the day on which the convention is held;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(6)(b)(ii)(B): the school board office candidate is contested in a primary election and the contribution is received within 30 days before the day on which the primary election is held; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(6)(b)(ii)(C): the school board office candidate is contested in a general election and the contribution is received within 30 days before the day on which the general election is held.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(6)(c): (6)(b); (6)(b); (6)(b) For each contribution that a school board office candidate fails to report within the time period described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(6)(e)(ii)(D): the date of the contribution.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(7): Within 31 days after receiving a contribution that is cash or a negotiable instrument, exceeds $50, and is from an unknown source, a school board office candidate shall disburse the contribution to an organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(8)(b): A school board office candidate shall include on any financial statement filed in accordance with this part:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(8)(b)(i): a contribution deposited in an account:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(8)(b)(i)(A): since the last campaign finance statement was filed; or

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(8)(b)(ii): an expenditure made from an account:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(8)(b)(ii)(A): since the last campaign finance statement was filed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1301(8)(b)(ii)(B): that has not been reported under a statute or ordinance that governs the account.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302 School board office candidate -- Financial reporting requirements -- Year-end summary report.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(1): (1)(a); 20A-11-1304
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(1)(a): Each school board office candidate shall file a summary report by January 10 of the year after the regular general election year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(1)(b): (1)(a); 20A-11-1304 In addition to the requirements of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2): 20A-11-601
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a): 20A-11-601 Each summary report shall include the following information as of December 31 of the previous year:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(i): the net balance of the last financial statement, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(ii): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all interim reports, if any, during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(iii): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all interim reports, if any, filed during the previous year;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(iv): a detailed listing of each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(v): for each nonmonetary contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(v)(A): the fair market value of the contribution with that information provided by the contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(v)(B): a specific description of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(vi): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on an interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(vii): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(viii): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts minus all expenditures; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(a)(ix): 20A-11-601 the name of a political action committee for which the school board office candidate is designated as an officer who has primary decision-making authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(b): In preparing the report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of December 31 of the previous year.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(2)(c): A check or negotiable instrument received by a school board office candidate on or before December 31 of the previous year shall be included in the summary report.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1302(3): The school board office candidate shall certify in the summary report that, to the best of the school board office candidate's knowledge, all receipts and all expenditures have been reported as of December 31 of the previous year and that there are no bills or obligations outstanding and unpaid except as set forth in that report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303 School board office candidate and school board officeholder -- Financial reporting requirements -- Interim reports.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1): (1); 20A-11-1301(1)(a)(i); (c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a): As used in this section, "received" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a)(i): for a cash contribution, that the cash is given to a school board office candidate or a member of the school board office candidate's personal campaign committee;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a)(ii): for a contribution that is a check or other negotiable instrument, that the check or other negotiable instrument is negotiated;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a)(iii): for a direct deposit made into a campaign account by a person not associated with the campaign, the earlier of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a)(iii)(A): the day on which the school board office candidate or a member of the school board office candidate's personal campaign committee becomes aware of the deposit and the source of the deposit;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a)(iii)(B): the day on which the school board office candidate or a member of the school board office candidate's personal campaign committee receives notice of the deposit and the source of the deposit by mail, email, text, or similar means; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a)(iii)(C): 31 days after the day on which the direct deposit occurs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(a)(iv): for any other type of contribution, that any portion of the contribution's benefit inures to the school board office candidate.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(b): (1); 20A-11-1301(1)(a)(i); (c)(i) As used in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(c): Each school board office candidate shall file an interim report at the following times in any year in which the candidate has filed a declaration of candidacy for a public office:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(c)(i): May 15;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(c)(ii): seven days before the regular primary election date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(c)(iii): September 30; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(1)(c)(iv): seven days before the regular general election date.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2): 20A-11-601 Each interim report shall include the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(a): the net balance of the last summary report, if any;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(b): a single figure equal to the total amount of receipts reported on all prior interim reports, if any, during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(c): a single figure equal to the total amount of expenditures reported on all prior interim reports, if any, filed during the calendar year in which the interim report is due;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(d): a detailed listing of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(d)(i): for a school board office candidate, each contribution received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(d)(ii): for a school board officeholder, each contribution and public service assistance received since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(e): for each nonmonetary contribution:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(e)(i): the fair market value of the contribution with that information provided by the contributor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(e)(ii): a specific description of the contribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(f): a detailed listing of each expenditure made since the last summary report that has not been reported in detail on a prior interim report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(g): for each nonmonetary expenditure, the fair market value of the expenditure;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(h): a net balance for the year consisting of the net balance from the last summary report, if any, plus all receipts since the last summary report minus all expenditures since the last summary report;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(i): a summary page in the form required by the lieutenant governor that identifies:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(i)(i): beginning balance;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(i)(ii): total contributions during the period since the last statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(i)(iii): total contributions to date;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(i)(iv): total expenditures during the period since the last statement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(i)(v): total expenditures to date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(2)(j): 20A-11-601 the name of a political action committee for which the school board office candidate or school board officeholder is designated as an officer who has primary decision-making authority under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(3)(a): In preparing each interim report, all receipts and expenditures shall be reported as of five days before the required filing date of the report.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1303(3)(b): Any negotiable instrument or check received by a school board office candidate or school board officeholder more than five days before the required filing date of a report required by this section shall be included in the interim report.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304 School board office candidate -- Financial reporting requirements -- Termination of duty to report.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304(1): Each school board candidate is subject to interim reporting requirements until the candidate withdraws or is eliminated in a primary.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304(2): 20A-11-1301; 20A-11-1302 Each school board office candidate is subject to year-end summary reporting requirements until the candidate has filed a statement of dissolution with the lieutenant governor stating that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304(2)(a): the school board office candidate is no longer receiving contributions and is no longer making expenditures;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304(2)(b): 20A-11-1301 the ending balance on the last summary report filed is zero and the balance in the separate bank account required in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304(2)(c): 20A-11-1302 a final summary report in the form required by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304(3): A statement of dissolution and a final summary report may be filed at any time.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1304(4): 20A-11-1302 Each school board office candidate shall continue to file the year-end summary report required by Section


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305 School board office candidate -- Failure to file statement -- Penalties.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(1): 20A-11-1005 A school board office candidate who fails to file a financial statement by the deadline is subject to a fine imposed in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(2): 20A-11-1303(1)(c)(i); (iv) If a school board office candidate fails to file an interim report described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(2)(a): that the school board office candidate failed to timely file the report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(2)(b): that, if the school board office candidate fails to file the report within 24 hours after the deadline for filing the report, the school board office candidate will be disqualified and the political party will not be permitted to replace the candidate.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(3): 20A-11-1303(1)(c)(i); (iv); (3)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(3)(b): (3)(a) The political party of a school board office candidate who is disqualified under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(4)(a): notify every opposing candidate for the school board office that the school board office candidate is disqualified;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(4)(b): send an email notification to each voter who is eligible to vote in the school board office race for whom the election officer has an email address informing the voter that the school board office candidate is disqualified and that votes cast for the school board office candidate will not be counted;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(4)(c): post notice of the disqualification on the election officer's website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(4)(d): if practicable, remove the school board office candidate's name from the ballot.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(5): (4) An election officer may fulfill the requirement described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(6)(c): (6)(b) the omissions, errors, or inaccuracies described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(7): (7)(b); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(i); (7)(c)(ii); (7)(c)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(7)(a): Within 60 days after a deadline for the filing of a summary report, the lieutenant governor shall review each filed summary report to ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(7)(a)(i): each school board office candidate who is required to file a summary report has filed the report; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(7)(a)(ii): each summary report contains the information required by this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-11-1305(7)(b): If it appears that a school board office candidate has failed to file the summary report required by law, if it appears that a filed summary report does not conform to the law, or if the lieutenant governor has received a written complaint alleging a violation of the law or the falsity of any summary report, the lieutenant governor shall, within five days of discovery of a violation or receipt of a written complaint, notify the school board office candidate of the violation or written complaint and direct the school board office candidate to file a summary report correcting the problem.
