Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(2)(g): one member appointed jointly by the legislative leader of the largest minority political party in the Senate and the legislative leader of the largest minority political party in the House of Representatives.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(3): (2); (2) An appointing authority described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(3)(a): shall make the appointments no later than:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(3)(a)(i): February 1 of the year immediately following a decennial year; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(3)(a)(ii): if there is a change in the number of congressional, legislative, or other districts resulting from an event other than a national decennial enumeration made by the authority of the United States, the day on which the Legislature appoints a committee to draw maps in relation to the change;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(3)(b): may remove a commission member appointed by the appointing authority, for cause; and

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(5)(a): 36-11-102 be a lobbyist or principal, as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(5)(b): be a candidate for or holder of any elective office, including federal elective office, state elective office, or local government elective office;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(5)(c): be a candidate for or holder of any office of a political party, except for delegates to a political party's convention;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(5)(d): be an employee of, or a paid consultant for, a political party, political party committee, personal campaign committee, or any political action committee affiliated with a political party or controlled by an elected official or candidate for elective office, including any local government office;

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(6)(b): may not, in the sole determination of the appointing authority, be an individual who is affiliated with a partisan organization or cause.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(10): The commission shall meet upon the request of a majority of the commission members or when the chair calls a meeting.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(11)(a): A majority of the members of the commission constitutes a quorum.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(11)(b): The commission takes official action by a majority vote of a quorum present at a meeting of the commission.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(13)(a): access announcements and records of commission meetings and hearings;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(13)(b): access maps presented to, or under consideration by, the commission;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(13)(c): 20A-20-302(8) access evaluations described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(13)(d): submit a map to the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-201(13)(e): submit comments on a map presented to, or under consideration by, the commission.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-202 Software and software services.
----------------------------------------------------------------
The Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel shall, when procuring software, licenses for using the software, and software support services for redistricting by the Legislature, include in the requests for proposals and the resulting contracts that the commission may purchase the same software, licenses for using the software, and software support services, under the contracts at the same cost and under the same terms provided to the Legislature.

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301 Public hearings -- Private conversations.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a): The commission shall, by majority vote, determine the number, locations, and dates of public hearings to be held by the commission, but shall hold no fewer than seven public hearings throughout the state to discuss maps, as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a)(i): one in the Bear River region, which includes Box Elder, Cache, and Rich counties;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a)(ii): one in the Southwest region, which includes Beaver, Garfield, Iron, Kane, and Washington counties;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a)(iii): one in the Mountain region, which includes Summit, Utah, and Wasatch counties;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a)(iv): one in the Central region, which includes Juab, Millard, Piute, Sanpete, Sevier, and Wayne counties;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a)(v): one in the Southeast region, which includes Carbon, Emery, Grand, and San Juan counties;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a)(vi): one in the Uintah Basin region, which includes Daggett, Duchesne, and Uintah counties; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(a)(vii): one in the Wasatch Front region, which includes Davis, Morgan, Salt Lake, Tooele, and Weber counties.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(b): The commission shall hold at least two public hearings in a first or second class county but not in the same county.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(c): The committee and the commission may coordinate hearing times and locations to:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(c)(i): avoid holding hearings at, or close to, the same time in the same area of the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(1)(c)(ii): to the extent practical, hold hearings in different cities within the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(2): Each public hearing must provide those in attendance a reasonable opportunity to submit written and oral comments to the commission and to propose redistricting maps for the commission's consideration.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(3): (1) The commission shall hold the public hearings described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(3)(a): October 17, if the commission receives the linked PL94-171 data on or before September 1; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(3)(b): 46 days after the day on which the commission receives the linked PL94-171 data, if the commission receives the linked PL94-171 data after September 1.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(4): (4)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(4)(a): A member of the commission may not engage in any private communication with any individual other than other members of the commission or commission staff, including consultants retained by the commission, that is material to any redistricting map or element of a map pending before the commission or intended to be proposed for commission consideration, without making the communication, or a detailed and accurate description of the communication including the names of all parties to the communication and the map or element of the map, available to the commission and to the public.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(4)(b): (4)(a) A member of the commission shall make the disclosure required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5): 20A-20-201(3)(a)(ii); (1); 20A-20-302(2); 20A-20-303(1); 20A-20-303(2) The committee chairs and the chair of the commission shall, no later than two business days after the day on which the Legislature appoints a committee, under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5)(a): reasonably ensures that the commission may complete the commission's duties in a timely manner, consistent with the time frame applicable to the committee and the Legislature;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5)(b): (1); 20A-20-302(2); 20A-20-303(1); 20A-20-303(2) establishes deadlines for the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5)(b)(i): (1) holding the public hearings described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5)(b)(ii): 20A-20-302(2) preparing and recommending maps under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5)(b)(iii): 20A-20-303(1) submitting the maps and written report described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5)(b)(iv): 20A-20-303(2) holding the public meeting described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-301(5)(c): provides that the commission dissolves upon approval of the Legislature's redistricting maps by the governor, or the day following the constitutional time limit of


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302 Selection of recommended maps -- Map requirements and standards.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1): (1)(b)(ii); (iii) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(a): "Map type" means one of four map types, as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(a)(i): a map of all Utah congressional districts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(a)(ii): a map of all state Senate districts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(a)(iii): a map of all state House of Representatives districts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(a)(iv): a map of all State School Board districts.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(b): (1)(b)(ii); (iii) "Total population deviation" means a percentage determined as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(b)(i): calculating the ideal district population by dividing the total population by the number of districts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(b)(ii): calculating the percentage difference between the population of the district with the greatest population and the ideal district population;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(b)(iii): calculating the percentage difference between the population of the district with the lowest population and the ideal district population; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(1)(b)(iv): (1)(b)(ii); (iii) combining the percentage differences described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(2): 20A-20-301(1) The commission shall, no later than 14 days after the day of the final public hearing described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(2)(a): three different maps for congressional districts, with the number of congressional districts apportioned to Utah;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(2)(b): three different maps for state Senate districts, with 29 Senate districts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(2)(c): three different maps for state House of Representatives districts, with 75 House of Representative districts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(2)(d): three different maps for State School Board districts, with 15 State School Board districts.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(3): (2); 20A-20-201(2)(f); 20A-20-201(2)(g)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(3)(a): To the extent possible, each map recommended by the commission shall be approved by at least five members of the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(3)(b): (2); 20A-20-201(2)(f); 20A-20-201(2)(g) If the commission is unable to obtain the approval of at least five members for all maps required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(3)(b)(i): if possible, recommend one map that is approved by at least five members of the commission; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(3)(b)(ii): 20A-20-201(2)(f); 20A-20-201(2)(g) recommend two additional maps that are approved by a majority of commission members, as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(3)(b)(ii)(A): 20A-20-201(2)(f) one of the maps shall be approved by a majority that includes the commission member described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(3)(b)(ii)(B): 20A-20-201(2)(g) one of the maps shall be approved by a majority that includes the commission member described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4): The commission shall ensure that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(a): each map recommended by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(a)(i): is drawn using the official population enumeration of the most recent decennial census;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(a)(ii): for congressional districts, has a total population deviation that does not exceed 1%;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(a)(iii): for Senate, House of Representatives, and State School Board districts, has a total population deviation of less than 10%;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(a)(iv): does not use race as a predominant factor in drawing district lines; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(a)(v): complies with the United States Constitution and all applicable federal laws, including Section 2 of the Voting Rights Act; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(b): each district in each map is:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(b)(i): drawn based on total population;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(b)(ii): a single member district; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(4)(b)(iii): contiguous and reasonably compact.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5): The commission shall define and adopt redistricting standards for use by the commission that require that maps adopted by the commission, to the extent practicable, comply with the following, as defined by the commission:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(a): preserving communities of interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(b): following natural, geographic, or man-made features, boundaries, or barriers;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(c): preserving cores of prior districts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(d): minimizing the division of municipalities and counties across multiple districts;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(e): achieving boundary agreement among different types of districts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(f): prohibiting the purposeful or undue favoring or disfavoring of:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(f)(i): an incumbent elected official;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(f)(ii): a candidate or prospective candidate for elected office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(5)(f)(iii): a political party.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(6): (8) The commission may adopt a standard that prohibits the commission from using any of the following, except for the purpose of conducting an assessment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(6)(a): partisan political data;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(6)(b): political party affiliation information;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(6)(c): voting records;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(6)(d): partisan election results; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(6)(e): residential addresses of incumbents, candidates, or prospective candidates.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(7): (4)(a)(iii) The commission may adopt redistricting standards for use by the commission that require a smaller total population deviation than the total population deviation described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(8): (8)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(8)(a): Three members of the commission may, by affirmative vote, require that commission staff evaluate any map drawn by, or presented to, the commission as a possible map for recommendation by the commission to determine whether the map complies with the redistricting standards adopted by the commission.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-302(8)(b): (8)(a) In conducting an evaluation described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303 Submission of maps to Legislature -- Consideration by Legislature.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(1): 20A-20-301(1); 20A-20-302 The commission shall, no later than 14 days after the day of the final public hearing described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(2): 20A-20-302 The commission shall submit the maps recommended under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3): (2); 20A-20-302; (1); (2); (1) The committee shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3)(a): (2); 20A-20-302; (1) hold the public meeting described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3)(a)(i): 20A-20-302 for the sole purpose of considering each map recommended under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3)(a)(ii): (1) for a year immediately following a decennial year, no later than 15 days after the day on which the commission complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3)(b): (2); (1) at the public meeting described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3)(b)(i): (1) the commission to present and explain the maps described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3)(b)(ii): the public to comment on the maps; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(3)(b)(iii): the committee to discuss the maps.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(4): (2); (3) The Legislature may not enact a redistricting plan before complying with Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-20-303(5): The committee or the Legislature may, but is not required to, vote on or adopt a map submitted to the committee or the Legislature by the commission.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 20A - Chapter 21 - Electronic Signature Gathering
*****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(1): 20A-21-201(4) "Approved device" means a device described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(2): 20A-9-403; 20A-9-408 "Candidate qualification process" means the process, described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(3): 20A-9-101 "Electronic candidate qualification process" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(4): 20A-7-101 "Electronic initiative process" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(5): 20A-7-101 "Electronic referendum process" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(6): 20A-9-101 "Manual candidate qualification process" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(7): "Petition" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(7)(a): as it relates to the electronic initiative process or the electronic referendum process, the electronic record that an individual signs to indicate the individual is in favor of placing the initiative or referendum on the ballot; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(7)(b): as it relates to electronic candidate qualification process, the electronic record that an individual signs to indicate the individual is in favor of placing an individual's name on the ballot to run for a particular elective office.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(8): 20A-7-101; 20A-9-101 "Signature" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(8)(a): 20A-7-101 as it relates to a signature gathered for an initiative or referendum, the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(8)(b): 20A-9-101 as it relates to a signature gathered for the candidate qualification process, the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(9): "Website" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(9)(a): as it relates to the electronic initiative process or the electronic referendum process, the website designated by the lieutenant governor for collecting the signatures and other information relating to the electronic initiative process or the electronic referendum process; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-101(9)(b): as it relates to the electronic candidate qualification process, a website designated by the lieutenant governor for collecting the signatures and other information relating to the electronic candidate qualification process.


Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201 Electronic signature gathering for an initiative, a referendum, or candidate qualification.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"VERIFICATION OF SIGNATURE-GATHERERUtah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1): 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204; 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204; 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304; 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(a): After filing a petition for a statewide initiative or a statewide referendum, and before gathering signatures, the sponsors shall, after consulting with the Office of the Lieutenant Governor, sign a form provided by the Office of the Lieutenant Governor indicating whether the sponsors will gather signatures manually or electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(b): 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204; 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304 If the sponsors indicate, under Subsection (1)(a), that the sponsors will gather signatures electronically:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(b)(i): 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204 in relation to a statewide initiative, signatures for that initiative:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(b)(i)(A): 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217 may only be gathered and submitted electronically, in accordance with this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(b)(i)(B): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204 may not be gathered or submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(b)(ii): 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304 in relation to a statewide referendum, signatures for that referendum:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(b)(ii)(A): 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315 may only be gathered and submitted electronically, in accordance with this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(b)(ii)(B): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304 may not be gathered or submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(c): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204; 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304; 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315 If the sponsors indicate, under Subsection (1)(a), that the sponsors will gather signatures manually:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(c)(i): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204; 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217 in relation to a statewide initiative, signatures for that initiative:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(c)(i)(A): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-204 may only be gathered and submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(c)(i)(B): 20A-7-215; 20A-7-216; 20A-7-217 may not be gathered or submitted electronically, as described in this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(c)(ii): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304; 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315 in relation to a statewide referendum, signatures for that referendum:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(c)(ii)(A): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-304 may only be gathered and submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(1)(c)(ii)(B): 20A-7-313; 20A-7-314; 20A-7-315 may not be gathered or submitted electronically, as described in this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2): 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504; 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504; 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604; 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(a): After filing a petition for a local initiative or a local referendum, and before gathering signatures, the sponsors shall, after consulting with the local clerk's office, sign a form provided by the local clerk's office indicating whether the sponsors will gather signatures manually or electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(b): 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504; 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604 If the sponsors indicate, under Subsection (2)(a), that the sponsors will gather signatures electronically:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(b)(i): 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504 in relation to a local initiative, signatures for that initiative:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(b)(i)(A): 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516 may only be gathered and submitted electronically, in accordance with this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(b)(i)(B): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504 may not be gathered or submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(b)(ii): 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604 in relation to a local referendum, signatures for that referendum:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(b)(ii)(A): 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616 may only be gathered and submitted electronically, in accordance with this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(b)(ii)(B): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604 may not be gathered or submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(c): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504; 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604; 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616 If the sponsors indicate, under Subsection (2)(a), that the sponsors will gather signatures manually:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(c)(i): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504; 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516 in relation to a local initiative, signatures for that initiative:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(c)(i)(A): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-504 may only be gathered and submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(c)(i)(B): 20A-7-514; 20A-7-515; 20A-7-516 may not be gathered or submitted electronically, as described in this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(c)(ii): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604; 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616 in relation to a local referendum, signatures for that referendum:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(c)(ii)(A): 20A-7-105; 20A-7-604 may only be gathered and submitted using the manual signature-gathering process described in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(2)(c)(ii)(B): 20A-7-614; 20A-7-615; 20A-7-616 may not be gathered or submitted electronically, as described in this section and Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3)(a): After a candidate files a notice of intent to gather signatures to qualify for a ballot, and before gathering signatures, the candidate shall, after consulting with the election officer, sign a form provided by the election officer indicating whether the candidate will gather signatures manually or electronically.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3)(b): If a candidate indicates, under Subsection (3)(a), that the candidate will gather signatures electronically, signatures for the candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3)(b)(i): may only be gathered and submitted using the electronic candidate qualification process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3)(b)(ii): may not be gathered or submitted using the manual candidate qualification process.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3)(c): If a candidate indicates, under Subsection (3)(a), that the candidate will gather signatures manually, signatures for the candidate:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3)(c)(i): may only be gathered and submitted using the manual candidate qualification process; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(3)(c)(ii): may not be gathered or submitted using the electronic candidate qualification process.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4): To gather a signature electronically, a signature-gatherer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(a): use a device provided by the signature-gatherer or a sponsor of the petition that:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(a)(i): is approved by the lieutenant governor;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(a)(ii): except as provided in Subsection (4)(a)(iii), does not store a signature or any other information relating to an individual signing the petition in any location other than the location used by the website to store the information;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(a)(iii): does not, on the device, store a signature or any other information relating to an individual signing the petition except for the minimum time necessary to upload information to the website;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(a)(iv): does not contain any applications, software, or data other than those approved by the lieutenant governor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(a)(v): complies with cyber-security and other security protocols required by the lieutenant governor;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(b): use the approved device to securely access a website designated by the lieutenant governor, directly, or via an application designated by the lieutenant governor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(c): while connected to the website, present the approved device to an individual considering signing the petition and, while the signature-gatherer is in the physical presence of the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(c)(i): wait for the individual to reach each screen presented to the individual on the approved device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(4)(c)(ii): wait for the individual to advance to each subsequent screen by clicking on the acknowledgement at the bottom of the screen.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(5): Each screen shown on an approved device as part of the signature-gathering process shall appear as a continuous electronic document that, if the entire document does not appear on the screen at once, requires the individual viewing the screen to, before advancing to the next screen, scroll through the document until the individual reaches the end of the document.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6): After advancing through each screen required for the petition, the signature process shall proceed as follows:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(a): except as provided in Subsection (6)(b):
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(a)(i): the individual desiring to sign the petition shall present the individual's driver license or state identification card to the signature-gatherer;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(a)(ii): the signature-gatherer shall verify that the individual pictured on the driver license or state identification card is the individual signing the petition;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(a)(iii): the signature-gatherer shall scan or enter the driver license number or state identification card number through the approved device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(a)(iv): immediately after the signature-gatherer complies with Subsection (6)(a)(iii), the website shall determine whether the individual desiring to sign the petition is eligible to sign the petition;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b): if the individual desiring to sign the petition is unable to provide a driver license or state identification card to the signature gatherer:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b)(i): the individual may present other valid voter identification;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b)(ii): if the valid voter identification contains a picture of the individual, the signature-gatherer shall verify that the individual pictured is the individual signing the petition;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b)(iii): if the valid voter identification does not contain a picture of the individual, the signature-gatherer shall, to the extent reasonably practicable, use the individual's address or other available means to determine whether the identification relates to the individual presenting the identification;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b)(iv): the signature-gatherer shall scan an image of the valid voter identification and immediately upload the image to the website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b)(v): the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b)(v)(A): shall enter the individual's address; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(b)(v)(B): may, at the discretion of the individual, enter the individual's date of birth or age after the individual clicks on the screen acknowledging that they have read and understand the following statement, "Birth date or age information is not required, but may be used to verify your identity with voter registration records. If you choose not to provide it, your signature may not be verified as a valid signature if you change your address before your signature is verified or if the information you provide does not match your voter registration records."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(c): after completing the process described in Subsection (6)(a) or (b), the screen shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(c)(i): except for a petition to qualify a candidate for the ballot, give the individual signing the petition the opportunity to enter the individual's email address after the individual reads the following statement, "If you provide your email address, you may receive an email with additional information relating to the petition you are signing."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(c)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(c)(ii)(A): if the website determines, under Subsection (6)(a)(iv), that the individual is eligible to sign the petition, permit the individual to enter the individual's name as the individual's electronic signature and, immediately after the signature-gather timely complies with Subsection (10), certify the signature; or
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(6)(c)(ii)(B): if the individual provides valid voter identification under Subsection (6)(b), permit the individual to enter the individual's name as the individual's electronic signature.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(7): If an individual provides valid voter identification under Subsection (6)(b), the county clerk shall, within seven days after the day on which the individual submits the valid voter identification, certify the signature if:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(7)(a): the individual is eligible to sign the petition;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(7)(b): the identification provided matches the information on file; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(7)(c): the signature-gatherer timely complies with Subsection (10).
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(8): For each signature submitted under this section, the website shall record:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(8)(a): the information identifying the individual who signs;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(8)(b): the date the signature was collected; and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(8)(c): the name of the signature-gatherer.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(9): An individual who is a signature-gatherer may not sign a petition unless another individual acts as the signature-gatherer when the individual signs the petition.
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(10): Except for a petition for a candidate to seek the nomination of a registered political party, each individual who gathers a signature under this section shall, within one business day after the day on which the individual gathers a signature, electronically sign and submit the following statement to the website:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(11): 20A-7-217; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-616; 20A-7-217; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-616 Except for a petition for a candidate to seek the nomination of a registered political party:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(11)(a): the county clerk may not certify a signature that is not timely verified in accordance with Subsection (10); and
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(11)(b): 20A-7-217; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-616; 20A-7-217; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-616 if a signature certified by a county clerk under Subsection (6)(c)(ii)(A) is not timely verified in accordance with Subsection (10), the county clerk shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(11)(b)(i): revoke the certification;
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(11)(b)(ii): 20A-7-217; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-616 remove the signature from the posting described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(11)(b)(iii): 20A-7-217; 20A-7-315; 20A-7-516; 20A-7-616 update the totals described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(12): For a petition for a candidate to seek the nomination of a registered political party, each individual who gathers a signature under this section shall, within one business day after the day on which the individual gathers a signature, electronically sign and submit the following statement to the lieutenant governor in the manner specified by the lieutenant governor:
Utah Code Annotated § 20A-21-201(13): For a petition for a candidate to seek the nomination of a registered political party, the election officer may not certify a signature that is not timely verified in accordance with Subsection (12).
